rows.Title: Lag and low fps in playing game
rows.Problem: Low fps in game and lags while using keyboard
rows.Summarized Problem: Game experiences low frame rate and lag during gameplay and keyboard use.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction during game usage, but does not cause device freeze or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: This is a system limitation due to high device temperature; user should allow device to cool down and provide logs and video if issue persists.

rows.Title: Device overheating
rows.Problem: My device always gets hot when I'm using any application
rows.Summarized Problem: The device overheats when running applications.
rows.Severity Reason: The device overheats during usage, which can lead to performance degradation or damage.
rows.R&D Comment: After adding graphite area, the thermal performance of the machine has been optimized, please check TR.

rows.Title: Audio crackling issue
rows.Problem: Audio crackling or distortion occurs when using headphones on Galaxy Tab A9 in DRM-based educational apps like Marrow, Prepladder, Cerebellum. Works fine on speakers and non-DRM apps like YouTube. Issue persists after factory reset, cache wipe, and latest update. Samsung support attributes it to third-party apps, but it affects multiple apps.
rows.Summarized Problem: Headphones cause audio crackling and distortion in DRM-based educational apps on Galaxy Tab A9, despite working on speakers and non-DRM apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue occurs during core device functionality (audio playback) in multiple educational apps, leading to a poor user experience and potential content inaccessibility.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: System audio routing fails randomly
rows.Problem: System audio routing fails randomly when apps try to play sound, even without an active call. WhatsApp sets device to ringtone mode during calls and fails to return to normal, preventing other apps from playing audio.
rows.Summarized Problem: System audio routing fails randomly due to WhatsApp failing to revert device mode after a call ends.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents apps from playing audio during normal usage, making the device unusable for basic functions like alarms and media playback.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: WhatsApp sets device to ringtone mode during calls and fails to revert it. Countermeasure: Recommend contacting WhatsApp app support or Play Store.

rows.Title: Camera Colour shift and pinkish tone in photos
rows.Problem: Photos have colour shift and pinkish tone; clearing camera app data improves dynamic range but does not resolve colour shift or pinkish tone.
rows.Summarized Problem: Photos exhibit colour shift and pinkish tone regardless of camera app data clearing.
rows.Severity Reason: Colour shift and pinkish tone in photos affect image quality and user experience, making photos untrustworthy and inconsistent.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Normal phenomenon; Countermeasure: Normal phenomenon

rows.Title: Unable to cut or edit song on photo editor
rows.Problem: Cannot edit or cut songs or voice backward in photo editor; only able to use full songs from third-party apps.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot cut or edit songs or voice clips backward in the photo editor, limiting flexibility in video editing.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot perform partial edits of audio, resulting in partial functionality but not full device unusability.
rows.R&D Comment: Studio is based on the video/photo as the main track; the audio is linked to the clip. Currently Studio does not support a separate audio track without a linked clip.

rows.Title: Google Chrome's top tab always getting blocked while opening for the first time
rows.Problem: Google Chrome's top tab always getting blocked while opening for the first time
rows.Summarized Problem: Google Chrome's top tab is blocked when opening for the first time.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of Chrome's initial tab loading, but does not render the app unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: unable to unfollow teams from sports from Google in Now bar
rows.Problem: The live notification bug exists after the Apr security update; users cannot unfollow teams, and the default setting is incorrect, with all teams initially followed and selection reversed.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot unfollow sports teams in the Now bar, and the default setting is reversed, making the feature unusable.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is essential for user control over notifications and is currently disabled, preventing core functionality.

rows.Title: Unable to edit SMSC number
rows.Problem: Unable to send SMS via mobile; unable to update SMSc number as the space is uneditable
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot edit the SMSC number in the Sim Card Manager settings, preventing SMS functionality.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot send SMS due to a critical inability to update the SMSC number, which is essential for basic communication functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: allowEditingSmscAddress=false; operator restriction. Countermeasure: Provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Samsung Messages Chat Features Missing
rows.Problem: Chat Features (RCS) no longer appear or register on SIM 1, despite working previously. The option vanishes and fails to register. It works on SIM 2 and via Google Messages on SIM 1. SIM 1 has no VoLTE option in settings, while SIM 2 does. Both SIMs are on VoLTE-supported networks. Tried clearing data, removing SIM 2, switching to mobile data, etc. No logs provided.
rows.Summarized Problem: RCS chat features are no longer available or registering on SIM 1 in Samsung Messages.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing on one SIM but works on another and via Google Messages, indicating partial malfunction rather than complete device failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Sound gets muted on any call
rows.Problem: When receiving a phone or WhatsApp call, sound gets muted. Alarms ring after device optimization, but WhatsApp calls do not ring. Incoming calls are shown on screen, but sound is muted. The issue persists after reset, notification setting changes, and restarts.
rows.Summarized Problem: Call audio is muted during incoming calls, preventing sound from playing despite visual indication of incoming calls.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from hearing incoming calls, making communication impossible during calls and leading to missed interactions.

rows.Title: battery draining
rows.Problem: I have been facing battery draining for quiet some time. I am hardly getting 4-5 hours of screen on time. This has been happening since one of the updates. There is no exceptional usage that I can find from the usage report. Please resolve.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device is experiencing significant battery drain, resulting in only 4-5 hours of screen on time despite normal app usage.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is unable to sustain basic usage for more than 4-5 hours, indicating a major performance issue with power consumption that affects usability.

rows.Title: Picture is blur in portrait mode
rows.Problem: Portrait mode image is incorrect and blurred, especially with thin subjects or repetitive backgrounds
rows.Summarized Problem: Portrait mode produces blurred images, particularly with thin subjects or repetitive backgrounds due to depthmap errors in feature matching between cameras.
rows.Severity Reason: The blur occurs in a specific use case (thin subjects or repetitive backgrounds), affecting image quality but not rendering the device unusable or causing crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Depthmap errors occur when feature matching between two cameras is difficult, especially with thin subjects or repetitive backgrounds; this issue is consistent and reproducible under those conditions.

rows.Title: sound quality get decreased including bass
rows.Problem: After april security patch update, sound quality has decreased including bass. The phone processor is capable of supporting newer features, yet Samsung has not properly implemented them.
rows.Summarized Problem: Sound quality, especially bass, has degraded after the April security patch update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects audio performance but does not cause device failure or crash, and is not fully resolved by software logs.
rows.R&D Comment: According to the log analysis by s/w team, there is no abnormal behavior. It seems to need to visit the service center and check if device is defective.

rows.Title: Unable to connect watch 7 lte to samsung galaxy s23
rows.Problem: Unable to connect watch 7 lte to samsung galaxy s23. Network is airtel. Watch and phone have been reset. ESIM activated. User ends up on attached screen.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot connect their watch 7 lte to samsung galaxy s23 despite resetting both devices and activating ESIM.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in device pairing, not full device failure or data loss, but prevents normal use of the wearable feature.
rows.R&D Comment: Insufficient defect info. Recommend user update latest version and retest; if issue persists, attach new logs.

rows.Title: Watch 7 lte 40mm sometimes got discharge instead of charging
rows.Problem: My watch 7 lte 40mm sometimes got discharge instead of charging
rows.Summarized Problem: The Galaxy Watch 7 LTE 40mm occasionally shows discharge instead of charging, indicating a malfunction in the charging function.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent battery drain but does not completely disable the device or lead to data loss, allowing partial functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue related to watchface rendering; hard to reproduce and fix; recommend checking latest watchface version and capturing logs if issue recurs.

rows.Title: Reminder setting in calendar gets automatically changed
rows.Problem: The reminder setting in Calendar gets changed on its own when set for event reminder more than 4 weeks before event
rows.Summarized Problem: Calendar reminders automatically change when set more than 4 weeks in advance.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of reminder functionality, but does not render the device unusable or result in data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by Google's logic, and the solution is to prevent input for reminders more than 4 weeks in advance in the OS version.

rows.Title: Ear buds connected but no media sound
rows.Problem: Bluetooth earbuds show as connected and button clicks are heard, but no media sound plays from apps like Facebook, Instagram, or YouTube. No error messages displayed.
rows.Summarized Problem: Bluetooth earbuds connect successfully but no media sound plays from apps such as Facebook, Instagram, or YouTube.
rows.Severity Reason: Media playback is completely absent across multiple apps, making the device unusable for audio consumption.

rows.Title: Unable to update Google Play Store
rows.Problem: I haven't received my Google Play system since 2024 help me out
rows.Summarized Problem: Users are unable to update the Google Play Store app, with authentication errors indicating the need to re-enter credentials.
rows.Severity Reason: The app fails to authenticate, preventing updates and potentially leading to loss of access to essential services.
rows.R&D Comment: Authentication error occurs due to missing or expired credentials; countermeasure suggests user re-entry of credentials to resolve auth token failure.

rows.Title: Lock Screen slow to lock
rows.Problem: Locking the screen is considerably slow whether using double tap or side button. Device stops video recording when locking.
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen takes a significant delay to lock when using either the double tap or side button.
rows.Severity Reason: The delay prevents immediate screen lock, causing video recording to stop unexpectedly, leading to data loss and user frustration.

rows.Title: Contacts stuck on Updating contacts
rows.Problem: Contacts are stuck on "Updating contacts" after updating to One UI 7, despite restarts, cache clearing, and sync toggling.
rows.Summarized Problem: Contacts remain stuck in 'Updating contacts' state after a system update due to prolonged database index rebuilding.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is unable to access contacts, which are a core functionality, leading to a major usability failure.

rows.Title: Wallpaper disappeared after Android 15 update
rows.Problem: Default wallpapers disappeared after updating to Android 15. User can only see a partial wallpaper now and needs guidance on how to fix it.
rows.Summarized Problem: Default wallpapers are missing after Android 15 update, user can only see partial wallpapers.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial UI malfunction where default wallpapers are not displayed correctly, but the device remains usable and core functions are intact.
rows.R&D Comment: In OneUI 7, the featured wallpaper library and editor UI changed; featured wallpapers are now only visible through variations in the editor path: Settings > Wallpaper and Styles > Change wallpapers > select first featured wallpaper > next > click Variations button to see all system wallpapers. Users must now navigate to the editor to view full featured wallpapers.

rows.Title: Fonts are so inconsistent throughout the entire phone
rows.Problem: The fonts are inconsistent throughout the entire phone, despite the new default Samsung fonts being introduced in One UI 6. The font used in settings differs from the font used in the battery percentage display.
rows.Summarized Problem: The font style is inconsistent across different parts of the device, such as settings and battery display.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual consistency but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Samsung is working with Google to allow Android to use one default font for the entire device unless otherwise designed by an application to use a different font.

rows.Title: Now Bar do not appear on lock screen
rows.Problem: Now Bar do not appear on lock screen
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Bar does not appear on the lock screen despite proper configuration of notifications.
rows.Severity Reason: The Now Bar feature is completely missing on the lock screen, which is a core functionality of the Samsung Smart Suggestions system, preventing users from accessing real-time suggestions.
rows.R&D Comment: The intent to create Now bar is not received during log duration; Now bar card creation requires user interaction that was not performed.

rows.Title: Dark Mode not applied properly in Keyboard
rows.Problem: Autocorrect popup is light colored with white text in Dark Mode; should be dark colored with white text
rows.Summarized Problem: The autocorrect popup in the Samsung keyboard appears with light background and white text in Dark Mode, when it should be dark-colored with white text.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects UI consistency in Dark Mode but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: This is a problem from org.thoughtcrime.securesm app side. App developer need to fix this issue.

rows.Title: Now bar isn't showing any live updates
rows.Problem: My now bar isn't showing any live updates other than music and alarm grouping isn't working
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Bar on the Lock Screen is not displaying live updates beyond music and alarm grouping.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects partial functionality of the Now Bar, impacting user experience but not rendering the device unusable or causing data loss.

rows.Title: Wallpaper changes from cinematic to portrait view after minimizing
rows.Problem: After minimizing the screen, the wallpaper takes a fraction of seconds to change from landscape to portrait view after playing videos or games in landscape mode.
rows.Summarized Problem: The wallpaper transitions from cinematic to portrait view after screen minimization, causing a brief visual disruption.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects user experience during app usage but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.

rows.Title: Front camera blinks when creating social media video
rows.Problem: Video blinking problem appears during Instagram video creation
rows.Summarized Problem: The front camera blinks during Instagram video creation.
rows.Severity Reason: The blinking occurs intermittently during video creation, affecting functionality but not causing device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: We have conducted approximately 100 shooting tests, but the phenomenon has not been reproduced. Please upload the reproduction path within the app and the reproduction environment.

rows.Title: Device is overheating after One UI 7 update
rows.Problem: My Samsung S24 Plus is overheating after the One UI 7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung S24 Plus is overheating after the One UI 7 update, especially during boot and app launching.
rows.Severity Reason: The device overheats significantly during boot and app usage, which could lead to performance degradation or thermal shutdowns, making it unusable under normal conditions.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: High CPU usage by third-party apps and boot process leads to elevated temperatures. Countermeasure: Same as cause; no change in thermal behavior expected.

rows.Title: charging speed slowed down
rows.Problem: My S24 charging speed slowed down after the January security update. The phone currently runs on One UI 7 with the April security update, but the issue persists. I use a proper 45W charger and do weekly restarts, but the problem remains. The phone charges at 16W, showing Super Fast Charging 2.0, which is significantly slower than expected.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device's charging speed has significantly slowed down after software updates, charging at only 16W despite being capable of Super Fast Charging 2.0.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is unable to achieve expected charging speed, resulting in prolonged charging times and reduced usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Input current limited by aicl; if external TA vbus voltage is abnormal, charger IC automatically drops input current. Please check TA or cable and use another one; if issue persists, visit service center for hardware check.

rows.Title: Call vibration not working
rows.Problem: No vibration when call connects or disconnects, persists after cache clearing and factory reset
rows.Summarized Problem: Call vibration is not working when a call connects or disconnects.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to provide basic call feedback, which is essential for user awareness and usability.

rows.Title: Call background not working
rows.Problem: Call background not working after UI 7 update, showing solid blue color instead of expected background
rows.Summarized Problem: Call background fails to display correctly after UI 7 update, showing a solid blue color instead of the intended background.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue results in a partial malfunction of the call interface, preventing proper visual context during calls, but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Show contact photo background when contact photo not saved; Countermeasure: Fix to show default background and provide user options to configure call background.

rows.Title: Loudness of unlock and lock sound decreases
rows.Problem: The loudness of unlock and lock sound in S24 OneUI 7 is very low compared to older versions. System sound is at full volume.
rows.Summarized Problem: The unlock and lock sound on the S24 Lock Screen is significantly quieter than in previous versions, despite system volume being at maximum.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects user experience but does not prevent device functionality or cause device failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Check the log, the system volume level was max, and it can not find the abnormal point, the lock and unlock tone was played too low to hear? please record the volume to let us know, I check the same software version, I do not reproduce the issue.

rows.Title: camera jitter when using 3X
rows.Problem: camera jitter when using 3X, not present before, fixed by switching to other frame rates
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera exhibits jitter when using 3X zoom, which was not present before and is resolved by switching to other frame rates.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects camera functionality under specific conditions but does not cause device freeze or crash, and is partially mitigated by user action.
rows.R&D Comment: It is estimated that the camera module is defective. However, the cause of the defect cannot be analyzed only with the attached data. Please visit the service center and guide them to replace the camera module.

rows.Title: Pointer size is huge and does not translate on tab
rows.Problem: Pointer size is huge and does not translate on tab. The pointer also looks pixelated.
rows.Summarized Problem: The pointer appears too large and does not translate properly when moving between tabs, and looks pixelated.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects pointer appearance and interaction but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The pointer size is configurable in Settings > General management > Mouse and trackpad > Pointer size and color > Pointer size; users can adjust it to desired size.

rows.Title: Device hangs
rows.Problem: Samsung A15 5G hangs even with 256GB ROM and 8GB RAM, despite only 75GB used. User has tried suggested activities but issue persists.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device hangs during normal usage despite sufficient storage and memory.
rows.Severity Reason: The device hangs, making it unusable, indicating a critical system-level performance failure.

rows.Title: Network stuck on 2g
rows.Problem: Network automatically stuck on 2g. After restart, works for 1 to 2 days then repeats. Device shows 5g/4g but no internet, VOLTE turns off. Occurs 2-3 times daily.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device repeatedly gets stuck on 2G network despite showing 5G/4G signals, resulting in no internet and VOLTE turning off.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to establish proper network connectivity, leading to complete loss of internet and voice services, making the device unusable for communication.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Contact vanishes after click and opens wrong call menu
rows.Problem: When you click on a contact after searching it vanishes and goes to the top, opens the call menu of the contact below it, and when you call that contact it calls the original contact only.
rows.Summarized Problem: After clicking a contact during search, it vanishes and displays the call menu of the next contact, causing incorrect call routing.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue results in incorrect call behavior, affecting functionality but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.

rows.Title: Weather widget not updating periodically
rows.Problem: Weather widget added via LockStar is not updating periodically and appears in the notification panel after restart
rows.Summarized Problem: The weather widget added via LockStar does not update periodically and appears in the notification panel after device restart.
rows.Severity Reason: The widget fails to update periodically, causing inconsistency in information, but does not render the device unusable or cause crashes.

rows.Title: Status bar icons got duplicated
rows.Problem: While receiving a call, the status bar icons got duplicated - both on the call screen and the homescreen.
rows.Summarized Problem: Status bar icons duplicate during phone calls on both call screen and home screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual display during calls but does not cause device crash or data loss, and does not prevent core functionality.

rows.Title: WiFi Not connecting
rows.Problem: System attempts to connect to available home WiFi but fails after multiple attempts over one minute. Support staff provided irrelevant information instead of verifying the issue. This issue emerged after a recent software update.
rows.Summarized Problem: WiFi fails to connect after multiple failed attempts, despite being available, and the issue started after a recent software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to establish a basic network connection, preventing normal operation and user access to the internet.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: DHCP fails to assign IP address; Counter Measure: Provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: delay when customizing lock screen settings
rows.Problem: delay occurs when turning off the phone and the screen turns off after a 1 second delay; same issue occurs when using multi window, where minimized windows close after a delay
rows.Summarized Problem: A delay occurs when turning off the phone and closing windows during lock screen customization.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a noticeable delay in screen shutdown and window closure, affecting usability but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.

rows.Title: Device getting Heatup even in normal use
rows.Problem: Galaxy M33 5G feels hot during normal use after latest security patch and app updates, despite having only basic apps installed, factory reset, and Google Play System updated.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device overheats during normal use even with minimal app usage and after factory reset.
rows.Severity Reason: Device overheating during normal use can lead to performance degradation or safety risks, making it unusable under typical conditions.
rows.R&D Comment: Overheating caused by frequent package launches, fast charging, weak signal, 5G network, and hotspot usage; countermeasure matches cause.

rows.Title: Screen freezes
rows.Problem: Screen freezes and requires force restart
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen freezes and requires a force restart to recover.
rows.Severity Reason: The screen freezing causes device unresponsiveness and requires force restart, making the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: GPU errors are occurring continuously, highly suspected as a hardware defect; recommend customer hardware inspection.

rows.Title: Delay in screen off while locking the phone
rows.Problem: Delay in screen off while locking the phone. When I press lock button or double tap for lock, it takes some time to get screen off. It is not getting screen off instantly. This happens every time after the UI7 update. The lock screen animation on OneUI7 takes a second to lock the screen when the phone is in FHD+. Once I switch it to QHD, the problem no longer persists. This issue happens every time I lock my screen.
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen takes a significant delay to turn off when locking the phone, especially on FHD+ resolution, and this delay persists after the UI7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a noticeable delay in screen off functionality, affecting user experience but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.

rows.Title: Display blinking when open apps
rows.Problem: Display blinks whenever an application is opened
rows.Summarized Problem: The display blinks when applications are opened.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects user experience during app launch but does not cause device failure or data loss.

rows.Title: Frame skips in app opening animations
rows.Problem: Frame skips in app opening animations for all apps after April 2025 update. Also occasional UI lag. Issue persists after Good Lock tweaks.
rows.Summarized Problem: App opening animations experience frame skips and occasional UI lag after the April 2025 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes noticeable UI lag but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The exact root cause is not clear from logs; if the issue persists, a new issue with logs and video should be raised.

rows.Title: Bluetooth audio not audible during media playback
rows.Problem: Bluetooth audio not audible during media playback
rows.Summarized Problem: Bluetooth audio is not audible when playing media, but works during calls.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects media playback functionality but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.

rows.Title: Error on opening Home Up from Good Lock
rows.Problem: Get error when opening Home Up from Good Lock
rows.Summarized Problem: Users encounter an error when attempting to open Home Up from a Good Lock screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The error prevents successful access to a feature but does not cause device crash or complete failure of core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: We are preparing the Home Up for Fold and Tablet of OneUI 7.0. We will let you download the Good Lock homeup soon.

rows.Title: Eye comfort shield not working
rows.Problem: Eye comfort shield works only in maintenance mode and not in normal use. Turning it on or off requires a phone restart to take effect.
rows.Summarized Problem: The eye comfort shield feature does not function during normal use and only works in maintenance mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to operate under normal usage conditions, preventing users from benefiting from its intended function, but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: V OS Ver 15 is already planned for this model. As discussed, kindly help share behavior on V OS. If reproduced pls report PLM accordingly

rows.Title: Serious software issue detected pop up occur after updating google play system
rows.Problem: Sometimes this appears since 1st of April
rows.Summarized Problem: A serious software issue pop-up appears after updating Google Play system, intermittently since April 1st.
rows.Severity Reason: The pop-up appears after a system update and may disrupt device usability, indicating a critical system-level issue.
rows.R&D Comment: V OS Ver 15 is already planned for this model. As discussed, kindly help share behavior on V OS. If reproduced, pls report PLM accordingly

rows.Title: Bixby not taking voice commands
rows.Problem: Bixby responds to 'turn off' with 'Shall I turn it off?' and then behaves abnormally when given responses like 'wait', 'oh no', or 'hello', triggering incorrect messages or unintended actions such as taking a screenshot.
rows.Summarized Problem: Bixby fails to properly process voice commands and responds abnormally to common user inputs, leading to incorrect or unintended behavior.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction in voice command processing but does not result in device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: V OS Ver 15 is already planned for this model. As discussed, kindly help share behavior on V OS. If reproduced, pls report PLM accordingly

rows.Title: Icons in a folder displayed as grayed out
rows.Problem: Icons in a folder are displayed as grayed out when moving out of a work mode that disables these apps
rows.Summarized Problem: Icons in folders appear grayed out when exiting a work mode that disables apps
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects app visibility in a work mode but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes or data loss
rows.R&D Comment: V OS Ver 15 is already planned for this model. As discussed, kindly help share behavior on V OS. If reproduced, pls report PLM accordingly

rows.Title: Device getting overheated
rows.Problem: Device always overheats, and user struggles to use the device for 10 days despite software updates, resets, and restores. User claims it is normal heating, which is unacceptable.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device consistently overheats despite software updates and resets, and the user considers this unacceptable.
rows.Severity Reason: The device overheats consistently, making it unusable for extended periods, and user claims it is normal, which contradicts device safety and usability standards.
rows.R&D Comment: Heating caused by continuous video calls via WhatsApp and device in multiwindow mode; thermal management system is working fine.

rows.Title: Color by Keyword function is not working
rows.Problem: The keyword is not getting colored
rows.Summarized Problem: The color by keyword function in the Samsung keyboard is not working, causing keywords to remain uncolored.
rows.Severity Reason: The function is missing, preventing keyword highlighting, but the device remains usable.

rows.Title: Server error is frequent
rows.Problem: Server error is frequent and annoying. Everything done. Data cleared, cache reset. Running one ui 7.0 final version
rows.Summarized Problem: Frequent server errors occur, causing data loss and requiring users to clear cache and reset data.
rows.Severity Reason: The errors cause data loss and disrupt core functionality, making the device unusable for critical operations.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is likely due to app-based server problems; background operation is not blocked immediately, and users can adjust via settings.

rows.Title: Bluetooth icon missing in status bar
rows.Problem: Bluetooth icon is missing in status bar
rows.Summarized Problem: The Bluetooth icon is missing from the status bar.
rows.Severity Reason: This is a cosmetic UI issue that does not affect device functionality or usability.

rows.Title: Call transcript feature not showing
rows.Problem: Call transcript feature not showing
rows.Summarized Problem: The call transcript feature is not displaying on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The call transcript feature is not showing, which prevents users from accessing call history or transcripts during or after calls.
rows.R&D Comment: The call recording feature is not supported on the device, which is a prerequisite for the call transcript functionality.

rows.Title: Camera picture quality has lots of grains
rows.Problem: Camera images have lots of grains and lower quality compared to previous versions, with faster processing time
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera images have excessive graininess and poor quality due to low image optimization settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of image quality, not rendering the device unusable or causing data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The Quality optimization option is set to "Minimum" in Intelligent optimization menu of camera option. It may cause the image quality degradation. Please change this option to "Maximum" and try to capture again.

rows.Title: Drop in battery performance related to AOD feature
rows.Problem: AOD feature now consumes significantly more battery, increasing from 0.7% to 4%, which is a major concern for users relying on this feature daily
rows.Summarized Problem: The Always On Display feature now consumes significantly more battery, increasing from 0.7% to 4%.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery consumption increase is substantial and directly impacts device usability for users who rely on the AOD feature throughout the day.

rows.Title: Device is hanging
rows.Problem: After updating to One UI 7, phone hangs frequently. Apps do not open. System UI and apps are unresponsive. Cannot open members app. Gallery app crashes when adding photos. Device stops working and requires restart.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device frequently hangs and becomes unresponsive after updating to One UI 7, preventing app launches and causing crashes in specific apps like Gallery.
rows.Severity Reason: The device hangs and stops responding, making it unusable for basic functions like opening apps and sharing content, which constitutes a major system failure.

rows.Title: Device getting heated
rows.Problem: Device getting heated after recent updates, especially during video calls using WhatsApp, which has high CPU consumption.
rows.Summarized Problem: Device heats up significantly during WhatsApp video calls due to high CPU consumption from the camera service.
rows.Severity Reason: Heating during active use makes the device unusable and poses a risk of damage or battery degradation.
rows.R&D Comment: Heating caused by WhatsApp video calls using the camera service; recommend optimizing camera service CPU usage and updating WhatsApp to reduce load.

rows.Title: app tray lags
rows.Problem: tapping a folder in the app tray lags slightly before opening when using vertical setup
rows.Summarized Problem: Tapping a folder in the app tray causes a noticeable lag before it opens.
rows.Severity Reason: The lag occurs during a fundamental interaction but does not prevent full functionality or cause device instability.
rows.R&D Comment: The lag is caused by the timing between touch up and folder opening; animation delay is due to screen size, and further clarification is needed for other potential lag points.

rows.Title: Home UI Crash
rows.Problem: After UI 7 update, can open any app only once, then home UI starts crashing
rows.Summarized Problem: Home UI crashes after opening an app once following the UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The home UI crashes after app opening, making the device unusable after the first app launch.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue will be fixed in Homescreen version 16.0.09.13 or above.

rows.Title: Sluggish in notes app
rows.Problem: Notes app becomes sluggish after a new app is installed
rows.Summarized Problem: The notes app becomes sluggish after a new app is installed.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of the app performance after app installation, affecting usability but not rendering the device unusable.

rows.Title: Unable to image search in photos
rows.Problem: Only one face is detected among 30-50 faces in gallery; only one photo shown for plant search; no results for fruit search despite multiple fruit photos
rows.Summarized Problem: Image search in photos fails to detect multiple faces or return accurate results for fruits and plants.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature partially malfunctions, failing to detect multiple faces or return correct search results, but does not cause device crash or complete failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Image analysis Service operates as a background service and only works when the device is idle with the screen off and (nearly) fully charged. The analysis process requires a considerable amount of time. Please check whether your device has been maintained in a fully charged state for at least a week. Additionally, we suggest temporarily turning off "Battery Protection" while verifying if the analysis is in progress, as there may be other underlying issues.

rows.Title: Wellbeing widget not updating
rows.Problem: Wellbeing home screen widget not updating actual time; shows last state until user navigates in and out; issue occurs after UI 7 update; previously updated correctly
rows.Summarized Problem: The wellbeing home screen widget fails to update in real time and displays the last known state until the user navigates away and back.
rows.Severity Reason: The widget fails to refresh in real time, causing users to see outdated information, which is a partial malfunction affecting usability.

rows.Title: Glitch in charging message
rows.Problem: Charging message is not displayed properly; shows "Charging will start at 9:59" instead of "Charging will complete/finish at 9:59"
rows.Summarized Problem: The charging message displays an incorrect message stating 'Charging will start at 9:59' instead of 'Charging will complete/finish at 9:59'.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of the message content, not affecting device usability or core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: If the "Adaptive" battery protection is on, charging stops at 80% during sleep and resumes an hour before waking; the message is normal and no change is needed.

rows.Title: Sluggishness in top-right dropdown settings
rows.Problem: The "Play Last Song" button in the top-right dropdown settings flickers and exhibits erratic behavior, suggesting a software bug. This issue occurs after the One UI 7.0 update and results in an unsmooth user experience.
rows.Summarized Problem: The 'Play Last Song' button in the top-right dropdown settings flickers and behaves erratically, causing an unsmooth user experience.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes erratic button behavior but does not prevent device operation or cause system crashes or data loss.

rows.Title: Fastcharging not working
rows.Problem: Fastcharging not working sometimes
rows.Summarized Problem: Fastcharging intermittently fails without clear timing or logs.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves intermittent malfunction of a core battery function without consistent reproduction or logs, preventing reliable usage.
rows.R&D Comment: Fastcharging not working sometimes issue => couldn't find when the problem happened. When you meet the problem, please get the log right away.

rows.Title: Cannot play multi player game
rows.Problem: I can't play multi-player games but can login and also can play other online games, when I play multi-player modes my ping goes high, I tried all steps but still it's useless
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot play multiplayer games due to high ping caused by weak network signal.
rows.Severity Reason: High ping during multiplayer gameplay leads to poor performance and renders the game unplayable, affecting core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Weak signal strength (RSRP 110 under) in network environment. Counter Measure: Recommend user to connect with strong network.

rows.Title: Samsung Store app terms acceptance issue
rows.Problem: Samsung Store app repeatedly asks for terms and conditions acceptance every time it is opened, instead of showing it only on first open or after app update.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung Store app repeatedly prompts users to accept terms and conditions upon every opening, rather than doing so only on first launch or after an update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes repeated UI prompts but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes or data loss; it is a partial malfunction affecting user experience.
rows.R&D Comment: User did not click continue after accepting terms; pop-up appears until continue is clicked. The continue button is clicked only once, as expected. If the pop-up reappears after acceptance, the issue should be re-raised for further analysis.

rows.Title: Note application gets auto restart while using
rows.Problem: Screen freeze in note app and system auto discards recording, user cannot see recording. Issue persists since device purchase.
rows.Summarized Problem: The note app freezes and automatically discards recordings, making it impossible for users to save or view their recordings.
rows.Severity Reason: The app completely fails to record notes, rendering a core functionality unusable and preventing users from taking notes effectively.
rows.R&D Comment: The attached log does not include the time when the problem occurred, so we cannot determine the cause. If the problem is reproduced, please attach the video and app operation log at that time.

rows.Title: Key cafe theme not working with keyboard
rows.Problem: Key cafe theme not working with keyboard
rows.Summarized Problem: The Key Cafe theme does not function properly when used with the keyboard.
rows.Severity Reason: The theme fails to work with keyboard input, resulting in partial functionality but not complete device unusability.

rows.Title: Animator Scale 0 causes color tone not to work in Camera Pro/ProVideo
rows.Problem: When Animator Scale is set to 0, color tone does not work in Camera Pro or ProVideo. When animator scale is above 0, color tone works and screen recording sends.
rows.Summarized Problem: Color tone fails to work in Camera Pro and ProVideo when Animator Scale is set to 0.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to work under specific conditions but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.

rows.Title: Edge panel immersive mode isn't working
rows.Problem: Edge panel immersive mode isn't working. Can't use edge panel in full screen mode of all the apps. Kindly fix it.
rows.Summarized Problem: The edge panel immersive mode does not work in full screen mode across all apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing in full screen mode, preventing consistent app usage but does not cause device crash or data loss.

rows.Title: System UI constantly accesses device location
rows.Problem: System UI constantly accesses device location leading to excessive battery drain
rows.Summarized Problem: The System UI repeatedly accesses device location, causing excessive battery drain.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes significant battery drain, making the device unusable for extended use.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Quick panel control splashes while scroll down
rows.Problem: The quick panel control splashes for a moment before the smooth animation begins when swiping down after unlocking the phone
rows.Summarized Problem: The quick panel control splashes briefly before the animation starts when swiping down after unlocking the phone.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue is a cosmetic animation glitch that does not affect device usability or functionality.

rows.Title: Camera consistently going to unresponsive state
rows.Problem: Camera is not working and consistently going to unresponsive state
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera consistently becomes unresponsive and fails to function properly.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera is completely unresponsive, rendering a core device function inoperable.
rows.R&D Comment: There is some Rear Tele(x5.0) camera HW error in the attached log. Please visit to CS center and request to check the Rear Tele(x5.0) camera module or related HW.

rows.Title: Sticker showing on Quick Panel while swipe down
rows.Problem: Swipe down notification screen is showing stickers that were created and kept on lockscreen
rows.Summarized Problem: Stickers created on the lock screen are displayed in the quick panel when swiping down.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction where stickers appear in the wrong context, affecting user experience but not causing device failure or data loss.

rows.Title: Portrait photos taken at 2x zoom with studio effect turn into green screen after processing
rows.Problem: Portrait photos taken at 2x zoom with studio effect turn into green screen after processing. This happened three times. After taking a normal photo in normal mode, portrait captures appear fine.
rows.Summarized Problem: Portrait photos taken at 2x zoom with studio effect result in green screen after processing.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes complete failure of a core camera feature under specific conditions, resulting in unusable output.
rows.R&D Comment: When studio effect failed, input image was incorrectly copied due to a bug; this has been fixed and will be released in a new update.

rows.Title: Samsung app not working
rows.Problem: Samsung app not working even after reinstalling
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung app fails to function even after being reinstalled.
rows.Severity Reason: The app does not work after reinstall, indicating a partial malfunction that affects usability but does not render the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: It's hard to understand because the content of the problem is ambiguous. Please explain it in more detail to understand, and include possible videos or capture screens. And please explain in detail which app didn't work.

rows.Title: Contact app issue
rows.Problem: When I click on one contact, it automatically shifts to another contact
rows.Summarized Problem: Clicking on a contact automatically shifts to another contact in the app.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes incorrect contact selection, leading to a partial malfunction in the contact functionality.

rows.Title: Charging speed is slow
rows.Problem: Charging speed is slow compared to one ui6. Everything was fine before the update. All troubleshooting for charger and cable has been done, and they are original and working on another Samsung device. Turning off everything speeds up charging, which suggests the issue is related to device-level charging behavior.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device charges slowly compared to a reference device, with no improvement when devices are powered off, indicating a performance issue in charging behavior.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in charging speed, which is not fully disabling device use but affects user experience significantly.
rows.R&D Comment: Input current limited by AICL; if external TA voltage is abnormal, charger IC drops input current. Please check TA or cable; if issue persists, visit service center for hardware check.

rows.Title: Videos not fully playing in Gallery App
rows.Problem: Some videos do not fully play when opening in the Gallery app
rows.Summarized Problem: Some videos fail to play fully in the Gallery app, ending abruptly during playback.
rows.Severity Reason: Playback stops prematurely, preventing full video viewing, but the issue does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The video reaches EOS in playback and is handled as such; recommend testing on other devices or attaching the video file for deeper analysis.

rows.Title: screen mirror and mode icon overlap in quick access panel
rows.Problem: screen mirror and mode icons are merging in the quick access panel
rows.Summarized Problem: Icons for screen mirror and mode are overlapping in the quick access panel.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of UI elements, causing visual overlap but not preventing device operation.
rows.R&D Comment: There was a timing issue of drawing a view. I added a code that matches the entire context sync.

rows.Title: Recent button doesn't work oftenly
rows.Problem: Recent button doesn't seem to work oftenly, i have to restart it to work so fix this bugg
rows.Summarized Problem: The recent button frequently fails to function and requires a restart to work.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of the feature but does not render the device unusable or lead to data loss.

rows.Title: Not showing animations on homescreen
rows.Problem: S23 is not showing animations on homescreen when opening or closing apps
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung S23 launcher is not displaying animations when apps are opened or closed.
rows.Severity Reason: Animations are missing during app transitions, affecting user experience but not causing device malfunction or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: V OS Ver 15 is already planned for this model. As discussed, kindly help share behavior on V OS. If reproduced, pls report PLM accordingly

rows.Title: One UI home keeps stopping
rows.Problem: UI one home keeps stopping
rows.Summarized Problem: The One UI home screen keeps stopping unexpectedly.
rows.Severity Reason: The home screen repeatedly stops, making the device unusable and disrupting core navigation functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: The analysis from provided logs is not sufficient. Also, as no release is planned for OS 14 and the issue is not occurring in the latest OS 15 launcher apk, please help to update to latest OS.

rows.Title: Delay in opening quick panel and WiFi panel space mismatch
rows.Problem: Space mismatch occurs when opening the WiFi panel after a delay; first click shows misalignment, second click fixes it but issue persists; alignment should be consistent as per design
rows.Summarized Problem: The WiFi panel in the quick panel shows misaligned spacing on first click, which persists despite fixing on second click, causing inconsistent UI alignment.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects UI consistency but does not prevent device operation or cause functional failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The fix has been identified and will be included in the next OS release.

rows.Title: Battery percentage icon showing while device not on charging
rows.Problem: Battery percentage icon showing while device not on charging
rows.Summarized Problem: The battery percentage icon displays on the device even when it is not charging.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of the battery display, where the icon shows incorrectly under specific conditions but does not cause device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The battery percentage value is shown based on the 'Show battery percentage' setting in settings, not charging status. Please provide detailed reproduction steps and video logs for clarification.

rows.Title: Device's processor hits 40+ on using Whatsapp, Instagram
rows.Problem: I have kept most of the apps in my phone are in deepsleep.... pls do optimize the os
rows.Summarized Problem: Device processor temperature rises to 40+ degrees when using WhatsApp and Instagram.
rows.Severity Reason: High temperature during app usage indicates potential device instability or overheating, which can lead to performance degradation or hardware damage.
rows.R&D Comment: As per logs, it seems a temporary issue of slowness in app. Please clear cache of app and update from Playstore. Issue is not reproducing at our end. So, please retest.

rows.Title: Battery backup reduced and phone heating up unexpectedly
rows.Problem: Battery backup reduced after One UI 7 upgrade, with last 5% draining in 5 minutes. Phone heats up unexpectedly even without intensive use. Issue persists despite app optimization and restart. Notification panel shows quick apps button from lock screen.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone experiences significant battery drain and unexpected overheating even during light usage after upgrading to One UI 7.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is experiencing rapid battery drain and overheating, which directly impact usability and device performance under normal conditions.

rows.Title: Sim Call Disconnection and Slot Misidentification
rows.Problem: When making a call with a physical SIM, the phone disconnects immediately and shows "Mobile network unavailable", while mobile data over the same SIM works fine.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device disconnects during SIM-based voice calls while mobile data over the same SIM remains functional.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to establish a voice call connection, rendering a core communication function unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: In provided logs, a 5-minute call from SIM2 is recorded; reproduction occurs at 2PM but logs are collected at 13:54, indicating a timing mismatch. Recommend re-recording the event before reporting.

rows.Title: Talk back action button not working
rows.Problem: Talk back action button is not working properly when double tapped; action visible but no action performed
rows.Summarized Problem: The Talk Back action button does not perform any action when double-tapped, despite showing a visual indication.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially malfunctioning but does not cause device unavailability or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: TalkBack functionality is scheduled for upgrade to One UI 7.0. Countermeasure: Users should transition to the new TalkBack version with One UI 7.0.

rows.Title: Voice cracks during calls
rows.Problem: Voice crackling sound during calls
rows.Summarized Problem: Users experience voice crackling during calls, with continuous speech and high noise patterns detected on both transmit and receive sides.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes noticeable audio degradation during calls, leading to poor call quality and potential user frustration, especially in real-time communication.
rows.R&D Comment: Suspect Rx side issue due to far end user's speech; confirm issue point using voice call recordings to verify noise patterns on both transmit and receive.

rows.Title: Auto-recording calls
rows.Problem: Calls are auto-recording in the Samsung dialer app even when set to not record calls from specific numbers
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung dialer app auto-records calls even when users have set it to exclude specific contacts.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is malfunctioning and recording calls despite user settings, leading to unintended data capture and potential privacy violations.
rows.R&D Comment: From TelephonyUI logs, the auto-record setting is enabled and set to record all calls except specific numbers, but the excluded numbers are not listed due to privacy issues. Provide CP silent logs for further investigation.

rows.Title: Alphabets not visible on the keyboard
rows.Problem: Two alphabets A and S are invisible on the keyboard, and when tapped, they appear in the top left corner. The issue persists after updates.
rows.Summarized Problem: Alphabets A and S are invisible on the keyboard and appear only when tapped, causing usability issues.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects key visibility and user interaction but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.

rows.Title: My contacts and phone app not opening
rows.Problem: My contacts and phone app not opening. Crashing again and again I open.
rows.Summarized Problem: The contacts and phone apps are failing to open and crash repeatedly after updating to Office One UI 7.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes repeatedly upon opening, making it unusable and preventing core functionality from being accessed.
rows.R&D Comment: The system is stuck in an 'Updating contacts' state due to a prolonged database index rebuild, causing the app to fail to launch.

rows.Title: Unstable network issue
rows.Problem: Network switches to 4G more than 10 times on Samsung S24 Ultra with One UI 7 and Android 15, despite device being able to connect to 5G on other devices. Issue recurs after flight mode and power saving mode adjustments. Device remains in LTE service after repeated failures and does not attempt to re-register to 5G.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device frequently switches from 5G to 4G and fails to re-register to 5G after network errors, staying in LTE service.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to maintain 5G connectivity and remains in a non-functional LTE state, leading to unreliable network access and potential service loss.
rows.R&D Comment: No resource due to TRM failure and RLFs cause UE to drop 5G service; device fails to re-register to 5G and stays in LTE. Requires CP logs for accurate diagnosis.

rows.Title: Issue in playing video on 4KHDR on YT, Netflix and Samsung Native App
rows.Problem: A53 struggles to play 4KHDR video on YouTube, Netflix, and Samsung Native App despite A52 and earlier models being capable. The device's Exynos 1280 chipset lacks hardware support for VP9 and AV1, and software codecs cannot play 4KHDR video, making performance inadequate for modern content.
rows.Summarized Problem: The A53 device cannot play 4KHDR videos on YouTube, Netflix, or Samsung Native App due to hardware codec limitations of the Exynos 1280 chipset.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to play 4KHDR content, which is a core media functionality, resulting in a significant user experience failure and performance deficit compared to lower-priced models.
rows.R&D Comment: Hardware codec limitations of Exynos 1280 do not support VP9 and AV1; software codecs cannot play 4KHDR video.

rows.Title: Notification panel not updated
rows.Problem: Notification panel remains solid and not transparent on S24 Ultra after OneUI 7 update, even when set to 0% transparency. Preview shows blur but actual panel becomes solid after applying Quickstar settings.
rows.Summarized Problem: The notification panel on the S24 Ultra displays as a solid color instead of transparent, even when set to 0% transparency.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual appearance but does not prevent device operation or cause functional failure.

rows.Title: Charging issues
rows.Problem: Here are the screenshot of the my problem as i told you before
rows.Summarized Problem: Users experience charging issues that may be caused by faulty charging cable or TA, leading to potential device charging port malfunction.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of charging function, requiring user intervention but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: When AICL is detected by the charger IC, it can indicate an issue with either the charging cable or TA; guide the customer to change their cable and TA, and if the issue persists, refer them to a service center for detailed inspection of the charging port.

rows.Title: Display color issue when opening black image
rows.Problem: A yellowish or grayish color appears instead of black when viewing a black image on the display.
rows.Summarized Problem: A yellowish or grayish discoloration appears instead of black when viewing a black image on the display.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects image display accuracy but does not cause device crash or data loss, and only occurs under specific conditions.
rows.R&D Comment: It is difficult to confirm the exact phenomenon due to insufficient information. Please visit the service center to get a diagnosis.

rows.Title: Device becomes unresponsive while sharing
rows.Problem: Unable to send photos or videos; device becomes unresponsive during rare sharing events
rows.Summarized Problem: Device becomes unresponsive when attempting to share photos or videos.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unresponsive during sharing, which renders core functionality unusable and may cause data loss or user frustration.

rows.Title: Camera distorts in low light
rows.Problem: Camera distorts in low light, especially with 50mp and 12mp sensors
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera distorts in low light conditions, particularly with the 50mp and 12mp sensors.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects image quality in low light but does not cause device crash or complete failure, only partial malfunction in specific conditions.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Low light distortion due to sensor limitations; Countermeasure: Normal phenomenon (accepted as design behavior)

rows.Title: Power off using side key
rows.Problem: Power off using side key takes longer than before and is increasingly frustrating
rows.Summarized Problem: Power off using side key is slow and increasingly frustrating
rows.Severity Reason: The function is not working reliably and takes longer than expected, causing user irritation but does not render the device unusable or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue was not reproducible in the latest binary; users are advised to verify in the latest version.

rows.Title: Back gesture indicator icon loses part after being pulled
rows.Problem: The back gesture indicator icon loses some part after being pulled
rows.Summarized Problem: The back gesture indicator icon loses part of its appearance when being pulled.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects only visual appearance and does not impact device functionality or usability.

rows.Title: Home UI crashing while opening Google widget
rows.Problem: Home UI crashes every time the Google song search widget is selected
rows.Summarized Problem: The home UI crashes when the Google song search widget is selected.
rows.Severity Reason: The UI crashes every time the widget is selected, making the home screen unusable.

rows.Title: Flickering issue while using camera
rows.Problem: Flickering issue after updating new software
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera display flickers after a software update, making it difficult to capture clear photos.
rows.Severity Reason: The flickering prevents proper image capture and affects core camera functionality, rendering the device unusable for photography.
rows.R&D Comment: Damage to the AF drive unit due to impacts or vibrations causes focusing issues; recommend service center inspection.

rows.Title: Network issue, unable to change Silent log setting
rows.Problem: Unable to change Silent log setting to send required CP logs, despite multiple attempts including contacting customer care via IVR.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot change the Silent log setting in the Mobile Networks settings to send required CP logs.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a setting, preventing log collection but not causing device crash or total unavailability.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: network issue
rows.Problem: shared speedtest result shows 8 mbps on device but 250 mbps on another device with same simcard
rows.Summarized Problem: Device shows significantly lower network speed than expected when using the same SIM card as another device.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves inconsistent network performance across devices with identical SIM cards, indicating a potential device-specific compatibility or configuration problem, but does not result in device unusability or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Weak signal strength and no internet connectivity
rows.Problem: Connectivity issues after latest software update on Galaxy S22 Ultra; signal strength is extremely weak and no internet connectivity, despite working on same Airtel network with other devices. Phone restarts and airplane mode toggling have been tried without resolution.
rows.Summarized Problem: Galaxy S22 Ultra experiences no internet connectivity and extremely weak signal strength after a software update, despite working on the same network with other devices.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to establish internet connectivity in areas where other devices work, rendering it unusable for basic functions like calls and browsing.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Clock size reduces in AOD
rows.Problem: The AOD clock reduces its size automatically many times, requiring frequent manual adjustment.
rows.Summarized Problem: The AOD clock size reduces automatically, requiring frequent manual correction.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of the AOD interface, requiring user intervention but does not render the device unusable.

rows.Title: Sound related issue
rows.Problem: Sound noise is heard when playing a video song recorded on another mobile device, and this issue started on 19/04/25. The problem was not present before the September 2024 software update, which previously resolved a cracker burst sound issue. No logs were captured during the actual occurrence of the noise.
rows.Summarized Problem: A noise is heard during playback of a video song on the device, indicating degraded audio quality.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects audio playback but does not cause device crash or complete failure, and is intermittent or context-dependent.
rows.R&D Comment: The noise occurs during playback but no logs are available at the time of occurrence; user is advised to restart and capture logs with timestamps for reproduction.

rows.Title: Palm swipe capture issue
rows.Problem: Unable to take screenshot after performing palm swipe gesture
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot take screenshots after performing a palm swipe gesture.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature does not work as intended, but the device remains usable and no data is lost.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: No kernel touch log for palm swipe gesture; timing of issue unclear. Countermeasure: Users should record video and dump logs immediately when the issue occurs.

rows.Title: Live Caption issues
rows.Problem: No subtitles are displayed when the "Live caption" mode is enabled. The Live Caption feature has not been working since updating to One UI 7. The feature still displays Vietnamese font format despite system language being switched to English.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Live Caption feature fails to display subtitles and shows incorrect font format after system language change.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely non-functional and fails to deliver core functionality, preventing users from accessing real-time captions.
rows.R&D Comment: This is a Google Livecaption issue, report to Google (https://partnerissuetracker.corp.google.com/issues/396176799), in the log, current LC version is preinstalled version, it will be auto update through Google store.

rows.Title: Slow charging
rows.Problem: After updating OneUI7, facing very slow charging issue
rows.Summarized Problem: Device charges slowly after updating to OneUI7 due to temperature-related charging current restriction.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction under specific usage conditions, not complete device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Device temperature increases to 40°C during charging and app usage, triggering thermal management that reduces charging current; this is a known thermal operation and is intentional.

rows.Title: AI generated image not downloading
rows.Problem: AI generated image not downloading when clicking arrow mark; shows photo saved in gallery but it is not saving
rows.Summarized Problem: AI-generated images fail to download and are not properly saved to the gallery despite showing a save confirmation.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction where the image does not save correctly, but the user interface indicates success, preventing full functionality.

rows.Title: Good lock home app not working
rows.Problem: Good Lock Home app not working after updating to OneUI 7.0 on Samsung Tab S10 Plus
rows.Summarized Problem: The Good Lock Home app is not working after the OneUI 7.0 update on Samsung Tab S10 Plus.
rows.Severity Reason: The app is not functioning after an update, but it is not causing device crash or complete failure, only a partial feature malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: The HomeUp app is being prepared for Fold and Tablet devices on OneUI 7.0; users will be able to download the GoodLock HomeUp soon.

rows.Title: background shows solid colour only during call
rows.Problem: Call background shows solid colour only when receiving a call, while call settings show different backgrounds; after call ends, screen tint returns to solid colour.
rows.Summarized Problem: Call background displays a solid colour instead of the configured or default background during calls.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of the call background feature, where expected visual content is missing but does not render the device unusable or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Show contact photo background when contact photo not saved; Countermeasure: Fix to show default background in this case.

rows.Title: Game not open on full screen
rows.Problem: Efootball game apk cannot open in full screen mode after one ui7 installation
rows.Summarized Problem: The Efootball game APK cannot open in full screen mode after UI7 installation.
rows.Severity Reason: The game fails to open in full screen mode, which is a partial malfunction of a core feature, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: We have checked the issue in the latest binary, but the issue didn't reproduce at our end. The exact root cause is not clear from the provided logs. If the issue persists, please raise a new issue with logs and video.

rows.Title: Wallpaper and Lockscreen settings
rows.Problem: Wallpaper and lock screen settings are not working; were working in beta 6 but not showing in stable version
rows.Summarized Problem: Wallpaper and lock screen settings are not appearing or working in the stable version, despite working in beta 6.
rows.Severity Reason: Settings are missing in stable version, preventing users from customizing wallpaper and lock screen, but core device functionality remains intact.

rows.Title: Background internet usage on Google Chrome
rows.Problem: Background internet usage on Google Chrome stops working intermittently after One UI 7.0 update, causing image generation tasks to fail when returning from other apps, but works when staying on the page.
rows.Summarized Problem: Google Chrome stops processing background tasks after One UI 7.0 update, leading to failed image generation when returning from other apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue occurs intermittently and affects only specific app interactions, not causing device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue may be related to content site handling and coincides with One UI 7.0 update; recommend clearing browser cache and retesting.

rows.Title: Object eraser not working properly
rows.Problem: The object erasing function in the gallery has more advanced face or image reconstruction after erasing, which may be part of the UI 7 feature
rows.Summarized Problem: The object erasing function in the gallery is not working as expected and may be incorrectly implemented or misidentified.
rows.Severity Reason: The function is not working properly but does not result in device crash or data loss; it is a partial malfunction in feature behavior.
rows.R&D Comment: The user is referring to Galaxy AI's Photo assist feature; users should check for the blue button in the Transform menu to activate the feature.

rows.Title: Lag in quick panel while opening in landscape mode
rows.Problem: There is a slight lag when opening the quick panel in landscape mode. After multiple openings, it opens smoothly.
rows.Summarized Problem: The quick panel experiences a lag when opened in landscape mode, though it becomes smoother after repeated use.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction that occurs intermittently and affects user experience during specific usage scenarios.

rows.Title: Unable to change the background of calendar widget
rows.Problem: Cannot change the background of calendar widget to Light; it does not update properly
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot change the background color of the calendar widget to Light.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a UI feature, preventing users from customizing widget appearance but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue occurs after FOTA upgrade due to changes in widget settings from U OS to V OS; users can work around by removing and re-adding the widget, and it will be fixed in the next app update.

rows.Title: Samsung music app buffering while playing
rows.Problem: Music playback shows buffering with a circle on the Home navigation screen in the media gadget
rows.Summarized Problem: Music playback in the Samsung Music app shows buffering with a circle on the Home navigation screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent playback delay but does not prevent usage or cause device failure.

rows.Title: Clock size gets small automatically on lockscreen
rows.Problem: Lock screen clock size reduces unexpectedly despite being set to maximum. The issue occurs after expanding the now bar on lock screen. Screen recording attempts fail because phone unlocks during recording.
rows.Summarized Problem: The clock size on the lock screen unexpectedly reduces to a small size despite being set to maximum, and this happens after expanding the now bar.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the usability of the lock screen clock, which is a key visual element, but does not cause device crash or data loss or render the device unusable.

rows.Title: Sluggishness observed while opening Samsung Wallet app
rows.Problem: When opening Samsung Wallet app, it starts a loop of opening app - authentication - and app opening page.
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung Wallet app loops between opening, authentication, and display when launched.
rows.Severity Reason: The app exhibits partial malfunction with a recurring loop during launch, but does not completely fail or cause device instability.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: App activity is terminated due to 'always-finish' setting in developer options. Counter Measure: Users should disable battery protection settings like 'Don't keep activities' in developer options.

rows.Title: Display colors getting washed out
rows.Problem: The colors of the display get washed out from time to time since the Update One UI 7
rows.Summarized Problem: The display colors are washing out intermittently after the One UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual appearance but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.

rows.Title: Lags in opening and server error message
rows.Problem: Members application takes more time to open and shows server error message popup. Device is working slowly.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Members application takes significantly longer to open and shows a server error message, causing overall device slowness.
rows.Severity Reason: The application lags severely and shows a server error, impairing core functionality and device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: The onServiceDisconnected error occurred due to improper unregisterCallback; fixed by pairing register and unregister calls in next version.

rows.Title: Unable to send MMS
rows.Problem: I can't send MMS to any contacts although my internet is perfectly fine and text messages are also going perfectly but only problem is with (MMS) messages
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot send MMS messages despite having a stable internet connection and working text messaging.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a messaging feature, where MMS sending fails while text messaging works normally.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Notification Panel collapses when SMS is deleted
rows.Problem: Deleting SMS from notification panel causes the notification panel to collapse
rows.Summarized Problem: Deleting an SMS from the notification panel causes the entire panel to collapse.
rows.Severity Reason: The notification panel is a core UI component; its collapse prevents users from viewing notifications and disrupts device usability.

rows.Title: No animation on lock screen
rows.Problem: Lock screen animation fails to display when device is locked, turning off immediately without any visual transition.
rows.Summarized Problem: The lock screen lacks animation when transitioning to locked state.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a visual element, preventing smooth user experience but not rendering the device unusable.

rows.Title: Home screen scaling issue
rows.Problem: When setting home screen scaling to max, the bottom left corner app closing animation becomes distorted
rows.Summarized Problem: The app closing animation on the bottom left corner of the home screen becomes distorted when home screen scaling is set to maximum.
rows.Severity Reason: The animation distortion occurs during a specific user action but does not cause device malfunction or data loss, affecting only visual presentation.
rows.R&D Comment: This is because the home scale is too large and the icon has not yet reached its original position. In this case, reduce the home animation duration.

rows.Title: App Transfer to external storage problem
rows.Problem: App transfer to external storage problem persists after following suggested solution
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot successfully transfer apps to external storage despite following the suggested solution.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially functional but fails to resolve the core issue after user intervention, indicating intermittent failure rather than complete malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: App transfer operation fails when moving to external storage; Countermeasure: System logs show package relocation but no success in actual transfer.

rows.Title: Navigation Bar Overlap with Progress Bar
