rows.Problem: When scrolling down on a short video in YouTube, the progress bar hides behind the navigation buttons, causing usability issues.
rows.Summarized Problem: The progress bar hides behind navigation buttons when scrolling on YouTube videos, disrupting user interaction.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects usability during video playback but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.

rows.Title: AOD clock and battery icon glitching
rows.Problem: While in AOD, the clock and battery icon are glitching and change positions after every tap. The notification bar becomes slightly blurred on lock screen, resolving when unlocking or on home screen.
rows.Summarized Problem: The clock and battery icon glitch and shift position during AOD, and the notification bar appears blurred on lock screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual consistency and usability during AOD but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.

rows.Title: Clock on AOD not updated
rows.Problem: When customizing the lock screen, the AOD shows a stuck clock that does not match the selected clock.
rows.Summarized Problem: The AOD clock does not update to match the user's selected lock screen clock during customization.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the functionality of the AOD clock but does not cause device failure or data loss, only a mismatch in displayed content.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue was not reproducible in the latest binary; users are advised to verify in the latest device version.

rows.Title: Screen flicker Green screen issue
rows.Problem: S23 Ultra after One UI 7 update facing screen flicker Green screen issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The device displays a green screen with flickering during idle or no action state after the One UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The screen flickering and showing a green screen renders the device unusable, indicating a critical display failure.
rows.R&D Comment: From attached dumpstate, the SF log flow seems normal. No graphics layer coloring issues detected. Recommend customer to visit service center for hardware inspection.

rows.Title: Lock Screen freezes when pressing side button
rows.Problem: Phone freezes screen for a second when pressing side button to lock, then locks successfully. Issue occurs after updating to ONEUI7
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone freezes for a second when the side button is pressed to lock the screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The device does not fully respond immediately, causing a brief lag in operation, but the lock function eventually works.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Overall UI responsiveness feels unstable and inconsistent
rows.Problem: Overall UI responsiveness feels unstable and inconsistent. Lock Button Animation Missing: When I press the lock button, there's no transition animation. The screen freezes momentarily and then turns off abruptly after a fraction of a second. This feels unpolished. No Background Blur on Large Folders: In the beta version, opening large folders triggered a pleasant background blur
rows.Summarized Problem: The UI responsiveness is unstable and inconsistent, with missing animations and screen freezes when interacting with the lock button and large folders.
rows.Severity Reason: The screen freezes and turns off abruptly after a brief interaction, making the device feel unresponsive and unreliable during use.

rows.Title: Lock automatically each time you leave app
rows.Problem: Secure folder lock not working perfectly. App does not lock automatically when exiting and re-entering. User must wait at least 2-3 seconds after exiting before opening again.
rows.Summarized Problem: The secure folder fails to lock automatically when the user exits and re-enters the app, leading to a security lapse.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to function reliably under normal usage, but does not cause device crash or data loss, and can be mitigated by user delay.
rows.R&D Comment: Locking of secure folder is not instant. When user exits secure folder, depending on the time it takes for the activity transition, secure folder locking can take up to 2 seconds. If user tries to close secure folder app and open again immediately, it might not lock, since the process was never completed. User should wait at least 2-3 seconds after exiting before trying to open again.

rows.Title: Gemini App appears on device, unable to uninstall
rows.Problem: After upgrading to OneUI 7, two Gemini apps appear on the device with different package names. Both icons are visible and cannot be uninstalled, causing constant irritation.
rows.Summarized Problem: Two Gemini apps appear after OneUI 7 upgrade and cannot be uninstalled.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents removal of an app, which is a partial malfunction of app management functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Two Gemini apps with different package names exist. Countermeasure: Layout modifications fixed in latest CL.

rows.Title: Font color not display proper in Home Up module of Good Lock
rows.Problem: When "Apply folder background color" is turned on, the text label color of folder apps turns black, making it unreadable
rows.Summarized Problem: Text label color of folder apps turns black when folder background color is applied, making it unreadable.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects readability of app labels in a specific UI setting but does not cause device malfunction or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue will be fixed in Homescreen Version 16.0.09.13 or above.

rows.Title: network issue
rows.Problem: My phone is facing a network issue. I am unable to make or receive calls. The phone works properly when the SIM is removed and used in another device. This suggests a network issue specific to the S25 phone.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone cannot make or receive calls due to missing 3G network coverage and lack of support for VOLTE, despite having a working SIM in another device.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to establish voice calls, rendering it unusable for basic communication, which is a core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: 2G mode is missing in network settings; operator lacks 3G coverage and does not support VOLTE. Countermeasure: Enable 2G in Settings > Connection > Mobile Networks and disable auto blocker if present.

rows.Title: Lock Screen Setting
rows.Problem: Unable to see customize option on lock screen, lockstar icon shows after few minutes of restart, rotate to landscape mode is disabled
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot see customize options on lock screen, lockstar icon appears after brief restart, and landscape rotation is disabled.
rows.Severity Reason: Partial functionality is missing, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable or causing crashes.

rows.Title: Notification Panel color not getting changed properly
rows.Problem: Notification panel color turns green when applying normal theme or changing lock app. User wants blur notification panel. This is the 9th report with no resolution.
rows.Summarized Problem: The notification panel color does not change properly and defaults to green when themes or lock apps are applied.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual consistency and user experience but does not cause device failure or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: Bug in transparent part of quick panel in theme park; fixed in version 1.1.01.06. Users should update to latest theme park version.

rows.Title: Unable to open phone app and access call history after updating to UI 7
rows.Problem: Unable to open phone app and no call history is visible after updating to UI 7
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot open the phone app and access call history after updating to UI 7.
rows.Severity Reason: The phone app is completely inaccessible, preventing users from accessing basic call history, which is a core device function.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by a failure in the phone app loading mechanism due to insufficient logs; the countermeasure is to clear app data and resync contacts, though this risks data loss.

rows.Title: Camera quality issue
rows.Problem: Image quality has dropped drastically, especially in photos taken in 12, 50, and 200 MP modes. Images are not sharp and do not meet premium phone standards, despite good video quality. This appears to be related to processing and hand blur during video snap.
rows.Summarized Problem: Photo clarity and detail have significantly decreased, especially in high-megapixel modes, due to processing and hand blur during video snap.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects photo quality but does not cause device crash or complete failure; images are still usable but degraded compared to previous performance.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by hand blur during video snap and heat-induced HDR failure, and the countermeasure confirms the same root causes.

rows.Title: Empty space issue in app drawer
rows.Problem: There is an empty space on the left side of the app drawer when opening it after the One UI 7 update.
rows.Summarized Problem: An empty space appears on the left side of the app drawer when opened.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the layout and appearance of the app drawer but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue has been fixed in git id 40a6571d390f1cf3127fcb49582637594202d422 and will be included in the next MR.

rows.Title: Now bar alignment not properly in AOD screen
rows.Problem: When the charger is connected, the charging information on the Now Bar in Always On Display is aligned to the left or right instead of center.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Bar on the Always On Display is misaligned when the charger is connected, showing on the left or right instead of center.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual alignment but does not cause device malfunction or data loss; it is a partial UI inconsistency.

rows.Title: Wonderland app doesn't function as intended
rows.Problem: Wonderland app doesn't function as intended after the one ui 7 update on s23
rows.Summarized Problem: The Wonderland app fails to function properly after the One UI 7 update on the S23.
rows.Severity Reason: The app does not function as intended, rendering a key feature unusable after a system update.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by the LockScreen Alpha function not operating correctly in V OS and will be resolved in the upcoming B OS update.

rows.Title: Always On Display wallpaper not displaying
rows.Problem: Device does not display the Always On Display wallpaper after One UI 6.1 and One UI 7 updates
rows.Summarized Problem: The Always On Display wallpaper is not showing on the device after OS updates.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the display of a visual element but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.

rows.Title: One UI7 isn't properly optimized for full screen gestures
rows.Problem: One UI7 isn't properly optimized for full screen gestures. The issue occurs with gesture navigation and does not work properly despite enabling camera cutout on games. It resolves when switching to button navigation and returns when using gesture navigation.
rows.Summarized Problem: Gesture navigation in One UI7 is not working properly and only functions when switching to button navigation.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects usability of navigation but does not cause device crash or data loss, and functionality is partially available when using button navigation.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue is not reproducing in the latest ONEUI Home. Will be fixed in Homescreen Version 16.0.09.13 or above. Please check in the Homescreen version  16.0.09.13 or above.

rows.Title: Issues in alignment of AOD
rows.Problem: The now bar on Always on display sometimes shows tilted to the left or right and occasionally goes completely white when opened from the top
rows.Summarized Problem: The now bar on the Always On Display displays with misalignment or turns completely white when opened from the top.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent visual distortion but does not prevent device usage or cause functional failure.

rows.Title: error when accessing tips and guides in settings
rows.Problem: error when attempting to access the tips and guides option in the settings menu
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot access the tips and guides option in the settings menu.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing or inaccessible, preventing users from accessing content, but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by app permissions or updates in WhatsApp and YouTube; countermeasure involves ensuring both apps have proper permissions and are updated.

rows.Title: Device is very slow while using recent tab or opening status bar
rows.Problem: Device is very slow while using recent tab or opening status bar or notification panel with frame drops and late touch input registration, laggy touch input as seen in video
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences significant lag and frame drops when using the recent tab or opening the status bar and notification panel.
rows.Severity Reason: The device exhibits severe performance degradation during core system interactions, leading to unresponsive touch input and visual frame drops, which impairs usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Device undergoing preload class creation; performance improves over 5 days post-upgrade. Countermeasure: Request CP silent logs for further analysis.

rows.Title: Unable to turn on Rotate to landscape mode
rows.Problem: Rotate to landscape mode is grayed out and cannot be toggled, despite Auto-rotate being on or off. This is a basic smartphone feature.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot enable the Rotate to Landscape mode feature, which is grayed out regardless of Auto-rotate settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing and not functional, but does not cause device crash or data loss, and is not essential for core operations.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue will be fixed in the Homescreen Version 16.0.09.13 or above.

rows.Title: Battery widget not working properly
rows.Problem: The battery widget is not behaving properly after an update. The battery % number and charging icons are not aligned properly. The issue occurs at minimum width of 50
rows.Summarized Problem: The battery widget displays misaligned battery percentage and charging icons after an update.
rows.Severity Reason: The widget malfunctions in alignment, affecting usability but does not cause device crash or data loss.

rows.Title: Face frame drop and lagging
rows.Problem: Device has lagging and face frame drop issues
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences lagging and face frame drop during operation.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes noticeable lag and visual drop in the face frame, impairing user experience and device responsiveness.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Preload class creation process is causing system lag; Counter Measure: Provide CP silent logs for further analysis.

rows.Title: Camera lagging and poor quality
rows.Problem: The issue persists despite troubleshooting attempts
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera exhibits lag and poor video quality when used at different zoom levels, especially under varying device conditions.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves intermittent performance degradation during video capture, but does not completely disable functionality or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The lag is likely caused by temporary delays due to device heat and app execution; future updates may mitigate this.

rows.Title: Routines not working
rows.Problem: The created routine is not working. When the Bluetooth connection condition is met, the playlist playback condition fails. Error messages are displayed during execution.
rows.Summarized Problem: Bluetooth-connected routine fails to trigger Spotify playlist playback.
rows.Severity Reason: The routine fails to execute its intended action under specific conditions, but does not cause device crash or total unavailability.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Battery Drain
rows.Problem: Battery drain, widgets disappear automatically, LTE and Bluetooth icons not showing in status bar
rows.Summarized Problem: Device experiences significant battery drain with widgets disappearing and connectivity icons missing from the status bar.
rows.Severity Reason: Battery drain combined with loss of critical UI elements makes the device unusable and impacts core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue is not reproducing in the latest ONEUI Home; will be fixed in Homescreen Version 16.0.09.13 or above.

rows.Title: Separate app sound not working
rows.Problem: Separate app sound feature is not working when using Android Auto; audio from apps like Instagram plays through phone instead of being routed to car speakers via Android Auto.
rows.Summarized Problem: The separate app sound feature fails to route audio to car speakers when using Android Auto.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature does not work as intended in a specific use case, but still allows basic functionality and does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: When connecting to Android Auto, the system treats the vehicle as a remote device rather than a Bluetooth device, preventing proper audio routing. A clarification or update to the connection logic is needed to identify the vehicle as a Bluetooth device.

rows.Title: Display Blink while minimize YouTube video in PIP Mode
rows.Problem: Black blink occurs when minimizing a YouTube video into picture in picture mode
rows.Summarized Problem: A black blink appears when minimizing a YouTube video into picture in picture mode
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a visual glitch during UI interaction but does not cause device malfunction or data loss

rows.Title: Camera quality not good
rows.Problem: Camera picture quality is very poor, especially at 10x and 3x zoom, with low resolution and no optimization.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera produces poor picture quality, especially at higher zoom levels, with inadequate resolution and no optimization.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of camera performance under specific conditions, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Image quality is affected by hand blur and low light; digital zoom degrades image quality due to optical limitations.

rows.Title: vibration not working
rows.Problem: phone's vibration is not working and sometimes vibrates briefly then goes silent, suggesting a software bug
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone's vibration feature is not working properly, with intermittent brief vibrations followed by silence.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of a core UI feature, with intermittent behavior rather than complete failure or device instability.

rows.Title: Screen resolution change affects app icons size
rows.Problem: Changing screen resolution causes app icons to change size, affecting UI consistency across apps like Instagram and others.
rows.Summarized Problem: Changing screen resolution causes app icons to resize, leading to inconsistent UI appearance across applications.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue is a cosmetic UI inconsistency, not affecting device functionality or performance.
rows.R&D Comment: App UI changes with screen resolution as expected; behavior is consistent with Pixel devices and considered normal.

rows.Title: Phone App Search is not working Properly
rows.Problem: Search bug in Phone application. When searching for contacts, tapping on a contact from the list results in incorrect selection. The UI is also laggy.
rows.Summarized Problem: The search function in the Phone app incorrectly selects contacts and suffers from UI lag.
rows.Severity Reason: The search function fails to correctly select contacts, leading to incorrect results, and UI lag significantly impacts usability, making the app unusable for basic tasks.

rows.Title: Battery icon missing in status bar
rows.Problem: The battery icon no longer appears in the status bar after updating to One UI 7 on Samsung S24 Ultra. The 'Battery Indicator' option is missing entirely in Settings > Display > Status bar.
rows.Summarized Problem: The battery icon is missing from the status bar after an OS update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visibility of a core system indicator but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes.

rows.Title: Search contact from dial pad does not select default SIM
rows.Problem: When searching a contact from the dial pad using T9, the device does not auto-select the set default SIM (e.g., SIM 1) for calling, even though it was previously configured. Selecting the contact result manually causes the SIM to change to the correct one.
rows.Summarized Problem: The dial pad fails to auto-select the default SIM when searching for a contact, requiring manual selection to correct.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a partial malfunction in the calling flow, as the correct SIM is not pre-selected during contact search, but works after manual interaction.

rows.Title: Mobile network keep switching from 5g to 4g every few seconds
rows.Problem: Mobile network keeps switching from 5g to 4g every few seconds after updating to one ui 7, despite basic troubleshooting. Same issue on s23 and some s24 devices; no issue on s21fe with one ui 6.
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile network intermittently switches between 5G and 4G every few seconds after OS update, affecting connectivity stability.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects network stability but does not cause device crash or data loss, and is observed in specific regions with mixed 5G coverage.
rows.R&D Comment: Airtel's mixed 5G and 4G cell areas, combined with frequent frequency changes due to small data activity, may cause 5G ping-pong. Jio lacks 5G subscription and triggers network error 27.

rows.Title: Distortion in image while taking extended screenshot
rows.Problem: Distortion in center of image during extended screenshot, appears as mismatch line
rows.Summarized Problem: A distortion appears in the center of the image when taking an extended screenshot.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a visible mismatch line in the image, affecting image quality but does not prevent the user from taking a screenshot or using the feature entirely.
rows.R&D Comment: Scroll-captured bitmap was wrongly composed due to webview animation during touch events; adding a 250ms delay before capturing resolves the issue.

rows.Title: Vibration feedback not working during call receive and end
rows.Problem: Vibration feedback is not working while a call receive and call end
rows.Summarized Problem: Vibration feedback fails to activate during call receive and end events.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a core call feature, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: User has disabled touch interaction vibrations; telecom vibration requests are ignored. Countermeasure: Enable touch interaction vibrations in system settings and monitor behavior.

rows.Title: 5G not switching to 4G when connection is poor
rows.Problem: Device stuck in speed test page when 5G connection is poor; fails to switch to 4G automatically; internet access lost; works only when 5G is manually switched to LTE
rows.Summarized Problem: The device fails to automatically switch from 5G to 4G when 5G connection is poor, causing loss of internet access.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unusable due to loss of internet access when 5G is poor, preventing user from accessing the internet.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Long pressing notification overlaps itself
rows.Problem: Long pressing on any notification to disable or access settings causes it to overlap over the notification itself, affecting all apps.
rows.Summarized Problem: Long pressing a notification causes it to overlap itself, disrupting user interaction with the notification panel.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects functionality of accessing notification settings but does not cause device crash or data loss, and occurs across all apps.

rows.Title: Navigation button overlapping on other app display
rows.Problem: Navigation button overlapping on other app display unable to use phone properly. On YouTube app screenshot you can see navigation bar is there but YouTube icons are missing. On WhatsApp screenshot you can see navigation bar is overlapping. Due to this I'm Unable to send the text
rows.Summarized Problem: The navigation button overlaps on other app displays, preventing proper interaction and text input.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects usability in key apps but does not cause device crash or data loss.

rows.Title: Change wallpaper and clock style
rows.Problem: Unable to change wallpaper and clock style
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot change the wallpaper and clock style in the device settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially unavailable, preventing users from customizing a basic UI element, but does not cause device failure or data loss.

rows.Title: Contact search and call issue
rows.Problem: Contact app glitches when searching and making calls; tends to dial a different contact usually placed below the intended one
rows.Summarized Problem: The contact app incorrectly dials a different contact when searching and making calls, often selecting one below the intended contact.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction in contact functionality, leading to incorrect calls but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.

rows.Title: Device is heating a lot and restarted 5 times
rows.Problem: Device is heating a lot and restarted 5 times in just 30 minutes
rows.Summarized Problem: The device is overheating and restarting multiple times within a short period, leading to device instability.
rows.Severity Reason: The device overheating and frequent restarts make it unusable and pose a risk of hardware damage or safety issues.
rows.R&D Comment: Random crashes have been observed multiple times due to hardware instability. Please advise the customer to visit the customer service center for a hardware inspection. (Main PCB replacement may be necessary.)

rows.Title: Bluetooth can't connect in device
rows.Problem: I can't connect Bluetooth and I did restart but not working
rows.Summarized Problem: Bluetooth connection fails even after device restart.
rows.Severity Reason: User cannot establish Bluetooth connection, making device functionality severely limited.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Navigate gesture is stuck at AOD screen
rows.Problem: Navigate gesture is stuck at AOD screen
rows.Summarized Problem: The navigation gesture is stuck when the device is in AOD mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The gesture fails to function properly in AOD mode, preventing user interaction but does not cause device crash or data loss.

rows.Title: Dialer App always shows a solid colored background during Call
rows.Problem: No gradient video call background present; solid colored background shows regardless of picture used in call
rows.Summarized Problem: During video calls, the dialer app displays a solid colored background instead of a gradient or user-selected image.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of the call background display, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable or causing crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Fix to show default background when contact photo is not saved; modification included in next MR version.

rows.Title: Camera color quality not good
rows.Problem: Camera color quality not good. Color are very dull. The significantly degraded image quality is unacceptable and requires immediate resolution.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera produces dull and poorly colored images, resulting in significantly degraded image quality.
rows.Severity Reason: The degraded color quality makes images unacceptably dull and impacts core camera functionality, rendering the feature unusable for basic photo capture.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is likely due to software rendering or color calibration problems; users should check for lens debris, but no reproduction was confirmed in tests.

rows.Title: Now Bar does not show scores when in locked screen
rows.Problem: The nowbar of my s24ultra does not show scores when in locked screen although its turned on. Google sports notification and locked screen notification is turned on.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Bar does not display scores on the locked screen, despite being enabled.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing on the locked screen, preventing score display, but the device remains usable.

rows.Title: Visibility Issue in NowBar
rows.Problem: When the 'Reduce Transparency and Blur' setting is turned ON, the NowBar's background becomes fully white and the foreground text remains white, causing content to become invisible or unreadable. This severely affects usability due to lack of contrast between background and text.
rows.Summarized Problem: The NowBar becomes invisible when 'Reduce Transparency and Blur' is enabled due to lack of contrast between background and text.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot see or interact with the NowBar content, severely affecting usability and core functionality of the lock screen interface.

rows.Title: Sports from Google option not showing under Now Bar
rows.Problem: Sports from Google option is not showing under Now Bar
rows.Summarized Problem: The 'Sports from Google' option is missing from the Now Bar on the lock screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing from a key UI element, but the device remains usable and core functions are intact.

rows.Title: DeX crashes on loop when change audio output to display device
rows.Problem: DeX mode crashes on loop when audio output is changed to play through the display device
rows.Summarized Problem: DeX crashes repeatedly when the audio output is switched to play through the display device.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes repeatedly, causing DeX mode to become unusable during audio output changes.
rows.R&D Comment: Couldn't find any logs to check if there is some interaction made in made output. Also can't tell from the logs how exactly audio path is transferred. Please attach the video of the issue, reproduction route, and new logs after reproducing the issue.

rows.Title: Timer showing inappropriate data
rows.Problem: Timer displays AM instead of PM when set for PM time, and shows 60 h instead of 1 hour or 60 mins
rows.Summarized Problem: The timer displays incorrect time format (AM instead of PM) and shows '60 h' instead of '1 hour' or '60 mins'
rows.Severity Reason: The timer malfunctions in time format and duration display, but does not cause device crash or data loss, only showing incorrect values in a non-critical feature.
rows.R&D Comment: User started a 60h timer; timer name and end time are correct. Current status should be maintained.

rows.Title: Stutter is not visible
rows.Problem: The transition between Wi-Fi and Bluetooth toggles in quick settings is stutery, especially when expanding and collapsing the list. This occurs frequently and is noticeable in real usage, despite smooth transitions in screen recordings due to higher frame rates.
rows.Summarized Problem: The system exhibits stutery during Wi-Fi and Bluetooth toggle transitions in quick settings, causing noticeable lag during real-time interactions.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects usability during common interactions but does not cause device failure or data loss; it is intermittent and partial in impact.

rows.Title: Wifi sharing not found under Mobile Hotspot setting
rows.Problem: Unable to find wifi sharing option under Mobile Hotspot setting
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot find the wifi sharing option in the mobile hotspot settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing from the settings menu, preventing users from accessing a common network-sharing function, but the device remains usable overall.

rows.Title: Clock widget background issue
rows.Problem: Users cannot set background transparency for the 2x2 analog clock widget after updating to oneUI 15; the feature was previously available and is now missing.
rows.Summarized Problem: The transparency option for the 2x2 analog clock widget is no longer available after oneUI 15 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing for a specific widget, affecting user customization but not causing device malfunction or data loss.
rows.Resolve Type: Product Requirement, UX Guide, Standard Technical Specification
rows.R&D Comment: Transparency bar has been removed from the 2x2 analog clock widget in oneUI7; no background switch option exists in settings.

rows.Title: Camera issue
rows.Problem: After rotating the camera to horizontal position and returning to home screen, the wallpaper shows in horizontal position and then returns to portrait.
rows.Summarized Problem: The wallpaper incorrectly displays in horizontal orientation after camera rotation and returns to portrait upon returning to home screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a partial malfunction in display behavior during camera rotation, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable or causing data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is not observed in OneUI8.0; upgrade to OneUI8.0 may resolve it.

rows.Title: Video playback not working
rows.Problem: Video playback stops working completely across all apps, including Instagram, YouTube, Netflix, and downloaded videos. The screen stays black, or the app freezes. This issue occurs before and after the One UI 7 update.
rows.Summarized Problem: Video playback fails across all apps, with the screen staying black or apps freezing.
rows.Severity Reason: Video playback is completely failing across multiple apps, making media consumption unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Video is not attached. Please retest in latest version of apps and attach new logs and video in sync if issue persists.

rows.Title: Zoom Blur Issue
rows.Problem: Camera screen has a dark spot on the right side bottom only in 1x zoom, 2x zoom is normal
rows.Summarized Problem: A dark spot appears on the right bottom corner of the camera screen when using 1x zoom, but not in 2x zoom.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects only one zoom level and does not prevent device usage or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs when the issue occurs.

rows.Title: Charging animation is broken
rows.Problem: Charging animation is broken and appears as a gif slapped over the battery icon; battery pill size is too large and users are complaining about it
rows.Summarized Problem: The charging animation is broken and appears incorrectly over the battery icon, with an excessively large battery pill.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual presentation and user experience but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery Charging VI is improved since OneUI8. Please check OneUI8 FOTA update. BENI CL 31549660

rows.Title: Wifi calling issue
rows.Problem: Wifi calling functionality not working after UI update, using eSIM
rows.Summarized Problem: Wifi calling functionality is not working after a UI update, particularly when using eSIM.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a feature after an update, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: No response from NW, possibly due to temporary network issue or subscription issue. Test with different SIM and hotspot; if fails, contact operator.

rows.Title: Quick setting panel is dark even when dark mode is off
rows.Problem: Quick setting panel is dark even after dark mode is turned off. Lockscreen bottom shortcuts are light even after dark mode is turned on with no translucent effects
rows.Summarized Problem: The quick setting panel appears dark when dark mode is off, and lockscreen bottom shortcuts show incorrect lighting with no translucent effects.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual consistency but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes or data loss.

rows.Title: Contact profile picture becomes blurry after answering a call
rows.Problem: Contact profile picture appears sharp before answering a call but becomes blurry after answering, starting after One UI 7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: Contact profile pictures become blurry after answering a call.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of the UI where the image quality degrades after a specific user action, but does not prevent device operation or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: OneUI 7.X changed the background concept; if a contact has no photo, it displays a default blurred background during screen initialization, which differs from intended behavior.

rows.Title: Photo ambient wallpaper not working on heavy rainfall or thunder
rows.Problem: Photo ambient wallpaper works on normal rainfall but not on rainfall with thunder or heavy rainfall
rows.Summarized Problem: Photo ambient wallpaper fails to activate during heavy rainfall or thunderstorms.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature partially works under normal conditions but fails in specific weather conditions, resulting in inconsistent behavior rather than complete failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by incorrect weather data handling on the device; a patch has been applied to fix location data caching, and users are advised to check the weather widget and update the software.

rows.Title: Control panel is blue colored and lags when turning off screen
rows.Problem: The control panel is blue colored in both light and dark modes and there is lag when turning off the screen and when AOD turns on.
rows.Summarized Problem: The control panel displays a blue color in both light and dark modes and lags when the screen is turned off or AOD activates.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects UI appearance and responsiveness during screen transition, but does not prevent device operation or cause data loss.

rows.Title: Battery widget doesn't display battery percentage on home screen
rows.Problem: Battery widget on home screen doesn't display battery percentage when Samsung Watch 3 is connected to Samsung phone via wearable app.
rows.Summarized Problem: The battery widget on the home screen fails to show battery percentage when Samsung Watch 3 is connected to a Samsung phone.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the display of battery level but does not cause device malfunction or data loss, only a partial UI failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: No connection/disconnection logs available. Countermeasure: Request new logs for analysis.

rows.Title: Notifications are overlapping the fingerprint area
rows.Problem: Notifications are overlapping the fingerprint area. Therefore, when I try to unlock the phone with my fingerprint, it opens the app on top of the fingerprint area
rows.Summarized Problem: Notifications overlap the fingerprint area, causing the phone to open an app instead of unlocking properly.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the usability of the unlock function but does not cause device failure or data loss.

rows.Title: Unable to open quick panel by swiping down
rows.Problem: Unable to open quick panel when swiping down from the right or left side of the notification panel. Only notification screen appears. Must manually swipe right to access quick panel. This happens only on home screen. Accessible with right side swipe when on other apps.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot open the quick panel by swiping down from the notification panel on the home screen, requiring manual swipe to access it.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents easy access to the quick panel on the home screen, which is a core navigation function but does not cause device crash or data loss.

rows.Title: Vibrate when answered feature not working
rows.Problem: Vibrate when answered feature not working; vibration is synced when previewing custom ringtone but does not vibrate for incoming calls
rows.Summarized Problem: The vibrate when answered feature does not work for incoming calls, despite syncing vibration when previewing custom ringtone.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing during actual call reception, but does not cause device crash or data loss, only affects user experience during call interaction.

rows.Title: Multiple issue with the camera
rows.Problem: After launching the camera app, the phone gets drastically warm. During burst shots and floating button activation, the device takes multiple shots sequentially instead of one. Same behavior occurs during video recording by long pressing the shutter button.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera app causes excessive heating and produces multiple shots instead of a single one during burst mode and floating button activation.
rows.Severity Reason: The device overheats and exhibits inconsistent behavior during core camera functions, indicating a major performance issue that compromises usability and stability.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Memory backpressure due to continuous usage and background processes. Countermeasure: Clear cache and RAM, close background apps, reboot and wait 20-25 minutes before testing.

rows.Title: Device takes a long time to wake up from sleep
rows.Problem: Device takes a long time to wake up from sleep, like 3 to 5 seconds after pressing the power button, been happening ever since the one UI 7 update that was received 2 days ago
rows.Summarized Problem: The device takes 3 to 5 seconds to wake up after being in sleep mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a noticeable delay in system responsiveness after sleep, but the device does not crash or become unusable, and system resources are normal.
rows.R&D Comment: CPU usage is normal, and enough memory is available. There are no ANRs or significant system bottlenecks. The issue is likely due to a software delay in the wake-up process introduced by the One UI 7 update.

rows.Title: Option not working in Secure Folder
rows.Problem: Option 'Each time I leave an app' in Secure Folder settings does not stay selected and reverts back when selected; other options work fine.
rows.Summarized Problem: The 'Each time I leave an app' option in Secure Folder settings fails to remain selected and reverts upon selection.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature does not function as intended but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.

rows.Title: One UI 7 crashed in split screen
rows.Problem: One UI 7 crashed while working on split screen
rows.Summarized Problem: One UI 7 crashes when using split screen functionality.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes during use, making the feature unusable and disrupting user workflow.

rows.Title: Hissing sound during video calls
rows.Problem: After the software update, a hissing sound like wind is heard during video calls, making it difficult for the other person to understand the conversation.
rows.Summarized Problem: A hissing sound is heard during video calls, interfering with communication.
rows.Severity Reason: The sound interferes with communication, making it difficult for the other party to understand the user.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: When full spectrum mic mode is activated, ambient noise is picked up. Countermeasure: Users should deactivate this feature via the quick panel.

rows.Title: Camera stutters
rows.Problem: Camera stuttering issue persists, user wants device replacement instead of repair
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera function stutters during operation, causing inconsistent performance.
rows.Severity Reason: The stuttering prevents smooth operation of the camera, making it unusable in real-time use cases.
rows.R&D Comment: UV Damper peeling due to improper assembly and incorrect curing position causes AF oscillation error, leading to driving force inaccuracies; improved jig and carrier height measurement will correct the issue.

rows.Title: Portrait Feature Issue
rows.Problem: The resulting image often has a completely different face with no resemblance to the original photo
rows.Summarized Problem: The portrait mode feature generates images with a completely different face that does not resemble the original photo.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature produces completely inaccurate results, leading to a major malfunction in facial recognition and image generation.
rows.R&D Comment: The resulting images are generated using the Cloud AI Server. Identity Mismatch is the limitation but however we try to match the identity almost close to 90%.

rows.Title: WhatsApp issue in secure folder
rows.Problem: While in a call with WhatsApp in the secure folder, cellular call functionality is not working. This was working in One UI 6.
rows.Summarized Problem: WhatsApp in the secure folder prevents cellular call functionality during calls.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of a core feature (cellular call) during a call, but does not cause device crash or total unavailability.

rows.Title: Heating issues
rows.Problem: Heating issue appears to be primarily correlated with camera application usage
rows.Summarized Problem: Device overheats when camera application is used.
rows.Severity Reason: The heating issue occurs during camera usage but does not cause device freeze or crash, only a performance-related thermal increase.
rows.R&D Comment: Camera entry, mode switching, and lens switching scenarios occur 19 times; the mode is performance-oriented, leading to high CPU usage, but camera CPU share is normal.

rows.Title: Battery Drain
rows.Problem: Battery drains very quickly and device performance is affected
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences rapid battery drain, leading to reduced usage time.
rows.Severity Reason: Battery drains quickly, affecting device usability but not causing complete failure or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: There is a history of 11% battery drain over 1 hours and 11 minutes according to the attached log and we could not find an abnormal battery drain issue. Please send the log immediately with a detailed description when you think an abnormal battery drain has occurred. The log could be initialized if the phone is rebooted or the battery is charged more than 80%.

rows.Title: Signals not registered
rows.Problem: Telecom signals not registering after android 15 update. Unable to call, always showing not registered to network. Both slots affected.
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile network signals are not registering after Android 15 update, preventing call functionality on both SIM slots.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot make calls due to complete failure of network registration, rendering basic communication functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Logs provided are insufficient for detailed cause; customers should visit Samsung Customer Service to collect detailed modem logs.

rows.Title: Can't connect to mobile networks while flight mode is on
rows.Problem: A system toast notification 'Can't connect to mobile networks while flight mode is on' appears and stays on screen for too long, especially when opening or using the Camera app, blocking the interface and delaying photo capture. The same issue occurs with the toast notification 'sent'.
rows.Summarized Problem: A persistent toast notification appears when flight mode is on, blocking camera interface and delaying photo capture.
rows.Severity Reason: The toast notification blocks critical functionality (camera access) and causes significant user disruption during key operations.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: System toast remains visible for too long due to user state configuration. Counter Measure: Adjust toast duration in system logs to reduce visibility.

rows.Title: Live sports cannot be brought back to now bar and status bar
rows.Problem: When live sports score is removed from notification panel, it cannot be restored to now bar and status bar after clearing notifications
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot restore live sports scores to the Now Bar and Status Bar after removing them from the notification panel.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from recovering a feature after accidental removal, but the device remains usable and core functions continue to work.

rows.Title: Phone dialer and contacts not loading
rows.Problem: Phone dialer and contacts are not loading after UI 7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone dialer and contacts are failing to load after the UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The contacts are not loading at all, preventing basic phone functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Database index rebuilding fails due to large contacts database size during upgrade. Counter Measure: Same as cause, indicating no improvement in current implementation.

rows.Title: Samsung Wallet issue
rows.Problem: Samsung Wallet app repeatedly asks for full access permissions despite already granting access to files; this is persistent and unnecessary for a wallet app, unlike Google Pay or PhonePe
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung Wallet persistently requests full access permissions unnecessarily, causing a poor user experience.
rows.Severity Reason: The app repeatedly asks for excessive permissions, which is a partial malfunction affecting usability but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Media permission is required only in case of import from PDF flow. So, we have removed and added in specific flow.

rows.Title: LockStar and Home Up apps not opening
rows.Problem: LockStar and Home Up apps are not updated and are not opening after updating to UI 7 on Tab S9 Plus
rows.Summarized Problem: Home Up and LockStar apps fail to open or update after UI 7 update on Tab S9 Plus.
rows.Severity Reason: The apps are not opening, which prevents core lock screen functionality from working.

rows.Title: Face search feature not found
rows.Problem: In gallery, face search option is not visible after Ui 7 update; only location and document search are visible
rows.Summarized Problem: Face search option is missing in the gallery after the Ui 7 update, only location and document search are visible.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing in a key functionality area but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The current face analysis service requires reanalysis when a new engine is applied; in S24 with Android 15, a full reanalysis is needed from the beginning, and FaceService only operates when the device is idle with screen off.

rows.Title: Battery Drain
rows.Problem: Device drains very fast after updating to OneUI 7, likely due to inefficient OpenGL graphics API replacement from Vulkan.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences rapid battery drain after updating to OneUI 7, caused by inefficient graphics API switching from Vulkan to OpenGL.
rows.Severity Reason: Battery drain is severe and renders the device unusable without sufficient charge, impacting core device functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue is from GMS apps; these apps continuously run in the background and perform frequent network operations, leading to high power consumption.

rows.Title: Gap between bottom of the screen and apps on home screen
rows.Problem: There is a gap between the bottom of the screen and the apps on the home screen, preventing apps from being moved to the bottom. This issue started after updating to One UI 7.
rows.Summarized Problem: A gap appears between the bottom of the screen and the home screen apps, making it impossible to place apps at the bottom.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects usability of the home screen layout but does not cause device failure or crash.

rows.Title: Wrist detection and BIA sensor stopped working
rows.Problem: Wrist detection and BIA sensor have stopped working after the last 2024 update
rows.Summarized Problem: Wrist detection and BIA sensor have stopped working after the latest 2024 software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The sensors are completely non-functional, preventing core health and motion tracking features from working, making the device unusable for key user functions.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: No contact with electrode sensor due to film obstruction; Countermeasure: Check film attachment to electrode; if issue persists, visit service center for sensor inspection.

rows.Title: Network issue
rows.Problem: When airplane mode is turned off and a call is ended, the call remains disconnected and stays static for minutes. This is a software glitch that occurs every time.
rows.Summarized Problem: A call remains disconnected and stays static after ending when transitioning between airplane and normal mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a persistent software glitch that prevents normal call termination, leading to a malfunction in core communication functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: WiFi is getting disconnected automatically
rows.Problem: WiFi is getting disconnected automatically after updating to UI7. It was working fine in UI6. On S23 Ultra, the network shows 'Ready to connect when network quality improves' and connects only when WiFi is manually turned on and off. The connection drops after a short time.
rows.Summarized Problem: WiFi connection drops automatically after updating to UI7, with the device showing a 'Ready to connect when network quality improves' message and requiring manual on/off toggle to reconnect.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves intermittent connectivity failure after a software update, affecting user experience but not causing device unavailability or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue occurs due to poor signal strength during data communication; further testing with strong signal APs is needed to confirm and resolve the root cause.

rows.Title: Scanned Data dialog box
rows.Problem: After updating to One UI 7, a "Scanned Data" dialog box appears when opening a travel ticket PDF, instead of automatically scanning and opening it with Samsung Wallet as in One UI 6.1. The dialog only allows copying scanned data to clipboard, which is not useful.
rows.Summarized Problem: A "Scanned Data" dialog box appears instead of automatically scanning and opening a travel ticket PDF with Samsung Wallet after updating to One UI 7.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature no longer functions as intended, but the core workflow is still accessible through copying data to clipboard, so it is not a complete failure.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue is happening due to increased security protocols in OneUI7. This has been taken care of and fixed, you can see the updates post Q2 release

rows.Title: Poor sound quality in buds 3
rows.Problem: The bass has been significantly reduced and the sharpness is too high after the UI7 update, making it impossible to increase volume above 70 percent
rows.Summarized Problem: The sound quality of Buds 3 has deteriorated after the UI7 update, with reduced bass and excessive sharpness that prevents volume adjustment beyond 70 percent.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects audio experience but does not cause device crash or complete failure, and only impacts sound quality rather than core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: From One UI 7.0, the EQ of the phone and Buds are separated, requiring EQ readjustment to restore sound quality.

rows.Title: Albums grouped by date despite option off
rows.Problem: Albums are grouped by date in Samsung Gallery app even when the date grouping option is turned off or on, and no change occurs regardless of setting.
rows.Summarized Problem: Albums in the Samsung Gallery app are incorrectly grouped by date even when the date grouping option is disabled.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature does not behave as expected when the option is turned off, but the issue is not complete failure or device crash, only a partial malfunction of functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is not reproducible in testing; app data and logs are needed for accurate analysis. Next update will include more detailed logs to help diagnose.

rows.Title: Black screen issue
rows.Problem: Black screen appears when swiping left on Instagram stories
rows.Summarized Problem: A black screen appears when swiping left on Instagram stories.
rows.Severity Reason: The black screen prevents users from viewing content, making the feature unusable.

rows.Title: Call background issue
rows.Problem: The call background screen displays the profile picture instead of the custom call background selected by the user
rows.Summarized Problem: The call background screen shows the contact's profile picture instead of the user-selected custom background.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a partial malfunction in the call background display, deviating from user expectation but does not render the call unusable or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Shows contact photo background if contact photo not saved; Countermeasure: Fix to show default background in this case.

rows.Title: Battery performance issue
rows.Problem: The battery drains quickly despite minimal usage, requiring charging twice a day, even with performance mode set to light.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device drains battery rapidly despite minimal usage, requiring frequent charging.
rows.Severity Reason: The device requires charging twice a day under minimal usage, indicating severe battery drain that renders the device impractical for daily use.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery consumption is high due to prolonged use of mobile hotspot; a user guide is needed to prevent unnecessary usage.

rows.Title: Charging connects and disconnects simultaneously
rows.Problem: Charging disconnects and reconnects after the latest update on S25 ultra. It stabilizes for about 10 minutes before reconnecting and disconnecting again.
rows.Summarized Problem: Charging connection repeatedly disconnects and reconnects after the latest software update, causing instability.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent charging, making the device unusable during use, and may lead to data loss or device damage.

rows.Title: Microsoft Outlook and Microsoft Teams do not sync or receive notifications in the background
rows.Problem: Microsoft Outlook (including Outlook Lite) and Microsoft Teams do not sync or receive notifications in the background. These apps only sync when manually opened. Notifications and background sync work fine for other apps like WhatsApp, Telegram, Gmail, etc.
rows.Summarized Problem: Microsoft Outlook and Microsoft Teams fail to sync or receive notifications in the background, only working when manually opened.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot receive real-time notifications or updates from critical apps, making communication unreliable and disrupting workflow.
rows.R&D Comment: Not enough information. As MS Outlook app is 3rd party. It's hard for us to find out the root cause without PowerLift ID. Please add more-info (PowerLiftID) to look into it with detail descriptions & repro video/screenshot. Within Outlook for Android's settings, tap Help & Feedback. Tap Collect Diagnostics. > Tap Get Started. > Tap Collect Logs (Android). Share the PowerLift ID

rows.Title: Photo quality issues
rows.Problem: I need to know which photo looks good and natural and clear. One photo is from a 4-year-old device and one from the latest S25, suggesting a significant quality gap.
rows.Summarized Problem: Photos taken on the device do not appear natural, clear, or of good quality, especially when compared between an older and a newer device.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in image quality, but does not result in device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Please tell me a more detailed problem. We optimized considering various environments. I will consider the improvement by referring to your opinion.

rows.Title: Unable to use Bixby when offline processing is off
rows.Problem: I'm unable to use bixby offline
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot use Bixby when offline processing is disabled.
rows.Severity Reason: The function is not available under specific settings, but the device remains usable overall.

rows.Title: Bluetooth icon not displayed
rows.Problem: Bluetooth icon is not displayed on the top right corner when connected, only visible when dragging down the notification panel. The vibration icon becomes unstable when attempting to add the Bluetooth icon.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Bluetooth icon does not display on the lock screen when connected, only appearing in the notification panel, and causes instability in vibration feedback when manually added.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the visibility of a key network indicator but does not cause device crash or data loss, and is partially mitigable through UI adjustments.

rows.Title: Side Key Button Not Work Properly
rows.Problem: When the side button long press option is set to Bixby, pressing the power and volume up buttons simultaneously shows a microphone icon on the status bar even though no command is assigned to that combination.
rows.Summarized Problem: The side button long press function triggers unintended microphone icon display when power and volume up buttons are pressed simultaneously, despite no command being assigned.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes unintended behavior in the system when a specific button combination is pressed, but does not result in device crash or data loss.

rows.Title: Caller background picture gets blurred out
rows.Problem: When lifting a call, the caller background picture blurs. Previously, it was a premium mix of green and black or pink and black, not a plain solid color. Users want the original premium background effect. The current setting does not allow users to change this behavior.
rows.Summarized Problem: The caller background picture blurs during calls and defaults to a plain solid color instead of the previous premium color blend.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual experience and user expectations, but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Show Contact photo background when contact photo not saved. Counter Measure: Fix to show default background and allow user to set custom background via contact photo, profile image, or call background settings.

rows.Title: Unsupported video plays audio but not video
rows.Problem: Unsupported video plays audio but has display lags
rows.Summarized Problem: Unsupported video playback causes display lags while audio plays normally.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves intermittent display lag during video playback, affecting user experience but not causing device crash or complete failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both state that the issue cannot be reproduced without a reproduction path and recorded video, and that logs are needed for further analysis.

rows.Title: Device gets unresponsive while restarting
rows.Problem: Device shows 'One UI - Optimizing Apps' screen, loads to 100%, screen dims, then becomes unresponsive and stuck. User must perform hard restart to recover.
rows.Summarized Problem: Device becomes unresponsive and stuck during restart, failing to boot properly after showing the 'One UI - Optimizing Apps' screen.
rows.Severity Reason: Device fails to complete restart process, leading to unresponsiveness and requiring hard restart, making the device unusable until recovery.
rows.R&D Comment: User likely performed app uninstalls via shell, which triggered system instability; Google confirmed this action is not recommended and may cause system optimization issues.

rows.Title: Unable to make normal call during WhatsApp call in secure folder
rows.Problem: Unable to make normal calls from phone dialer while on a WhatsApp call within the secure folder
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot make normal phone calls from the dialer while on a WhatsApp call inside the secure folder.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from making basic phone calls, rendering a core functionality unusable during an active call.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Active call userHandle and desired call userHandle differ; only same phone account handle allows calls. Countermeasure: Users must terminate active calls; system now considers simultaneous and multi-user call states in ongoing call checks (Google AOSP implementation).

rows.Title: Device becomes unresponsive while listening to Spotify
rows.Problem: Spotify continues playing after mobile data ends, then stops suddenly. The app notification does not respond when tapped. Attempting to open Spotify multiple times results in no response. Spotify's UI appears in place when swiping up to the app drawer.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device becomes unresponsive after mobile data ends while listening to Spotify, with the app failing to respond to user interaction.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unresponsive and Spotify fails to respond to user input after data ends, rendering the music playback unusable and potentially impacting user experience significantly.
rows.R&D Comment: Uptime and memory usage are normal; no ANRs or fatal exceptions observed. The issue may stem from Spotify's background behavior post-data end, requiring deeper investigation into app lifecycle handling.

rows.Title: Unable to use bluetooth headphones for calls
rows.Problem: After the latest OneUI 7 (Stable) update on my galaxy S23 Ultra, I can't use my bluetooth headphones while on a call. I have Galaxy buds 2 pro and having this issue since I updated my phone to the latest software. Saw a few posts that a few people were having the same issues with the 2nd Beta update.
rows.Summarized Problem: Bluetooth headphones fail to function during calls after the OneUI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial functionality failure during a specific use case (calls) rather than complete device unavailability or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: Connection is failing due to page timeout. Make sure that the remote device is charged, powered on, in connectable or pairing mode or not already connected to some other device and then try connecting again. Also confirm if it is remote device issue by trying connecting with other devices. If issue persists, OTA logs will be required to check whether the remote device is sending packets to.

rows.Title: Loud read notifications not working
rows.Problem: Loud read notifications in Modes and Routines are not working after updating to One UI 7.0
rows.Summarized Problem: Loud read notifications are not functioning in Modes and Routines after the One UI 7.0 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing in specific routines, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Battery percentage not showing
rows.Problem: I cannot see the battery percentage after updating to One UI 7
rows.Summarized Problem: The battery percentage is not visible on the device screen after updating to One UI 7.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visibility of battery level but does not prevent device operation or cause system crashes or data loss.

rows.Title: Installed apps overlapping with existing widgets
rows.Problem: After updating to oneui 7, newly installed applications from Play Store or Galaxy Store overlap with existing widgets. Users can move widgets and place them to avoid overlap, but the overlap still occurs.
rows.Summarized Problem: Newly installed apps overlap with existing widgets on the home screen after updating to OneUI 7.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in widget positioning, allowing overlap but not preventing it entirely, which affects user experience but does not render the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The overlap behavior is caused by the 'DIY Home' feature in HomeUp, which allows free widget placement without fixed app positions. Users can disable this feature to prevent overlap.

rows.Title: Inconsistent battery percentage readings
rows.Problem: After updating to One UI 7, the phone shows inconsistent battery percentage readings. The battery drains to low levels, then suddenly jumps to higher percentages during charging, drops quickly after removing the charger, and stays stuck at high levels even after overnight charging. The reading corrects only after a restart.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device displays inconsistent and inaccurate battery percentage readings after an OS update, leading to unreliable battery usage information.
rows.Severity Reason: The inconsistency in battery percentage readings makes battery usage unreliaable, leading to user confusion and potential misuse of device functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: The battery usage count is high. It is estimated that the battery performance has degraded due to battery aging. We recommend replacing the new battery.

rows.Title: Delay in app launch/close
rows.Problem: Animation test of opening and closing apps is not smooth on S23 ultra with One UI 7 stable version. Gesture tuning on Home-up from Good Lock apps has response issues.
rows.Summarized Problem: App launch and close animations are not smooth on the S23 Ultra with One UI 7.
rows.Severity Reason: The animation issue affects smoothness of app transitions but does not cause device unavailability or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: Keep all animation scales at 1. (Window animation scale, Transition animation scale, Animator duration scale)

rows.Title: Smiley option missing from keyboard
rows.Problem: Smiley option and other tab bar are not showing on keyboard after recent security patch update, while earlier it was working fine
rows.Summarized Problem: The smiley option and tab bar are missing from the Samsung keyboard after a recent software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects a key UI element but does not cause device malfunction or data loss, and can be resolved through user settings.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Toolbar has been turned off in keyboard settings. Countermeasure: User should enable Keyboard Toolbar in Samsung keyboard settings.

rows.Title: Game plugins not supported in V-OS
rows.Problem: Game plugins are no longer supported in V-OS; functions have been integrated into GameBooster or moved to Goodlock app
rows.Summarized Problem: Game plugins are no longer supported in V-OS, with functionalities moved to GameBooster and Goodlock apps
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial functional change rather than a complete system failure or data loss
rows.R&D Comment: GamePlugin is no longer supported by GameBooster UX simplification policy in Android V-os. Some functions of GamePlugin have been added as the main function of GameBooster, and the rest will be additionally supported through the Goodlock app. Please keep the current status.

rows.Title: Operating advance features in Home up is not smooth
rows.Problem: Phone is not smooth when using advance tuning features in HomeUp such as icon scale interpolator, icon tracking position interpolator, wallpaper interpolator, and home screen interpolator. Animations for app opening and closing are not responsive.
rows.Summarized Problem: Animations in HomeUp are laggy and unresponsive, causing a lack of smoothness when interacting with app transitions and UI elements.
rows.Severity Reason: The device feels unresponsive during normal use, impacting user experience significantly and making advanced features unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: optimized the performance of animation and fixed the animation related issues

rows.Title: Front camera not working in third party apps
rows.Problem: Front camera stopped working in third-party apps like WhatsApp and Google Meet after updating to One UI 6.1 on Galaxy M34 5G. It works in the default Samsung Camera app, indicating a software issue post-update. User has tried reset, cache clearing, app reinstallation, safe mode boot, and storage optimization with no resolution.
rows.Summarized Problem: The front camera does not function in third-party apps after an OS update, despite working in the native Samsung Camera app.
rows.Severity Reason: The front camera fails in multiple third-party apps, which are essential for daily use, but still works in the native app, indicating partial functionality rather than complete failure or device unusability.
rows.R&D Comment: Attached videos and logs are not in sync. Please update all apps from Playstore and retest. If the issue persists, attach new logs and video in sync.

rows.Title: Constant switching of network from 5G to 4G
rows.Problem: Hotspot switches from 5G to 4G after a few minutes when sharing network with devices like laptop or PlayStation 5, despite strong 5G signal. Issue occurs intermittently and lasts for about 2 minutes before recurring.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device switches from 5G to 4G when sharing hotspot, despite strong 5-than signal, and this happens intermittently for about two minutes before returning.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent loss of high-speed connectivity during hotspot use, affecting user experience but does not result in device crash or complete failure.
rows.R&D Comment: It seems device temperature is very high which is causing device to enter in thermal situation and 5G cell is getting dropped which is causing device to drop 5G.

rows.Title: App names come written in dark color instead of white
rows.Problem: App name is marked in dark color and cannot be changed to white despite switching between dark and bright modes
rows.Summarized Problem: App names are displayed in dark color instead of white, regardless of dark or bright mode settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual consistency but does not prevent device operation or cause functional failure.

rows.Title: Device getting overheated
rows.Problem: Device overheats during regular use, especially when using 5G/WiFi, AC USB charging, and running Android Auto, camera, and SNS apps simultaneously.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device overheats during normal usage due to combined load from 5G/WiFi, AC charging, and multiple apps.
rows.Severity Reason: Overheating occurs under normal usage conditions and is caused by combined system loads, potentially leading to device instability or safety risks.
rows.R&D Comment: The maximum temperature of the device was measured at around 43 degrees Celsius, as per the LRP standard. This increase in temperature appears to have been caused by the combined load generated while using 5G/WiFi networks and AC USB charging, along with the simultaneous execution of Android Auto, camera, and SNS apps. Additionally, external environmental factors such as direct sunlight and the blanket effect may have restricted heat dissipation from the device, potentially leading to further te

rows.Title: not able to open any application for 2-3 seconds after closing incognito tab notification
rows.Problem: after closing incognito tab notification, unable to open any application for 2-3 seconds, tapping on app results in 'PROCESSING NOTIFICATION' alert
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot open any application for 2-3 seconds after closing an incognito tab notification, resulting in a 'PROCESSING NOTIFICATION' alert when attempting to launch apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from launching applications immediately after a notification action, rendering the device temporarily unusable for app access.
rows.R&D Comment: This is a Chrome-based issue; reported to Crbug ID:416181574. Google will evaluate and resolve in future Chrome updates.

rows.Title: Unable to launch camera
rows.Problem: camera is unable to open
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera app fails to launch and cannot open.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera cannot open, preventing basic device functionality.

rows.Title: Glitch in the homepage
rows.Problem: When trying to delete a page on the homepage by swiping inward and opening home screen settings, there is no option to delete the page which appears at the top.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot delete a page on the homepage when attempting to swipe and open settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in the user interface, preventing a basic action but not causing device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue is not occurring in the version; please check in the latest version.

rows.Title: HomeUp not working after UI 7 update
rows.Problem: HomeUp feature fails to function after UI 7 update, showing a popup every time it is clicked
rows.Summarized Problem: The HomeUp feature on the Lock Screen is not functioning after the UI 7 update and shows a popup every time it is clicked.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to work consistently but does not cause device crash or data loss, only a persistent popup on interaction.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: HomeUp version does not match Launcher version; Countermeasure: Update HomeUp to version 16.x.x

rows.Title: Game booster feature in good lock is not available
rows.Problem: Game booster feature in good lock is not available even after One UI 7.0 Update in my Samsung S24FE device. It is very worse than, with One UI 7.0, i lost Game Plugins features which were super awesome in One Ui 6.0 and now I feel like getting One Ui 6.0 back with gaming features.
rows.Summarized Problem: The game booster feature is unavailable in the good lock screen after the One UI 7.0 update, removing previously available gaming plugins.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing in a key functionality area but does not cause device crash or complete unavailability of core functions.

rows.Title: 5G network not latching in device
rows.Problem: After removing and reinserting the SIM card, the device does not show 5G signal, even though the user has a 5G plan and the area supports 5G. The device previously detected 5G before the UI update.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device fails to detect or maintain 5G network signal after SIM reinsertion, despite having a 5G plan and supported area.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial functionality (5G registration) that fails intermittently under specific conditions, but does not render the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: swipe up gesture not working for multi window
rows.Problem: The swipe up gesture for multi window isn't working and the button is freeze
rows.Summarized Problem: The swipe up gesture for multi window is not working and the button freezes after the update.
rows.Severity Reason: The gesture is completely non-functional and causes the button to freeze, making the multi-window feature unusable.

rows.Title: Test menu doesn't appear on entering *#0011# and Key input value
rows.Problem: The test menu does not appear when dialing *#0011# and entering key input. It shows an error. Occasionally it appears after clicking SIM 1, but no options work.
rows.Summarized Problem: The test menu fails to appear when accessing via *#0011# and key input, and when it appears, no options are functional.
rows.Severity Reason: The menu fails to load or function properly, but does not cause device crash or complete failure of core operations.
rows.R&D Comment: The attached logs do not capture the keystring failure scenario; Auto Blocker may be enabled, preventing key input.

rows.Title: Color Banding shown in captured Images
rows.Problem: Color banding persists in darker tones like red, green, and gray, especially when using certain apps.
