rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to display video content, rendering the media playback function unusable, which prevents users from viewing content.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue belongs to 3rd party application. It should be checked and fixed by 3rd  party application. We don't have source code, so we can't find root cause. Therefore, please consider it as a market issue.

rows.Title: Android Auto not working
rows.Problem: Android Auto not working
rows.Summarized Problem: Android Auto is not functioning properly on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a feature not working, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Android Auto app disabled in settings. Counter Measure: Users should disable the Android Auto app in settings to resolve.

rows.Title: Highlighting Not Visible in Exported PDF
rows.Problem: When a note is highlighted in Samsung Notes and exported as a PDF, the highlighted sections are either not visible at all or appear so faint that they are unreadable in most PDF viewers.
rows.Summarized Problem: Highlights are not visible or appear too faint when exporting notes to PDF in Samsung Notes.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the readability of highlighted content in exported PDFs, but does not cause device crash or data loss.

rows.Title: Unable to download the app in device
rows.Problem: Unable to download the app, tried all tips in feedback but still not working
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot download the WhatsApp app from the Google Play Store.
rows.Severity Reason: The app download fails consistently despite user attempts, indicating a major functional failure in the app store interface.
rows.R&D Comment: The error indicates Play consents failed to retrieve for a user account; sync failed due to credential re-entry needed. Recommendation: Guide users to clear Play Store cache and re-enter credentials.

rows.Title: Flickering lines appear while playing video in landscape mode
rows.Problem: Flickering lines appear when playing videos in landscape mode on Samsung A34 5G, observed in multiple apps including Netflix, JioHotStar, Crunchyroll, but not in YouTube or VLC. Issue occurs consistently after updating to One UI 7. No lines appear in portrait mode. Problem persists even in recovery mode.
rows.Summarized Problem: Flickering lines appear during video playback in landscape mode on Samsung A34 5G, affecting multiple apps and persisting post-One UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects video playback in multiple apps but does not cause device crash or data loss, and is intermittent or context-dependent.

rows.Title: Navigation bar not visible
rows.Problem: Navigation bar is not visible after system update, causing inconvenience
rows.Summarized Problem: The navigation bar is not visible after a system update, leading to user inconvenience.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of the UI, affecting usability but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue was caused by incorrect user ID value being sent as '0' in all cases; the fix has been implemented and a rel request has been raised - 49637

rows.Title: One UI Home isn’t responding
rows.Problem: The system crashes when trying to add apps to the Edge Panel with the message 'One UI Home isn’t responding'.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Edge Panel fails to respond when adding apps, causing system crashes.
rows.Severity Reason: The system crashes when attempting a basic function, making the device unusable for navigation and app management.
rows.R&D Comment: Problems occur because edge panel settings are accessible from Dex space.

rows.Title: Images are getting more saturated in the rear camera and are grainy in the front camera
rows.Problem: Images are getting more saturated in the rear camera and are grainy in the front camera
rows.Summarized Problem: Rear camera images become overly saturated, and front camera images are grainy under certain conditions.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects image quality but does not cause device crash or complete failure; it is intermittent and tied to temperature conditions.
rows.R&D Comment: Saturation occurs in rear camera during heat generation due to disabled HDR post-processing; user should be guided to wait until temperature drops.

rows.Title: Battery drain issue
rows.Problem: Abnormal battery drain occurs on Galaxy Watch 7 when idle, from 21% to 0% in one hour, despite AOD off, no third-party apps running, Bluetooth connected, and sleep tracking enabled. The issue is linked to a third-party app (WhatsApp) running in the background, consuming power continuously.
rows.Summarized Problem: Galaxy Watch 7 experiences rapid battery drain when idle, leading to complete shutdown within one hour despite minimal usage.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unusable within a short period, resulting in a complete shutdown during normal sleep, which is a critical failure in device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by WhatsApp running in the background and consuming power continuously. A countermeasure involves app-level power optimization, though Samsung has no control over third-party app behavior.

rows.Title: S Pen unexpectedly disconnects
rows.Problem: The S Pen unexpectedly disconnects when removed from the device and the device no longer recognizes it, even after reinsertion. The issue persists despite restarts; it is unclear whether it is software or hardware related.
rows.Summarized Problem: The S Pen disconnects immediately when removed and fails to reconnect, even after reinsertion.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to recognize the stylus after removal, rendering a key input function non-operational and affecting core usability.

rows.Title: Camera flickers and image/video gets blurred when zooming to 3x
rows.Problem: Camera flickers and image or video becomes blurred when zooming from 1x to 2.9x, suddenly clearing after reaching 3x zoom. The camera vibrates noticeably and user cannot zoom beyond 3x.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera image becomes blurred and flickers when zooming to 3x, with no ability to zoom beyond this point.
rows.Severity Reason: The user cannot zoom at all beyond 3x, rendering the camera function unusable for practical use.
rows.R&D Comment: The log and video do not match, making it impossible to verify, but it has been confirmed that the video was taken under indoor flicker light conditions. Under indoor flicker light conditions, the exposure was too short, causing flicker outside the flicker correction range, which is a normal occurrence.

rows.Title: UI issue in quick panel
rows.Problem: Notification cards are squeezed to a very compact size, causing volume and brightness bars to appear distorted
rows.Summarized Problem: Notification cards in the quick panel are too compact, distorting the volume and brightness bars.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects only visual presentation and does not impact device functionality or usability.

rows.Title: Network issue
rows.Problem: No 5G network despite being in a 5G area. 4G signal is weak with only 1 to 2 signal bars. Service provider confirms their side is fine. Troubleshooting including network reset has been tried with no improvement.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device fails to connect to 5G networks in areas where 5G is available, with only weak 4G signal, despite service provider confirming their side is normal.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial network functionality failure, with 5G not working and 4G signal being weak, but the device is still usable for basic operations.

rows.Title: Image quality is not good
rows.Problem: The ultra-wide lens image is blurry, while the main 1x lens image is clearer but still has poor quality.
rows.Summarized Problem: The ultra-wide lens camera produces blurry images, indicating poor image quality despite the main lens showing better clarity.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial functionality of the camera, where the ultra-wide lens does not deliver clear images, but the main lens still functions adequately.
rows.R&D Comment: The ultra-wide camera of the S24+ model is designed with FF (Fixed Focus) and does not support AF. This is a product design feature to ensure wide field of view and fast shooting, but image clarity varies with subject distance. Users should consider subject distance for better results.

rows.Title: Unable to set ANC and 360 Audio via Routine
rows.Problem: Unable to set the Galaxy Buds2 Pro ANC and 360 Audio via Routine. Please see the screen recording video for details.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot set ANC and 360 Audio features through routines on Galaxy Buds2 Pro.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely missing from routine settings, preventing users from configuring key audio settings.
rows.R&D Comment: Fix NoiseControl state, 360 audio, BoostLoudness icon in RoutineActionProvider; fix setup Noise control in Routine

rows.Title: Lag observed while opening quick panel
rows.Problem: User can use some parts of the screen but cannot open control panel sometimes
rows.Summarized Problem: The quick panel lags and fails to open reliably when users attempt to access it.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves intermittent failure to open a core control panel, affecting usability but not rendering the device unusable.

rows.Title: Unable to play YouTube 4K videos in 60fps
rows.Problem: YouTube 4K videos in 60fps automatically change to maximum 480p resolution when played
rows.Summarized Problem: YouTube fails to play 4K 60fps videos and automatically downgrades to 480p resolution.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot handle 4K 60fps content due to hardware limitations, resulting in complete failure of high-resolution video playback, which is a major functional failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The Exynos 1380 chipset only supports 4K at 30fps; 4K 60fps videos cause codec errors, and YouTube application handles the error by limiting resolution to 480p. The issue is application-level, not hardware, but the result is a major functional failure.

rows.Title: Connected Hotspot shows no internet
rows.Problem: When other users use my hotspot it shows no internet on their mobile but I have much speed and mobile data. I see all settings but no settings applied & after restarting my mobile they get the internet. So I request you to solve the issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: Hotspot connection fails for other devices, showing no internet despite available data and speed, with issue resolved after device restart.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction where internet connectivity is not applied to devices using the hotspot, but functionality returns after restart.
rows.R&D Comment: Please ask the customer to attach the logs of the client device in which it shows internet is not available

rows.Title: Closing notification shows processing popup
rows.Problem: Closing notification shows processing popup and cannot open any app while swiping notification panel
rows.Summarized Problem: Closing a notification triggers a processing popup that prevents opening apps and interacting with the notification panel.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents app access during notification interaction but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Lag in SmartThings App
rows.Problem: Device Management option in SmartThings app no longer opens when tapped, though it still appears in the menu.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Device Management feature in the SmartThings app no longer opens when tapped, despite still being visible in the menu.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially malfunctioning but still visible, preventing full device access rather than rendering the app unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Thank you for reporting the issue. This issue is scheduled to be fixed in the next update. The next update is planned for mid-August.

rows.Title: Weak 5G network issue
rows.Problem: Facing weak 5G network issue since device purchase. Tried all troubleshooting and Samsung Remote Management Service, still issue persists. Screenshot shows 4G logo while 5G is selected.
rows.Summarized Problem: Device shows 4G logo while 5G is selected, indicating weak or absent 5G signal despite selection.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial failure in 5G connectivity, which persists after troubleshooting but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.

rows.Title: Call gets disconnected automatically while on another call
rows.Problem: Call disconnection issue while on another call
rows.Summarized Problem: Calls get disconnected automatically when a user is already on another call.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from making or receiving calls during active calls, leading to device usability failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Wireless Android Auto keeps disconnecting
rows.Problem: Wireless Android Auto repeatedly disconnects on Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5 with Tata Safari 2022; wired connection and Google Pixel work fine; user has tried all standard troubleshooting steps
rows.Summarized Problem: Wireless Android Auto disconnects repeatedly on Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5 in Tata Safari 2
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of a feature in a specific device combination, not causing device unavailability or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: There is a routine set related to android_auto_mode wherein wifi settings are being modified. If user does not want this behavior, pls modify android_auto_mode routine.

rows.Title: My Files keeps auto closing
rows.Problem: The My Files Application keeps closing again and again making it impossible to access any documents. I have cleared the cache and have updated the app to the latest version but the issue persists.
rows.Summarized Problem: The My Files app repeatedly closes, preventing users from accessing their documents despite cache clearing and app updates.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes repeatedly, making it unusable and preventing access to essential documents.
rows.R&D Comment: Added exception handling for non-hierarchical URI; users should rename and restore the Downloads folder to clear corrupted download_uri data.

rows.Title: Unable to log in to Samsung Max VPN
rows.Problem: Unable to log in to Samsung Max VPN; shows error 'Check your internet connection' even though internet works for other apps
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot log in to Samsung Max VPN despite having a working internet connection.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a specific app failing to connect under normal network conditions, indicating a partial malfunction rather than a full device failure.

rows.Title: Instagram content doesn't display
rows.Problem: Content from Instagram is not showing even though the Hide Content toggle is off, despite reinstalling the app
rows.Summarized Problem: Instagram content is not displaying in the secure folder despite the Hide Content toggle being off.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of content visibility in a secure folder, not full app failure or device crash.

rows.Title: Voice input not working
rows.Problem: Mic not showing when turned on, despite voice-to-text conversion being enabled
rows.Summarized Problem: Voice input fails to activate despite mic being turned on and voice-to-text conversion being enabled.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of the voice input function, where the feature is not properly visible or responsive, but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: User must enable keyboard button on navigation bar and press and hold to select voice input; settings configuration is required for functionality.

rows.Title: Lag observed in the device
rows.Problem: Tab S9 FE Plus hang during high performance tasks
rows.Summarized Problem: The device exhibits lag during high performance tasks, causing a hang in the Tab S9 FE Plus.
rows.Severity Reason: The device hangs during high-performance tasks, making it unusable for performance-intensive operations.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Device undergoing preload class creation with high memory usage; Counter Measure: Provide CP silent logs for further analysis.

rows.Title: rapid battery drain
rows.Problem: The Samsung S24 Plus exhibits a rapid battery drain, decreasing from 10% to 1% in a short timeframe, resulting in significantly reduced battery lifespan and a technical anomaly that appears to be caused by heavy load in low voltage state triggering a rapid SOC drop.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences rapid battery drain, dropping from 10% to
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drains extremely quickly, leading to device unusability within minutes and a significant reduction in battery lifespan.
rows.R&D Comment: When heavy load occurs in low voltage state, voltage drops to Vempty level, causing rapid SOC decrease; if SOC drops rapidly without usage, users should visit service center for battery inspection.

rows.Title: Noise control didn't get changed
rows.Problem: Galaxy Buds FE noise cancellation mode not changing during calls, touch control toggles automatically but noise control remains unchanged. Cache clearing did not resolve issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: Noise cancellation mode does not activate during calls on Galaxy Buds FE.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to work during calls, but the device remains usable overall with partial functionality.

rows.Title: VoLTE not working
rows.Problem: VoLTE and WiFi calling options are not available despite enabling IMS TS32 profile in Developer Options. Device shows VoLTE, Video Calling, and WiFi Calling provisioned as HIDE in Phone Info.
rows.Summarized Problem: VoLTE is not functioning on the device despite proper provisioning and enabling of IMS TS32 profile.
rows.Severity Reason: VoLTE is a core connectivity feature; its failure prevents voice calling over data, rendering the device unusable for basic communication.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Device loses network when NR is selected
rows.Problem: Device loses all network connection when NR Only (5G Only Mode) is selected, showing "No Service" immediately
rows.Summarized Problem: The device loses all network connection when NR Only (5G Only Mode) is selected, showing "No Service" immediately.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to maintain network connection in a critical mode (NR Only), rendering it unusable for calls or data.

rows.Title: Voice recorder not working
rows.Problem: The voice recorder does not record speech when not connected to earphones, and fails to record what is spoken.
rows.Summarized Problem: The voice recorder fails to record audio when not connected to earphones.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature works only under specific conditions (earphone connection), indicating partial malfunction rather than complete failure or device unusability.
rows.R&D Comment: Customer is advised to self-test; provide CP silent logs for further analysis.

rows.Title: Camera failed pop up occurred
rows.Problem: Video camera error
rows.Summarized Problem: Video camera function fails with sensor ID mismatch and I2C failure during initialization.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera fails to initialize due to sensor ID mismatch and I2C failure, preventing video capture entirely, making the device unusable for core photography functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Sensor ID mismatch (expected 0x754, received 0x0) and I2C failure in imx754 sensor; Countermeasure: Replace rear tele2 10x+ camera sensor module (0x34 slave address).

rows.Title: Lag in camera
rows.Problem: Lag observed in camera during use
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera exhibits lag during operation.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of camera performance, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Actuator error detected in logs; no other issues found. Countermeasure: Reboot device and capture logs upon issue reproduction.

rows.Title: Files folder crashing
rows.Problem: Download section of Files folder is crashing for a long time with no changes made
rows.Summarized Problem: The download section of the Files folder crashes repeatedly without any user changes.
rows.Severity Reason: The download section crashes repeatedly, making a core functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Added exception handling for non-hierarchical URI; users should rename and restore the Downloads folder to clear corrupted download_uri data.

rows.Title: Telegram not updating
rows.Problem: Telegram pro profile picture does not load; issue persists after factory hard reset and across different 5G networks
rows.Summarized Problem: Telegram fails to load profile pictures, even after factory reset and across network changes.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects a specific feature but does not render the device unusable or cause system crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Unable to uninstall some apps
rows.Problem: Cannot uninstall apps
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot uninstall certain apps on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The inability to uninstall apps prevents users from managing their device storage and functionality, making the system unusable for core operations.

rows.Title: WhatsApp images, documents, and videos folder not showing in gallery
rows.Problem: WhatsApp images, documents, and videos folder is not showing in gallery. User has been facing this issue for many days and cannot find WhatsApp media in gallery.
rows.Summarized Problem: WhatsApp images, documents, and videos folder is not visible in the gallery app.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the ability to view media from WhatsApp in the gallery, but does not cause device crash or data loss, and can be resolved through user settings.
rows.R&D Comment: Check Media Visibility Settings: Open WhatsApp > Settings > Chats > Chat Backup to ensure Include Videos and Auto Backup are enabled. Verify gallery settings to include WhatsApp media in view.

rows.Title: Samsung Wallet not working
rows.Problem: Samsung Wallet not working on device and unwanted background activities running continuously without disable options, affecting performance.
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung Wallet is not functioning on the device and several background services run continuously without disable options, impacting performance.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing and critical background services are running continuously, leading to poor device performance and usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Samsung Wallet logs are not present in the attach dumpstate. Please ask customer to download wallet from the galaxy store and share logs if issue is present.

rows.Title: Screen recorder missing from quick panel
rows.Problem: Screen recorder feature is missing from quick panel and settings advanced features on Galaxy A23 with One UI 6.1 and Android 14
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen recorder feature is missing from the quick panel and settings advanced features.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is not available in key access locations, preventing users from easily recording screen content, but the device remains otherwise usable.

rows.Title: Error faced while changing clock style for lockscreen
rows.Problem: Same lock screen error
rows.Summarized Problem: Users encounter an error when attempting to change the clock style on the lock screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The error prevents users from customizing the clock style, which is a partial malfunction of a functional feature.

rows.Title: Bixby not working
rows.Problem: Bixby is not working on galaxy device
rows.Summarized Problem: Bixby voice functionality is not working on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely unavailable, preventing user from using a core assistant function.
rows.R&D Comment: A Wakeup Register Error occurred, but no related logs were found in the attached file. Please try registering again from scratch and report the issue immediately after it occurs, with the proper logs included.

rows.Title: Device asking for password after restart when pin set
rows.Problem: Device asks for password after restart despite having a PIN set; user unable to unlock without losing data or personal information
rows.Summarized Problem: Device asks for password after restart when a PIN is set, preventing user from unlocking the device without data loss.
rows.Severity Reason: Device is unable to unlock after restart, which prevents user access to personal data and renders the device unusable.

rows.Title: Mobile data not working
rows.Problem: All settings have been tried but problem not solved
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile data connectivity is not working despite all settings being configured.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction where settings are applied but connectivity remains unresolved.

rows.Title: Whatsapp image video section not showing in gallery
rows.Problem: After the new update in gallery no whatsapp sections is showing a bug need to be fix
rows.Summarized Problem: WhatsApp image and video sections are not appearing in the gallery after the update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction where a specific content section is missing, but the overall gallery functionality remains usable.

rows.Title: One drive files not showing in my files
rows.Problem: The OneDrive files are not showing in My Files. I have checked there is no connectivity or login issue. The OneDrive application on the phone is working fine and shows all the files. Never faced this issue earlier.
rows.Summarized Problem: OneDrive files are not visible in the My Files section despite being accessible in the OneDrive app.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction where files are missing from a specific view but are accessible elsewhere, indicating a display or sync issue rather than full device failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Fix to sync logic to update folders and files list. - August App update.

rows.Title: Unable to turn on mobile hotspot
rows.Problem: mobile hotspot not working when turned on; it instantly turns off in 5GHz band only
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile hotspot turns off instantly when turned on in 5GHz band only.
rows.Severity Reason: The hotspot fails to remain active, causing users to lose internet sharing capability, which renders a key network function unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: WiFi bus is in suspend state during hotspot activation; Counter Measure: Same as cause, indicating a system-level suspend issue during interface start.

rows.Title: Mobile data not working
rows.Problem: Mobile data is not working despite correct settings; device has relied on Wi-Fi for three months.
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile data is not functioning despite correct settings, forcing reliance on Wi-Fi.
rows.Severity Reason: Device is unusable for internet access without mobile data, leading to significant functional limitation.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue. Counter Measure: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Different date is showing in the picture
rows.Problem: The Gallery app fails to sort images and videos by their metadata dates, showing photos taken on 09th July 2025 under today's date (16th July 2025). This issue persists after cache clearing, device restart, and wiping cache partition, and affects multiple images and videos.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Gallery app incorrectly displays images based on metadata dates, showing photos taken on one date under a different, later date.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes incorrect sorting of media by date, affecting user experience but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes or data loss.

rows.Title: Camera failed
rows.Problem: The camera failed after official software update. Previously both sides of the camera did not work, now only one side works in third-party apps but not in Samsung camera app.
rows.Summarized Problem: The rear camera is not functioning properly in the Samsung Camera app after a software update, working only in third-party apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The rear camera fails to operate in the primary camera app, rendering a key functionality unusable and preventing users from taking photos with the official app.
rows.R&D Comment: I2C error detected in logs; possible rear camera hardware fault. Recommend reboot and, if persistent, service center evaluation.

rows.Title: Need to on/off aeroplane mode to use mobile data
rows.Problem: UI bug or network issue prevents access to mobile data; user must toggle airplane mode multiple times to connect to internet after switching from Wi-Fi. Reset, SIM change, and other troubleshooting steps do not resolve the issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users must repeatedly toggle airplane mode to access mobile data after switching from Wi-Fi, indicating a network connection or UI issue.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents consistent access to mobile data, making internet usage unreliable and disrupting core device functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Whatsapp icon aligned incorrectly on home screen
rows.Problem: Whatsapp icon aligned incorrectly on home screen
rows.Summarized Problem: The WhatsApp icon is misaligned on the home screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the visual layout but does not prevent device usage or cause functional failure.

rows.Title: Phone randomly freeze
rows.Problem: The phone randomly freezes and no buttons or gestures work on any screen, including notification panel and recent apps. Only force restart resolves the issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone randomly freezes, making no interface elements functional until a force restart.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes completely unresponsive, preventing user interaction with any interface elements.
rows.R&D Comment: FATAL Exception in Google Play Store app due to unsupported offset; Google needs to investigate as sources are encrypted.

rows.Title: Bixby Basic Commands Installation Issue
rows.Problem: Bixby prompts users to install Basic Commands for simple tasks, but the installation link redirects to Samsung website with no download option
rows.Summarized Problem: Bixby fails to install Basic Commands due to missing download option on Samsung website
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot complete basic Bixby functionality due to missing installation option, but the core system remains usable

rows.Title: Login to Samsung Wallet
rows.Problem: Unable to login to Samsung Wallet for the last week. No solution from Samsung support. Cannot determine if issue is server-side or app blocked.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot log in to Samsung Wallet after a week, with no resolution from support or clear cause.
rows.Severity Reason: Users are unable to access a core feature, preventing use of the wallet functionality entirely.

rows.Title: Navigation bar overlaps or gets cropped in apps
rows.Problem: Navigation bar overlaps or gets cropped in apps like Google Pay and SBI
rows.Summarized Problem: The navigation bar overlaps or gets cropped in certain apps, affecting user interface visibility.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects app interface visibility but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.

rows.Title: Unable to View OneDrive Files in My Files App
rows.Problem: Unable to view any of my OneDrive files or folders in the My Files app after signing in.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot view their OneDrive files or folders in the My Files app after signing in.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a core feature (file viewing) within the app, preventing access to stored files but not causing device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Fix to sync logic to update folders and files list. - August App update.

rows.Title: Edited videos not supporting in Samsung gallery
rows.Problem: Edited videos are not supported in Samsung Gallery; videos encoded at 3840x2160@60fps are not playable due to hardware limitations.
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung Gallery does not support high-resolution videos edited at 3840x2160@60fps, showing 'video codec not supported' error.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot view or play edited videos, rendering a core functionality of the My Files module unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The platform S5E8535 (Exynos 1330) supports only up to 1920x1080@150; videos at 3840x2160@60fps exceed hardware limits, causing unsupported playback.

rows.Title: Can't View One Drive Folders Or Can't Sync Add New Folders In One Drive In Samsung My Files App
rows.Problem: Can't view One Drive folders or can't sync, add new folders in One Drive in Samsung My Files app
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot view, sync, or add new folders in One Drive within the Samsung My Files app.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot perform basic folder operations in One Drive, which impacts functionality but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Fix to sync logic to update folders and files list. - August App update.

rows.Title: Screenshot not working in palm gesture
rows.Problem: Palm gesture for screenshot is not working properly after latest UI update
rows.Summarized Problem: Palm gesture for taking screenshots is not working after the latest UI update.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing or not functioning correctly, but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: No swipe detected in logs; user must swipe from left to right. Missing timestamp logs prevent root cause analysis.

rows.Title: Delay observe while switching Front& Back Camera
rows.Problem: Switching between front camera and back camera is taking a lot of time on Galaxy S23.
rows.Summarized Problem: Switching between front and back cameras on Galaxy S23 takes an excessive amount of time.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera switch delay is significant but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.

rows.Title: Camera Freeze
rows.Problem: Camera application freezes when opening pro video mode and clicking mic options, showing "camera application has been stopped" after Android 7.0 update. Issue persists after resets and reboots, returns after 5 minutes.
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera application freezes when entering pro video mode and clicking mic options, leading to app stop and loss of functionality.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera application completely stops functioning, making it unusable during video recording, which is a core feature.

rows.Title: Clock Alignment on Lock Screen
rows.Problem: Lock screen clock alignment issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The clock on the lock screen is misaligned.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the visual presentation of the clock but does not prevent device usage or cause functional failure.

rows.Title: Camera app crashes when 5G enabled
rows.Problem: Camera app crashes and shows 'Camera server error occurred' when 5G is enabled on Galaxy S23 Ultra, but works fine on 4G.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera app crashes and displays a server error when 5G is enabled, but functions correctly on 4G.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera app crashes completely when 5G is enabled, making the feature unusable under normal conditions.
rows.R&D Comment: The defect occurred due to a hardware factor and requires visiting an AS center to check the set.

rows.Title: Phone getting lag and doesn't work anything
rows.Problem: Phone suddenly gets lag and doesn't work properly, even after restart. The issue persists and phone gets stuck with some options working and some not.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone experiences sudden and persistent lag, causing partial or complete unresponsiveness during use.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unresponsive and fails to function properly, making it unusable for basic operations.
rows.R&D Comment: Hostapd has a null pointer exception; this issue is identical to P250714-07628 and requires Samsung to investigate.

rows.Title: Camera is taking blurry pictures
rows.Problem: My camera is not taking normal pictures ... makes pictures blurry. Looking i am using the basic budget phone under 8k. See the shady pictures , blurred , not clear. I did already all these steps. Lens is clear , phone is updated . Still not clicking good pictures
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera is producing blurry images despite being updated and with a clean lens.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera fails to capture clear images, but basic functionality remains intact and does not cause device crash or complete failure.
rows.R&D Comment: There seems to be a problem with the quality of your camera. However, we did not find any software defects in the image and log you sent us. First, I suspect camera window dirt or oil. Please check if the same phenomenon occurs even if you wipe the window cleanly. Nevertheless, if the same phenomenon is repeated, it seems that moisture caused by condensation inside the camera window has occurred. This needs to be replaced at the s

rows.Title: Unable to update google play services
rows.Problem: I am not able to update the google play services even though it is showing "failed to update ". Please fix this issue
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot update Google Play Services, with the update process failing and showing a "failed to update" message.
rows.Severity Reason: The update failure prevents essential app functionality from being maintained, impacting core system services.
rows.R&D Comment: The error INSTALL_FAILED_VERIFICATION_FAILURE indicates a failure in creating an Apex Verity device during installation; countermeasure includes checking storage and network connectivity, with potential need for firmware-level fix.

rows.Title: Rotate to landscape mode option is not working in portrait mode
rows.Problem: Landscape rotation has not working in S24 ultra since last 2 months. The reporter has not been able to fix this bug with customer technician. iOS screenshots and recordings are of better quality than Samsung's.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device does not allow rotation to landscape mode when in portrait orientation.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing in a key user interaction flow, preventing normal device usage but does not cause device crash or data loss.

rows.Title: Fingerprint unlock not recognizing
rows.Problem: Fingerprint unlocking not working after successful registration; attempts to deregister and re-register fail
rows.Summarized Problem: Fingerprint unlock fails after successful registration, even after attempting to deregister and re-register.
rows.Severity Reason: The fingerprint unlock function is not working after registration, but the registration itself is successful, indicating a partial malfunction in the unlock workflow.

rows.Title: Blur effect missing in YouTube navigation bar
rows.Problem: Blur effect on YouTube navigation bar is missing; previously had frosted-glass blur behind Home, Shorts, and Library buttons, now shows solid color with no transparency.
rows.Summarized Problem: The blur effect on the YouTube app's navigation bar is missing, showing only a solid color instead of a frosted-glass transparent effect.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual appearance but does not prevent app functionality or cause device instability.

rows.Title: Voice assistant sound coming as robotic
rows.Problem: Voice assistant sound is very bad during voice search on YouTube, caller name announcements, and maps
rows.Summarized Problem: The voice assistant produces robotic and distorted sounds during various functions like YouTube voice search, caller name announcements, and maps.
rows.Severity Reason: The voice output is severely degraded, leading to poor user experience and potential miscommunication during critical interactions.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by improper functionality of the Google TTS app; the developer must handle the thread condition properly, as this is a 3rd party app with no Samsung involvement in development.

rows.Title: System UI crashing issue
rows.Problem: I already sent it earlier as well. However still sending it again.
rows.Summarized Problem: The System UI is crashing on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The system UI crashing makes the device unusable and prevents normal operation.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by UFS link layer errors, and the countermeasure is to guide users to visit the customer service center to check the device's hardware (AP or UFS component) for signal and power integrity issues.

rows.Title: Network issue
rows.Problem: Mobile data randomly drops on Galaxy M35 5G, network icon disappears, internet unavailable for a few seconds, then reconnects to 2G and switches back to 5G/4
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile data randomly drops and reconnects on Galaxy M35 5G, causing intermittent internet loss.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent loss of connectivity but does not completely disable device functionality or result in data loss.

rows.Title: Landscape mode not working
rows.Problem: Landscape mode not working on home screen and app drawer; toggle for enabling landscape mode is greyed out and unresponsive
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot enable or use landscape mode on the home screen and app drawer due to a greyed-out toggle that is unresponsive.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially missing and prevents normal device usage in landscape orientation, but does not cause device crash or data loss.

rows.Title: Call does not connect after accepting incoming call
rows.Problem: When an incoming call is accepted, there is no response or the call does not connect for 3-4 seconds. This problem occurs after the recent system update.
rows.Summarized Problem: After accepting an incoming call, the device fails to connect or shows no response for 3-4 seconds.
rows.Severity Reason: The call connection fails intermittently after a system update, affecting functionality but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Screen Not Showing Properly in Portrait Mode
rows.Problem: Screen is displaying half when in portrait mode, affecting usability and causing device unavailability for daily use.
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen displays only half of the content when in portrait mode, making it unusable.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unusable in portrait mode due to incomplete screen display, preventing normal operation.

rows.Title: camera doesn't get open
rows.Problem: My camera doesn't get open, it gets black and sometimes stuck on one object even though the camera points on other object. The issue still persists even after performing above task
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera fails to open and displays a black screen, sometimes getting stuck on a single object despite pointing at others.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera fails to open and displays a black screen, which prevents basic functionality and renders the device unusable for photography.
rows.R&D Comment: CSIS errors occurred during stream on of rear wide sensor. Please reach out to Samsung service center and ask for HW analysis. Analysis needs to be done on IMX906 sensor module also AP S5e8855.

rows.Title: Lag observed while playing YT video
rows.Problem: Phone pauses while playing videos, gets heated, freezes, and stops responding with no buttons or touches working, then shuts off
rows.Summarized Problem: Device lags and freezes during video playback, causing the phone to heat up, stop responding, and eventually shut off.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes completely unresponsive during video playback, leading to a full freeze and potential loss of device functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Device rebooted but no codec issues found; requires input-output dumps and synchronized logs for further analysis. Issue not reproducible on Sherlock.

rows.Title: Now Brief option in Lock Screen is not showing
rows.Problem: The Now Brief option in lock screen is not showing up and it only shows when music is playing; all notifications and tips are blocked.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Brief feature on the lock screen does not display when no music is playing and blocks all notifications and tips.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature failure prevents users from seeing notifications and tips, rendering the lock screen functionally incomplete and unusable.

rows.Title: Video playback green screen and screen hang
rows.Problem: After updating to Android 15, UI 7, during video playback for about 15 minutes, green screen appears, screen pauses, and device hangs. After restart, device resumes.
rows.Summarized Problem: During video playback, a green screen appears followed by screen pause and device hang after 15 minutes of use.
rows.Severity Reason: The device hangs during video playback, rendering it unusable for video content, which is a major functional failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Root cause: potential memory leak due to reference counting or resource leaks during buffer handling. Solution: explicitly release buffer before freeing to prevent memory leaks and refcount mismatches. Verify CL#31882965 and CL#31883115 in next release.

rows.Title: Stop Watch still running even stopped clock app in active app section
rows.Problem: The stop watch continues to run in the background after the clock app is closed or stopped, even when the app is not active or in the recents tab.
rows.Summarized Problem: The stopwatch continues to run in the background after the clock app is closed or stopped.
rows.Severity Reason: The stopwatch remains active in the background despite being stopped, which is a partial malfunction of the app's intended behavior.

rows.Title: Lag on swiping down notification Panel upon unlocking
rows.Problem: The phone experiences lag when waking up and unlocking, with the notification panel stuttering heavily right after unlock. Fingerprint and face unlock also freeze for 2–3 seconds. The Lift to Wake gesture works only about 50% of the time. These issues affect daily usability.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device lags significantly when unlocking and swiping down to open the notification panel, with stuttering and freezes during the unlock process.
rows.Severity Reason: The lag and freezes during unlock severely impact daily usability, making the device feel unresponsive and unreliable.
rows.R&D Comment: The system is busy and operates slowly due to Android performance constraints; background apps should be shut down if not in use.

rows.Title: Pen not working properly
rows.Problem: Writing tools are useless; toggles don't turn on and one that is on doesn't work properly. Pointer assistant and pen nib don't work well, making it difficult to study.
rows.Summarized Problem: The S Pen writing tools and associated features are not functioning properly, making note-taking difficult.
rows.Severity Reason: The pen is a primary input tool for note-taking, and its failure prevents core functionality during study sessions.

rows.Title: USB Earphones Not Working for Calls
rows.Problem: USB-C earphones do not work for calls; audio defaults to tablet speaker and there is no USB audio or headset option during calls. Microphone also does not work.
rows.Summarized Problem: USB-C earphones fail to function during calls, with no audio or microphone options available via USB.
rows.Severity Reason: Call functionality is completely broken for USB earphones, preventing users from making or receiving calls through earphones.
rows.R&D Comment: Call over USB headset is not supported; device only supports 3.5mm headset for calls.

rows.Title: Taskbar overlaps
rows.Problem: Taskbar stays stuck after exiting an app, overlays other elements, and does not respond to taps; touch input is registered by icons behind it. Fix needed: taskbar should auto-hide or be interactive.
rows.Summarized Problem: The taskbar remains stuck after app exit and does not respond to taps, causing usability issues.
rows.Severity Reason: The taskbar is unresponsive and overlays content, but does not completely prevent use or cause device failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue was not reproduced in the newest version of Homescreen 16.0.9.29. Please help to check for latest update.

rows.Title: Optical Image Stabilization is no longer working
rows.Problem: The Optical Image Stabilization (OIS) is no longer working after the latest software update. Attempts to fix via clearing camera app data, wiping cache, and safe mode have failed.
rows.Summarized Problem: Optical Image Stabilization is no longer functioning after a software update, despite troubleshooting attempts.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely non-functional after an update, rendering a core camera function unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue appears to be due to vertical movement exceeding correction margins; testing is needed for general walking scenarios and video stabilization in similar movements.

rows.Title: Quick Panel color changed automatically
rows.Problem: Quick Panel shows yellowish tint automatically
rows.Summarized Problem: The Quick Panel displays a yellowish tint unexpectedly.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue is a visual anomaly that does not affect device usability or core functionality.

rows.Title: apps not visible on app drawer
rows.Problem: some apps are not visible on samsung app drawer and this issue occurs frequently
rows.Summarized Problem: Some apps are missing from the Samsung app drawer, making it difficult to locate and launch them.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial visibility of apps, affecting usability but not rendering the device unusable or causing crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: The missing app icons are likely due to app uninstalls; users can manually clean up pages in the app drawer to restore visibility.

rows.Title: Now bar not working
rows.Problem: Now bar is not visible or working properly; music plays in background but does not show in now bar. Glitches occur after UI 7.0 update.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Bar on the Lock Screen is not displaying music playback, despite background music playing.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is not working at all, preventing users from seeing real-time music playback on the lock screen, which is a core functionality.

rows.Title: faces not shown in search
rows.Problem: Battery protection turned off during long charging; new photos not separated; device shows no response to photo analysis
rows.Summarized Problem: Photos taken during long charging sessions are not being recognized or separated in the gallery search function.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot find newly captured photos, making the gallery function unusable for basic photo retrieval.
rows.R&D Comment: Database may be corrupted due to prolonged idle charging; recommend clearing app data to restart analysis.

rows.Title: Wi-Fi toggle not working
rows.Problem: Wi-Fi on off function not working, many Samsung mobiles have same issue after last update
rows.Summarized Problem: The Wi-Fi toggle function is not working properly on devices, affecting basic connectivity.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of network functionality but does not render the device unusable or result in data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue has been fixed in the latest update; no further action required.

rows.Title: Gemini not working
rows.Problem: Gemini not working properly on newly purchased S25 device. Unable to set alarms or reminders with action failed as shown in attached image.
rows.Summarized Problem: Gemini feature is not functioning on the S25 device, preventing users from setting alarms or reminders.
rows.Severity Reason: Users are unable to set alarms or reminders, which are essential daily functions, making the device unusable for basic use cases.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: resultCode 2000 (ERROR_SYSTEM_ERROR) indicates a system-level failure during execution. Countermeasure: Issue not reproducible; requires latest logs and binary for further investigation.

rows.Title: Blue screen when launching Message app
rows.Problem: Message app shows a blue screen when opened, followed by messages. Issue started after UI 7.0 update.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Android Messages app displays a blue screen when launched, before showing messages.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a visual glitch during app launch but does not prevent the app from functioning fully after the initial screen.

rows.Title: Picture has redish tint when captured in 2x
rows.Problem: Pictures appear dull in 2x but normal in 1.9x; redish tint occurs in 2x but not in pro mode
rows.Summarized Problem: Photos captured in 2x have a redish tint and appear dull, unlike in 1.9x or pro mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects image quality in a specific zoom setting but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes.

rows.Title: Object eraser not working
rows.Problem: Object eraser is not working at all. It is stuck at "Finding suggestions for what to erase". The AI suggestion feature is not working and there is no option to turn off these suggestions. User cannot use the object eraser at all.
rows.Summarized Problem: The object eraser feature is stuck and unable to function due to a memory handling error in AI suggestion processing.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely non-functional and prevents user from using the photo editor core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue occurred due to a memory handling error in AI suggestion processing, which will be fixed in the next software update.

rows.Title: Lag observed while switching camera from rear to front
rows.Problem: Switching to front camera in photo mode is quite slow
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera switches from rear to front mode experience significant lag.
rows.Severity Reason: The lag severely impacts user experience during basic camera operation, making it difficult to use the camera function effectively.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: MIPI error indicates faulty camera connector or defective camera module. Countermeasure: Service center reassembly or replacement of camera module.

rows.Title: Sim1 slot as Vodafone shows under sim2 in sim manager
rows.Problem: Sim1 inserted as Vodafone shows under sim2 in sim manager section, but should show sim1 as vodafone and sim2 as jio. Issue occurs in about phone and sim manager, not in phone diagnostic. Device correctly identifies sim1 as vodafone when switched, suggesting sim manager mislabels slots.
rows.Summarized Problem: Sim manager incorrectly displays the SIM1 (Vodafone) under SIM2 slot instead of showing it correctly in the SIM1 position.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects user interface consistency but does not cause device malfunction or data loss; it is a partial UI mislabeling that impacts usability.
rows.Resolve Type: Product Requirement, UX Guide, Standard Technical Specification
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is due to incorrect labeling in the SIM manager UI, and the countermeasure is to follow the naming convention that assigns 'SIM 1' to the first inserted SIM regardless of slot number.

rows.Title: Network problem
rows.Problem: Network issue causes game stick to stuck and joy stick cannot be moved; software problem reported
rows.Summarized Problem: A network issue causes the game to become unresponsive and the joy stick to become stuck.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents user interaction with the game, rendering the device unusable during gameplay.

rows.Title: Bluetooth headset media audio does not play
rows.Problem: Bluetooth headset connects successfully but media audio does not play. Only clicking sound is heard. Media audio is ON in settings, but no output. Headset works fine on other devices. Issue started after latest update on Galaxy A15. Media audio is delayed every second during Google Meet usage.
rows.Summarized Problem: Bluetooth headset connects but fails to play media audio, only producing a clicking sound, with audio delay during Google Meet.
rows.Severity Reason: User cannot hear media audio through Bluetooth, rendering the feature unusable in real-world scenarios.
rows.R&D Comment: There is no log for BT connection state or media playback; proper logs must be provided for analysis. Report issue immediately to capture logs at the time of occurrence.

rows.Title: Camera not working properly
rows.Problem: Camera focus issue occurs almost every time, especially in specific apps, and is very annoying. Same issue persists across devices.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera consistently fails to focus properly, especially in specific apps, leading to a poor user experience.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of camera functionality but does not render the device unusable or result in data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue likely stems from software-specific camera handling; if it occurs only in third-party apps, it may be a software compatibility issue. A hardware defect check is recommended if the problem persists in Samsung's basic camera app.

rows.Title: Lag observed while locking the screen
rows.Problem: The screen shows a slight stutter or lag when pressing the lock screen button, then locks.
rows.Summarized Problem: The lock screen experience exhibits a noticeable stutter or lag when the user presses the power button.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a noticeable delay in screen locking but does not prevent device operation or cause data loss.

rows.Title: slight jitter in the animations while switching the apps
rows.Problem: There is a slight jitter in the animations while switching the apps and a flash after i stop
rows.Summarized Problem: Animations exhibit slight jitter and flash when switching apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects app switching smoothness but does not cause device failure or data loss.

rows.Title: Screen turned complete orange
rows.Problem: Screen turned completely orange after software update and watch became non-functional
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen turned completely orange after a software update, rendering the device non-functional.
rows.Severity Reason: The device became completely non-functional after the update, preventing any use of the watch.

rows.Title: Camera color tint issue
rows.Problem: Photos have orangish and yellowish tones that are not natural
rows.Summarized Problem: Photos appear with unnatural orangish and yellowish tones due to color tint issues in the camera.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects photo appearance but does not cause device malfunction or data loss, and only occurs under specific lighting conditions.
rows.R&D Comment: AWB algorithm expresses optimal color based on environment, but current S23 tuning causes unnatural color tints; ongoing improvements aim to reduce this impact.

rows.Title: Sim not recognised
rows.Problem: Emergency call only shows hoo raha hai after inserting sim
rows.Summarized Problem: Emergency calls show 'hoo raha hai' after sim insertion, indicating sim not recognised.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to establish emergency call functionality after sim insertion, rendering a critical feature inoperable.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Distorted pixels on lock screen
rows.Problem: Distorted pixels appear for a split second during an incoming call, especially when the device is under load or multitasking, often flashing on part of the screen.
rows.Summarized Problem: Distorted pixels appear briefly on the lock screen during high device usage or calls.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes visual glitches during normal use but does not prevent device operation or cause system crashes.

rows.Title: Mobile data not working
rows.Problem: The 5G and 4G network is worst in this device Samsung A55 Could you fix it or its permanent? Don't give me aa nonsense suggestions after this feedback if you can fix then I'm Leaving this device soon
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile data connectivity is poor or non-functional on the device, affecting 5G and 4G network performance.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to establish or maintain mobile data connections, which renders basic communication functions unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Bixby cannot send messages through several apps when set to US English
rows.Problem: Bixby cannot send messages through several apps when set to US English. Every time I ask it to send a WhatsApp message, it asks for permission to change language to Indian English.
rows.Summarized Problem: Bixby fails to send messages through apps when set to US English and prompts users to change to Indian English instead.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely broken under specific language settings, preventing core functionality (message sending) from working.
rows.R&D Comment: Video is not attached. Issue is not clear. So, we cannot analyse the issue. Please attach new logs and video in sync.

rows.Title: Wi-Fi sharing not working
rows.Problem: Previously able to use Wi-Fi and Mobile Hotspot simultaneously to share internet, now this feature no longer works
rows.Summarized Problem: Wi-Fi sharing feature is disabled and no longer functional, preventing simultaneous use of Wi-Fi and mobile hotspot to share internet.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is currently disabled, leading to partial functionality failure rather than complete device unusability or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Wi-Fi sharing is disabled in device settings. Countermeasure: Enable Wi-Fi sharing in settings under Mobile Hotspot configuration.

rows.Title: Network issues
rows.Problem: The phone is not getting network at all / network keeps disappearing. Sometimes the call gets disconnected automatically or shows "No Service". I checked the SIM, it is working fine in another phone. I have tried to restore the network
rows.Summarized Problem: The device fails to maintain mobile network connection, resulting in no signal and frequent call drops despite a working SIM.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is unable to establish or maintain network connectivity, leading to complete loss of call and data services.

rows.Title: Unable to turn on mobile hotspot
rows.Problem: Mobile hotspot does not turn on after security update; requires phone restart to recover
rows.Summarized Problem: The mobile hotspot feature fails to turn on after a security update and requires a phone restart to recover.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to function entirely, rendering a key connectivity function unusable without restart, which is a major usability and functionality issue.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by the device failing to get capability from Wi-Fi firmware; countermeasure recommends user to check hardware Wi-Fi chipset and visit service center.

rows.Title: Animation lag in recent apps
rows.Problem: Lag or animation glitch in recent apps, persists despite adjusting refresh rate to 60-120Hz
rows.Summarized Problem: Recent apps exhibit animation lag despite refresh rate adjustments.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of app transition animations under varying refresh rates.

rows.Title: unable to restore the contact while taking up the backup
rows.Problem: unable to restore the contact while taking up the backup
rows.Summarized Problem: Contacts are not restoring during Samsung Cloud backup process.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial functionality failure in contact restoration, not full device unusability.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Green Screen during video playback and scrolling
rows.Problem: Green screen during video playback and scrolling in apps like Chrome and Instagram; screen flickers or turns green; phone freezes when recording; issue started after One UI 7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: Video playback and scrolling in apps cause green screen flicker and phone freezing.
rows.Severity Reason: The screen showing green during playback and scrolling renders content unusable and causes device freezing, making the device functionally unusable in key scenarios.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue is not reproducing at our end. Please update apps from Playstore and retest.

rows.Title: Phone number saved in Contacts shown with different name in WhatsApp
rows.Problem: Contacts displayed in WhatsApp show wrong names, such as wife's number showing a different name instead of 'wife', causing confusion and usability issues
rows.Summarized Problem: WhatsApp displays contacts with incorrect names instead of the saved names in the device contacts.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes confusion in contact identification but does not prevent core functionality or lead to device crash or data loss.

rows.Title: Wi-Fi quick toggle fails to connect instantly
rows.Problem: Wi-Fi quick toggle fails to connect instantly, shows 'Obtaining IP address' 2-3 times, then finally connects
rows.Summarized Problem: Wi-Fi quick toggle takes a long time to connect, showing 'Obtaining IP address' multiple times before finally connecting.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a delay in Wi-Fi connection, but the device eventually connects, indicating partial malfunction rather than complete failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The AP is not sending a DHCP ACK response; recommend checking AP DHCP settings and rebooting the AP to resolve potential temporary congestion.

rows.Title: App randomly crashes
rows.Problem: App crashes randomly, occurring intermittently across different applications, with no specific timing or trigger.
rows.Summarized Problem: The in-app purchase feature crashes randomly and intermittently across apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes randomly and intermittently, affecting functionality across multiple applications, making it unreliable and potentially unusable.

rows.Title: Home Up app not working
rows.Problem: Home Up app is not working on Z fold 7. The updated version of home add is not working.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Home Up app is not functioning on Z Fold 7 devices.
rows.Severity Reason: The app is completely non-functional on a device, preventing users from using a core feature.
rows.R&D Comment: The attached logs are insufficient and lack time synchronization with video; we need logs and video synced with time, and the latest app version should be updated.

rows.Title: Samsung Wallet not opening
rows.Problem: Samsung Wallet is not opening after One UI 7 update on Galaxy M53 5G. It shows 'service will come soon' even after phone reset and multiple factory resets. Others with same device report the same issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung Wallet fails to open after One UI 7 update on Galaxy M53 5G, showing 'service will come soon' instead.
rows.Severity Reason: The app is completely unresponsive and fails to launch, preventing user from accessing a core feature.

rows.Title: Contacts showing in short form in WhatsApp
rows.Problem: Contacts are showing in short form such as 'Er Pratap Singh' displayed as 'Er Singh' in WhatsApp
rows.Summarized Problem: WhatsApp is displaying contact names in a shortened form, incorrectly truncating full names.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of contact name display, affecting user experience but not causing device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: WhatsApp contact name display issue (P250722-05427). Countermeasure: WhatsApp has fixed the issue and will apply it gradually; treat as 3rd Party app issue.

rows.Title: Not able to install whatsapp messenger
rows.Problem: Unable to install WhatsApp messenger on device despite contacting Google support and trying all troubleshooting steps
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot install WhatsApp messenger on the device despite attempting all troubleshooting steps.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in app installation, which prevents the user from installing a third-party app, but does not render the device unusable or cause a crash.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Lag observed while switching app
rows.Problem: Glitch in UI; when swiping from gesture to switch app, app takes time to come in full screen
rows.Summarized Problem: App takes excessive time to load full screen after a gesture swipe, causing noticeable lag during app switching.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a delay in app transition but does not result in device unavailability or data loss, affecting usability intermittently.

rows.Title: 5G not working properly
rows.Problem: 5G data speed remains like 4G or slower despite showing 5G icon, not providing true 5G performance
rows.Summarized Problem: The device shows 5G icon but delivers only 4G or slower data speeds, failing to provide true 5-than performance.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of 5G functionality, where connectivity is present but performance is inadequate, preventing full 5G data experience.

rows.Title: Video lags when played
rows.Problem: 4K video freezes while playing, resulting in poor playback experience despite high purchase price
rows.Summarized Problem: 4K video playback lags and freezes during playback.
rows.Severity Reason: Video playback freezes, making the feature unusable and disrupting user experience.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is likely due to low SD card performance; user should back up data and test with a new SD card or internal storage.

rows.Title: Unable to configure Samsung pay app or not able to add credit card to the app
rows.Problem: Unable to configure Samsung pay app or not able to add credit card to the app
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot configure Samsung Pay or add credit card to the app.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial functionality failure in adding a credit card, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Looks like this is a known issue of Indian Mastercard with international payment disabled from bank app. Please check if user enabled international transaction in Bank application. If yes, please ask him to share bank name and first 6 digit of card number.

rows.Title: Ghost Touch Issue
rows.Problem: Ghost touch issues occur when the device is warm, especially during gaming or charging. The touch responds abnormally and independently. The issue does not occur in Safe Mode and has persisted after a full factory reset.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device exhibits ghost touch when warm, causing abnormal and independent touch responses.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes the device to respond incorrectly to touch inputs when hot, making it unusable during high-temperature usage scenarios like gaming or charging.
rows.R&D Comment: The recent logs show no touch-related symptoms; users are advised to upload logs and videos or visit service center for inspection with developer options enabled.

rows.Title: Poor network and slow mobile data speed
rows.Problem: Slow internet even with 5G available and full network bar, high latency when connection is established
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile data shows slow speed and high latency even when 5G is available and network bar is full.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to deliver reliable connectivity despite 5G availability, resulting in poor user experience and potential functional failure in network-dependent tasks.

rows.Title: 5G speed degraded
rows.Problem: When hotspot is turned on and 5GHz band is used, 5G speed drops significantly on both devices. The issue occurs only on 5G network, not on 4G. Speed is normal on 2.4GHz band.
rows.Summarized Problem: 5G speed degrades significantly when using 5GHz band with hotspot enabled, despite normal performance on 2.4GHz.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects only specific network conditions and does not cause device failure or data loss, but impacts user experience during 5G hotspot usage.
rows.R&D Comment: The speed drop may be due to physical obstacles or distance; request CP silent logs for deeper analysis.

rows.Title: unable to view OneDrive files or folders in My Files
rows.Problem: Unable to view any OneDrive files or folders within the My Files app on Samsung Galaxy A34, despite signing in and troubleshooting steps like signing out, clearing cache, and verifying via web and standalone OneDrive app.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot view OneDrive files or folders in the My Files app on Samsung Galaxy A34.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a core feature (file viewing) that persists after troubleshooting, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Fix to sync logic to update folders and files list. - August App update.

rows.Title: Contents not shown in My Files
rows.Problem: Contents are not shown in My Files. I tried clearing cache, logging out and in, but still no results.
rows.Summarized Problem: Files in One Drive are not displayed in the My Files section.
rows.Severity Reason: User cannot access stored files, making the file management feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Fix to sync logic to update folders and files list. - August App update.

rows.Title: Inconsistent font size throughout the system
rows.Problem: Inconsistent font size throughout the system and does not match the font size and screen zoom configured by the users
rows.Summarized Problem: The system displays inconsistent font sizes that do not match user-configured font size and screen zoom settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects user experience by making text display inconsistent with user preferences, but does not cause device failure or data loss.

rows.Title: Lock star missing from Goodlock
rows.Problem: Lockstar has disappeared from Good lock
rows.Summarized Problem: The lock star element is missing from the Goodlock screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing from a key visual element of the lock screen, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable.

rows.Title: Phone gets powered off
rows.Problem: Phone gets powered off when keeping in a pockyor closing the fold or opening the fold display
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone powers off when kept in a pocket or when the fold is closed or opened.
rows.Severity Reason: The device loses power unexpectedly under normal usage conditions, making it unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: A defect in C2C FPCB is suspected. We suspect that the HW is defective, so please visit the service center for inspection.

rows.Title: contacts changing their name on its own and duplicating
rows.Problem: contacts changing their name on its own and duplicating. The same issue has been going on on whatsapp on this new phone as well, the names have changed on their own.
rows.Summarized Problem: Contacts are changing their names and duplicating automatically during sync.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes inconsistent contact data and potential data loss, making it impossible to trust contact information across apps.
rows.R&D Comment: Duplicate contacts are merged only when both name and phone number match; the app fails to link contacts with different names or phone numbers during sync.

rows.Title: Intelligent wifi is not working
rows.Problem: Intelligent wifi is not working. MyWifi2.4G and MyWifi 5G are added to frequently used wifi networks but wifi isn't switched on automatically. It connects after manual switch. Same issue reported 3 months ago with no resolution.
rows.Summarized Problem: WiFi does not switch on automatically after being added to frequently used networks, despite being manually enabled and later connecting.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to work as intended, but the device remains usable and does not crash or lose data.
rows.R&D Comment: Mobile data seems to be disabled. You need the Internet to use "Wi-Fi auto-on/off". Turn on your mobile data.

rows.Title: Circle to search is not working
rows.Problem: Circle to search is not working. When I use this feature, it tells me to sign in to my account, but I've already done it multiple times, still facing the same problem. I have also updated my software and reset accessibility. But still facing the same issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: The circle-to-search feature fails to function and repeatedly prompts the user to sign in, despite having already completed the authentication process.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature does not work as intended, but does not cause device crash or data loss, and can be partially resolved by user actions like resetting accessibility.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Unable to play 4K video HDR in YouTube
rows.Problem: Samsung Galaxy M34 5G cannot play 4K HDR videos on YouTube. HDR not displayed. Phone runs ONE UI 7 (Android 15).
rows.Summarized Problem: YouTube fails to play 4K HDR videos on Samsung Galaxy M34 5G due to lack of hardware AV1 decoder.
rows.Severity Reason: Device cannot play 4K HDR content, which is a core media functionality, resulting in a significant user experience failure.
rows.R&D Comment: M34 lacks hardware AV1 decoder; YouTube uses codec policies based on device capabilities; issue raised to Google.

rows.Title: Google maps is crashing often
rows.Problem: Google maps is crashing often. I also cleared cache and app data but the same problem is repeating. I also Uninstalled updates and reinstalled update but the problem is continuing. I attach a video regarding this problem. I completed all the steps given by samsung support.
rows.Summarized Problem: Google Maps app crashes frequently despite clearing cache, removing and reinstalling updates, and following Samsung support steps.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes repeatedly, making navigation functionality unusable, which directly impacts core device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: The crash is caused by a third-party Google Maps app issue; Samsung has no control over the app's source code or development, and cannot debug or fix the root cause.

rows.Title: phone getting restarted automatically
rows.Problem: phone getting restarted automatically multiple times and wifi not enabling even after factory reset
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone restarts automatically multiple times and WiFi fails to enable even after a factory reset.
rows.Severity Reason: The device restarts repeatedly and fails to establish WiFi, making it unusable for basic operations.
rows.R&D Comment: Modem getting reset due to FW crash. Need full ramdump to check further. Since the issue seems to be persistent, please get the hardware checked to rule out any hardware defects.

rows.Title: Green screen and device restart
rows.Problem: Device restarts after showing green screen; video not saved due to restart
rows.Summarized Problem: Device restarts after displaying a green screen.
rows.Severity Reason: Device restarts mid-use, causing loss of data and user experience disruption.

rows.Title: Mobile Data Issue
rows.Problem: Mobile data is intermittently switching on and off after a UI7 update, previously functioning smoothly
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile data intermittently switches on and off after a UI7 update, previously functioning smoothly
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves intermittent functionality after an update, indicating partial malfunction rather than complete failure or device unusability.
