rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: 5G not working
rows.Problem: 5G not working on the device, previously working until two days ago, with 5G preferred option enabled in mobile network settings and Airtel 5G SIM used.
rows.Summarized Problem: 5G connectivity is no longer working on the device despite previously functioning and having the 5G preferred option enabled.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of 5G functionality, which was previously working and has regressed recently, but does not cause device crash or total unavailability.

rows.Title: Slow charging
rows.Problem: After updating to OneUI 7 and Android 15, the device's charging speed drops from 7 watts to less than 5 watts within a minute, and this occurs during every charging session.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device reduces charging power from 7 watts to less than 5 watts within a minute after updating to Android 15 and OneUI 7.
rows.Severity Reason: The charging power drop significantly impacts device usability and performance, leading to prolonged charging times and user frustration.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Auto restarting issue
rows.Problem: Device has been restarting while using normally and is not because of restart after update. Please check the logs.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device is restarting unexpectedly while in normal use.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is restarting unexpectedly, which makes it unusable during normal operation.

rows.Title: Closing all apps from recent bar launches weather widget
rows.Problem: When closing all apps from the recent apps screen in landscape mode, the phone incorrectly launches the weather widget, which is located below the close all button. This happens when the input is given quickly and is noticeable and annoying. The bug does not occur when the screen is rotated to landscape due to the weather widget's repositioning.
rows.Summarized Problem: The weather widget unexpectedly launches when the close all button is tapped in landscape mode on the recent apps screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a noticeable and annoying UI inconsistency but does not result in device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue is not reproducible in latest OS version; no ANR or crash found in logs. Recommend checking in latest OS with fresh logs and video if issue persists.

rows.Title: Camera cutout issue
rows.Problem: The camera cutout setting is broken — even after enabling "Show camera cutout", the app doesn’t extend to full screen.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera cutout feature fails to extend the screen in full-screen mode during app usage.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents full-screen app functionality but does not cause device crash or data loss.

rows.Title: Bluetooth button not showing
rows.Problem: Bluetooth button does not appear in the notification panel after a call ends, even though Bluetooth connection is active. There is a UI issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Bluetooth button fails to appear in the notification panel after a call ends, despite a successful Bluetooth connection.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the visibility of a key feature in the notification panel, preventing users from managing Bluetooth devices, but does not cause device crash or data loss.

rows.Title: Camera vertical line coming while zoom
rows.Problem: Phone camera zoom has a vertical line coming
rows.Summarized Problem: A vertical line appears when zooming in on the camera.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents proper use of the camera during zoom, rendering a key functionality unusable.

rows.Title: Mobile Data Sharing Issue
rows.Problem: Mobile data sharing fails when used via USB tethering or mobile hotspot, causing apps like Roblox to fail to connect on other devices. This affects both USB tethering and Wi-Fi hotspot, despite direct data working on the source device.
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile data sharing fails when shared via USB tethering or hotspot, preventing app connectivity on other devices.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents other devices from connecting to mobile data, rendering data sharing unusable in practical scenarios.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Unable to edit lockscreen
rows.Problem: AOD and lock screen problem
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot edit the lock screen, specifically the AOD feature.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents editing of the lock screen feature but does not cause device failure or data loss.

rows.Title: Sim 1 slot not showing
rows.Problem: After updating the system device shows only sim slot 2 and not showing the sim slot 1 or sim 1
rows.Summarized Problem: The device no longer displays SIM slot 1 after an update, showing only SIM slot 2.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of the SIM card display functionality, where one slot is missing but the device remains usable.
rows.R&D Comment: User has renamed the value from SIM 1 to SIM 2; only one SIM card is present. Provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Unable to register for RCS service after upgrading to One UI 7
rows.Problem: User cannot register for RCS service after upgrading to One UI 7 and switching default messaging app to Samsung Messages. The registration process shows "Registration Failed" after about 5 minutes. Network provider confirms no side issues.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot register for RCS service after upgrading to One UI 7 and switching to Samsung Messages, with the registration process failing after five minutes.
rows.Severity Reason: The RCS registration fails intermittently but does not cause device freeze or data loss, and the issue persists only after a specific software change.
rows.R&D Comment: Insufficient logs found; user needs to provide proper issue timing logs for analysis.

rows.Title: Application icon disappears from home screen intermittently
rows.Problem: Application icon intermittently disappears from home screen
rows.Summarized Problem: The app icon intermittently disappears from the home screen after a software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects usability but does not cause device malfunction or data loss; it is intermittent and can be resolved by changing app sorting settings.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is resolved by switching app sorting from direct setting to alphabetical order; further analysis requires additional logs.

rows.Title: Recent view not display properly
rows.Problem: On the recent application screen, it happens every time
rows.Summarized Problem: The recent application view displays incorrectly every time.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue occurs consistently on the recent app screen but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.

rows.Title: Unable to add credit or debit cards to Samsung Wallet
rows.Problem: Unable to add any credit or debit cards to Samsung Wallet. It shows 'Couldn't complete'
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot add credit or debit cards to Samsung Wallet, with the app showing 'Couldn't complete' after attempting to add cards.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature to add cards is completely non-functional, preventing users from using the payment functionality.

rows.Title: Sensor malfunction
rows.Problem: Device frequently hangs and essential sensors like the accelerometer, gyroscope, and Flex mode sensor are not functioning correctly
rows.Summarized Problem: Essential sensors such as accelerometer, gyroscope, and Flex mode are not functioning correctly, causing device hangs.
rows.Severity Reason: Device frequently hangs and essential sensors are not working, making core functionality unusable.

rows.Title: S Pen Warning Popup Not Occurring
rows.Problem: When the S Pen is out and the home screen is locked via side button, the reminder notification that 'S PEN IS OUT' does not show.
rows.Summarized Problem: The S Pen out warning notification fails to appear when the home screen is locked.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing in a key usage scenario, preventing users from knowing their S Pen is out, but the device remains usable.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: User must walk away with phone while screen is off; device on table in video; warning does not show. Counter Measure: Same as cause.

rows.Title: Image post processed with blurry painting effect when set as key image in motion photo
rows.Problem: When setting an image as a key image in a motion photo, the image is badly post-processed with a blurry painting effect and gets saved. No AI edits were performed; only a standard image was selected. The issue was reported to customer care but they could not reproduce or explain it.
rows.Summarized Problem: An image set as a key image in a motion photo is incorrectly post-processed with a blurry painting effect instead of being preserved in original quality.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in image processing during motion photo creation, affecting visual quality but not rendering the device unusable or causing crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: As a result of checking the attached file image, it is difficult to analyze accurately because it is not the original photographed image. If possible, please forward the original jpg shooting image for the problem phenomenon. Also, I would like you to deliver various photographed images such as photographed images and normally photographed images in the event of a problem. The photographed image delivered in this way can be inferred about the information on the shooting environment, whi

rows.Title: Persistent Wi-Fi Connection Issue
rows.Problem: Wi-Fi quick toggle often fails and gets stuck on "Obtaining IP address" loop before eventually connecting
rows.Summarized Problem: Wi-Fi quick toggle fails and gets stuck in an "Obtaining IP address" loop before eventually connecting.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent failure in Wi-Fi connection, preventing reliable use but does not completely disable device functionality.

rows.Title: Camera not working
rows.Problem: Camera not working after ONEUI7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera function is not working after the ONEUI7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera is a major core function; its failure renders the device unusable for basic photography and video calls.
rows.R&D Comment: The camera probe failure is suspected to be a hardware issue. A detailed log is needed for confirmation. Please use the following command to capture the log: adb root, adb remount, adb shell mkdir vendor/etc/camera, adb shell "echo logWarningMask=0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF >> /vendor/etc/camera/camxoverridesettings.txt", adb shell "echo logInfoMask=0xA01C092 >> /vendor/etc/camera/camxoverridesettings.txt", adb shell "echo logEntryExitMask=0x0 >> /vendor/etc/camera/camxoverrid

rows.Title: 5g not working
rows.Problem: 5g is gone again after latest update
rows.Summarized Problem: 5G connectivity is missing after the latest software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The device loses a core network functionality, making 5G unavailable after an update, which directly impacts usability.

rows.Title: Samsung TTS not working properly
rows.Problem: Samsung TTS is not functioning as default text-to-speech service on Google Play Books; the app uses Google speech service instead, and when Samsung TTS is set as default, it prompts to install a TTS app.
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung TTS fails to function as the default text-to-speech service in Google Play Books, instead using Google speech or prompting for app installation.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature does not work in a third-party app, but partial functionality is available via AI SDK, indicating a partial malfunction rather than complete failure.
rows.R&D Comment: From V OS, 3rd party applications are not allowed to use Samsung TTS; third-party apps can use Samsung TTS via AI SDK.

rows.Title: HDR not working
rows.Problem: HDR not working on Samsung A35
rows.Summarized Problem: HDR functionality is not working on Samsung A35 due to codec error when playing 4K 60fps content.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to render HDR content properly when playing high-frame-rate videos, resulting in a complete failure of the feature, making the display experience unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The Exynos 1380 chipset only supports 4K at 30fps; playing 4K 60fps videos causes codec errors, leading to HDR failure. The issue is hardware-limited and cannot be resolved without software adaptation or chipset upgrade.

rows.Title: Issues playing BGMI
rows.Problem: Joystick gets stuck, touch becomes unresponsive, and controls lag during gameplay
rows.Summarized Problem: Game controls lag and become unresponsive during gameplay in BGMI.
rows.Severity Reason: Controls lag and become unresponsive, affecting gameplay but not causing device crash or complete failure.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue belongs to 3rd party application. It should be checked and fixed by 3rd party application.

rows.Title: Eye comfort shield issue
rows.Problem: Eye comfort shield turns on with full intensity and causes screenshot to appear deep yellow, inconsistent across devices with same settings
rows.Summarized Problem: The eye comfort shield activates at full intensity and causes screenshots to appear deep yellow, inconsistent across devices with same settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual output during screenshots but does not cause device malfunction or data loss, and is inconsistent across devices.

rows.Title: Unable to reset samsung account password
rows.Problem: Not working, showing error again with provided link
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot reset their Samsung account password due to repeated error messages.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely non-functional, preventing users from recovering their account credentials, which is essential for device access.

rows.Title: NotiStar is not working
rows.Problem: NotiStar is not working
rows.Summarized Problem: The NotiStar feature is not functioning on the lock screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely missing, preventing notification display on lock screen, which is a core functionality.

rows.Title: Wallpaper and Styles feature not working
rows.Problem: The Wallpaper and Styles feature on my phone is not working. When I try to set a wallpaper for either the main screen or the cover screen, the app closes automatically and becomes unresponsive. I'm currently unable to set wallpapers on both the cover screen and the main screen.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Wallpaper and Styles feature fails to allow setting wallpapers on both main and cover screens, causing the app to close automatically.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes when attempting to set wallpapers, preventing users from customizing their device display, making the feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Sorry for the inconvenience. The problem is solved when updating the latest SW.

rows.Title: Camera Image quality not good
rows.Problem: The camera image quality on Z Fold 7 shows excessive noise and lack of detail compared to Vivo X200 Pro, even under normal lighting conditions with a monitor light shining on the hand. The user claims the Z Fold 7's post-processing is inadequate and requests improvement.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Z Fold 7 camera produces noisy and low-detail images under normal lighting conditions, especially when compared to the Vivo X200 Pro.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction in image quality under typical use, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Inadequate post-processing in Z Fold 7 camera; Counter Measure: Disable macro mode and use wide sensor for comparison shots.

rows.Title: Software issue detected pop up occurs
rows.Problem: Fold 4 inner screen not working when phone opens, speaker and earpiece not working, device shows nothing on screen after June update, troubleshooting and reset attempts failed, error report shows software issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The inner screen of the Fold 4 does not display anything when the phone is opened, and audio output through speaker and earpiece is not functioning.
rows.Severity Reason: The device shows no screen output and has no audio, making it completely unusable for basic operations.
rows.R&D Comment: If no sound or display works 100% depending on fold state, hardware inspection may be required. Guide customer to service center for inspection.

rows.Title: Keyboard not showing up
rows.Problem: Keyboard not showing up when typing in messaging app, issue occurs intermittently
rows.Summarized Problem: The keyboard fails to appear when typing in messaging apps, especially during intermittent use.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of text input functionality but does not render the device unusable or result in data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Incorrect focus update from application side leads to keyboard show call being ignored. Countermeasure: User should clear app data and update to latest software version; detailed reproduction path required for further analysis.

rows.Title: MX player cant process media files pop up occurs
rows.Problem: Everytime I open media players like MX player or even gallery, an error popup appears saying 'Can't process media files'. The media plays well without hickups, but the popup is annoying.
rows.Summarized Problem: MX player displays an error popup when attempting to process media files, despite media playing without issues.
rows.Severity Reason: The error popup occurs during media playback but does not prevent functionality, indicating a partial malfunction rather than a complete failure.
rows.R&D Comment: MediaProvider supports HEVC transcoding but the app does not request it; transcoding is disabled for files over 60 seconds due to cost, leading to the error popup despite playback working.

rows.Title: Two icons for same app shown
rows.Problem: Applications showing double icons on phone
rows.Summarized Problem: Users see two icons for the same application on their phone.
rows.Severity Reason: The duplication is a known feature behavior under Dual Messenger mode, not a malfunction or device failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The second icon is part of the Dual Messenger profile; it is intended behavior and not a bug.

rows.Title: Bluetooth not working
rows.Problem: Bluetooth is not showing clear cache option and has low sound quality after UI 7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: Bluetooth is not showing a clear cache option and has low sound quality after the UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of Bluetooth functionality after an update, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery drops from 60-80% to 20-15% within 3-4 hours during normal use with minimal app usage, browser, and no heavy multitasking or background activity. Battery drains 3% during simple typing. No significant drainage observed when screen is off. Request for battery logs under controlled conditions.
rows.Summarized Problem: Device experiences rapid battery drain during normal usage despite minimal app activity and background processes.
rows.Severity Reason: Battery drains rapidly under normal use, leading to device becoming unusable before expected usage time, indicating a major performance issue.

rows.Title: Camera quality is not good
rows.Problem: Pictures taken with 200MP and 12MP do not have sharpness when zoomed in, indicating poor image quality under magnification.
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera images lack sharpness when zoomed in, especially in 200MP mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera fails to deliver clear images upon zooming, which directly impacts core functionality and user experience.
rows.R&D Comment: The 200MP mode switches to 50MP in low light or high contrast conditions due to sensor limitations; high-resolution sensor performs best in bright light, leading to blurry images under zoom.

rows.Title: Optical Image Stabilization not working
rows.Problem: Optical Image Stabilization is not working
rows.Summarized Problem: Optical Image Stabilization is not functioning as expected in the camera.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature does not work under normal handheld conditions, but the issue may be related to user operation or settings rather than a system failure.
rows.R&D Comment: There is no problem related to stabilization in the log. The video suggests strong shaking may cause bumpy footage; users should verify that 'Camera - Video stabilization ON' is enabled.

rows.Title: Gallery app crashes while using
rows.Problem: application closes automatically while using the gallery. ui update shows after
rows.Summarized Problem: The gallery app crashes automatically while in use.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes during use, making it unusable for users.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Dependency on MS OneDrive provider in a dying process; Countermeasure: Reassign ownership and review with MS OneDrive.

rows.Title: Network issues in mobile data
rows.Problem: Mobile data automatically freezes, shifts to 3g, and cannot be changed back to 4g despite good network strength. Issue persists for days until device restart. After restart, 4g connection is restored temporarily.
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile data freezes and drops to 3G, unable to revert to 4G, until device restart.
rows.Severity Reason: Device fails to maintain stable 4G connection, leading to intermittent loss of network access and potential usability issues.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Bixby can not send messages through several apps when it is set to US English
rows.Problem: Bixby can not send messages through several apps when it is set to US English. Every time I ask it to send WhatsApp message, it asks me permission to change language to Indian English.
rows.Summarized Problem: Bixby fails to send messages through apps when set to US English and prompts users to switch to Indian English.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction where Bixby fails to send messages in US English and prompts a language change, but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The objective was to migrate Indian users to en-IN with better experience; now majority of Indian users are from en-IN, so this prompt will be removed in the next release.

rows.Title: Display gets pink on lock screen
rows.Problem: A glitch appears on the top part of the screen while unlocking, lasting 2-3 seconds and then vanishing, experienced 2-3 times this week
rows.Summarized Problem: A pink glitch appears on the top of the screen during unlocking and disappears after 2-3 seconds.
rows.Severity Reason: The glitch occurs intermittently and affects screen appearance during a key user action, but does not cause device failure or data loss.

rows.Title: Notifications not shown on Galaxy 3 watch
rows.Problem: Not getting notifications in Samsung galaxy 3 watch for two apps: MultiTimer and Microsoft To Do. Have tried everything. Have listed this issue before but got no resolution.
rows.Summarized Problem: Notifications are not displayed on the Samsung Galaxy 3 watch for specific apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects functionality for two apps but does not render the device unusable or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is resolved in the following cl. https://gerrit.sw.sec.samsung.net/package/c/Package/BandModule/+/1447253

rows.Title: Insta pop up has its icons overlapping
rows.Problem: While using landscapes in apps or games, the insta popup view is buggy and inappropriate according to instagram appearance
rows.Summarized Problem: The Instagram popup view has overlapping icons and appears buggy in landscape mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual appearance and user experience in specific scenarios but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Unable to sign in google account
rows.Problem: not able to sign in google account in watch 8. I have reset it multiple times, didn't work. a msg pops up saying Couldn't copy your google account. kindly help
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot sign in to their Google account on the watch 8, with a message indicating 'Couldn't copy your google account'.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to perform a basic authentication function required for core services, rendering key features inaccessible.
rows.R&D Comment: Attached video and logs are not in sync. So, we cannot analyse the issue. Please Clear Google Play Services and retest.

rows.Title: Font style didn't changed for Instagram
rows.Problem: The font applied on device is not reflected in Instagram; it still shows default font.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot apply custom font styles in Instagram, which continues to display default font instead.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of UI functionality, where user settings are not reflected in the app.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by Instagram's third-party codebase and not Samsung's software. Facebook should investigate, as the issue is temporary and not reproducible across all devices.

rows.Title: Lag observed in the device
rows.Problem: The device automatically restarted or froze, causing system instability
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences significant lag and automatic restarts, leading to system instability.
rows.Severity Reason: The device freezes and restarts unexpectedly, making it unusable and indicating a major system malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is likely due to hardware malfunction in the PCIe block or WIFI module; a RAM dump is needed for definitive diagnosis and hardware investigation is recommended.

rows.Title: Unable to log to Samsung account
rows.Problem: Unable to log to Samsung account even after changing password multiple times. Not able to use Samsung wallet and password. How to fix this
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot log into their Samsung account after changing their password, preventing access to Samsung Wallet and password features.
rows.Severity Reason: Users are unable to authenticate to their Samsung account, which is essential for accessing core features like Samsung Wallet and password management, making the device functionality severely limited.

rows.Title: Camera lags
rows.Problem: Phone camera lags and zitters when opened since purchase. Tried reset, clear cache, safe mode, and latest update. Issue persists consistently.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera lags and zitters when opened, despite multiple troubleshooting steps and software updates.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera lag significantly impacts usability, making it difficult to take photos or videos, and persists after multiple attempts to resolve.
rows.R&D Comment: Device temperature is very high in given logs, please reproduce in latest binary and try to reproduce issue, if issue is reproduced, please reopen the PLM

rows.Title: Google app issue
rows.Problem: Swiping diagonally from the bottom corners does not open Google Assistant or Gemini, though it works with 'Hey Google'. All settings are enabled and the app is updated.
rows.Summarized Problem: Swiping diagonally from the bottom corners fails to launch Google Assistant or Gemini, despite working with voice command.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially functional but does not work through the intended gesture, resulting in inconsistent user experience.
rows.R&D Comment: To open digital assistant, please press and hold the side button.

rows.Title: hotspot disconnects from devices
rows.Problem: The system hotspot disconnects from all other devices after a few minutes, despite staying ON on Galaxy M14 5G.
rows.Summarized Problem: The mobile hotspot disconnects from all connected devices after a few minutes of use.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent disconnections, affecting device connectivity but does not render the device unusable or cause crashes.

rows.Title: phone is crashing very frequently
rows.Problem: Post recent software update the phone is crashing very frequently. The UI crashing is very bothering. Please provide a solution ASAP or help to downgrade.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone is crashing frequently after a recent software update, causing UI instability.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is crashing frequently, making it unusable and disrupting normal operation.

rows.Title: Battery protection not working properly
rows.Problem: Battery charging setting set to maximum 80% but this function is not working
rows.Summarized Problem: The battery charging setting set to maximum 80% is not functioning properly.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially malfunctioning, preventing proper battery management but does not cause device failure or data loss.

rows.Title: Display statters when playing YouTube in 2x speed on 4k, 2k, or 1080p
rows.Problem: When playing YouTube at 2x speed in 4k, 2k, or 1080p, the display shows statters. This issue started after the security patch update and was not present before.
rows.Summarized Problem: The display shows statters when playing YouTube videos at 2x speed in 4k, 2k, or 1080p.
rows.Severity Reason: The display stuttering during video playback makes content viewing unusable and disrupts user experience significantly.
rows.R&D Comment: YouTube app runtime errors indicate screen null and layout state issues; countermeasure includes app cache clearing and update checks.

rows.Title: Ghost touch issue
rows.Problem: Ghost touch issues persist on Galaxy A14 5G, especially during gaming, despite factory reset, screen protector removal, and disabling HW overlays. The issue is still occurring after recommended settings adjustments.
rows.Summarized Problem: Ghost touch issues continue to occur on the Galaxy A14 5G during gaming, even after factory reset and recommended setting adjustments.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue persists despite multiple troubleshooting steps and affects usability during critical activities like gaming.
rows.R&D Comment: When analyzing the attached log, some of the touch characteristic data is spec-out. Please guide users to visit a nearby service center for inspection.

rows.Title: Device restarts unexpectedly
rows.Problem: The device restarts frequently, especially when battery drops below 50%, and becomes more severe as battery percentage decreases. This mainly happens while playing videos through apps or from the gallery.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device restarts unexpectedly, particularly when battery drops below 50% and during video playback.
rows.Severity Reason: The device restarts frequently and unexpectedly, disrupting daily usage and potentially indicating a critical system malfunction.

rows.Title: Touch issues
rows.Problem: Touch missing at fingerprint sensor location or touch stuck; issue resolves automatically or after manual restart and lock/unlock
rows.Summarized Problem: The touch function is missing or stuck at the fingerprint sensor area, intermittently affecting usability.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent touch failure at a critical sensor location, but does not render the device unusable or result in data loss.

rows.Title: Camera quality degraded
rows.Problem: After the last update, camera photos are coming out dark, dull, and slightly blurred even with HDR and Scene Optimizer turned on
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera photos are dark, dull, and slightly blurred despite HDR and Scene Optimizer being enabled.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects photo quality but does not cause device failure or crash, and functionality remains partially available.
rows.R&D Comment: Image is captured at ISO 2000 which looks balanced between clarity and noise. So recommending to maintain the current behavior.

rows.Title: Battery draining fast during light usage
rows.Problem: Battery is draining unusually fast even during light usage. The phone also heats up during idle time. Background apps are using more battery than expected.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device drains battery rapidly during light usage and heats up when idle, with background apps consuming excessive power.
rows.Severity Reason: Battery drain during light usage and overheating indicate significant power inefficiency, potentially rendering the device unusable or posing safety risks.
rows.R&D Comment: Background apps like com.facebook.services and com.google.android.gms are using excessive battery and background power; reducing their background activity can mitigate drain.

rows.Title: Battery Drain
rows.Problem: Battery life is very short and requires charging twice a day.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device requires charging twice a day due to excessive battery drain.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unusable without frequent charging, indicating a major functional failure in power management.

rows.Title: Display turns yellow on notification
rows.Problem: Display color tone turns yellowish when receiving messages or calls
rows.Summarized Problem: The device display turns yellow when receiving notifications or calls.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual appearance during notifications but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The yellow color is caused by the 'flashing notification' feature being enabled; users should disable it to resolve.

rows.Title: Camera pop up issue
rows.Problem: Camera app shows 'Another app is using the camera' message despite no other app running. Issue persists after restart, cache clear, and permission checks.
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera app displays 'Another app is using the camera' message when no other app is running, despite no active apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The message prevents user from accessing the camera function, rendering a core feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Consecutive recovery failure in camera module triggers fatal signal; Counter Measure: Request CP silent logs for deeper analysis.

rows.Title: mobile starts lagging
rows.Problem: mobile starts lagging when uploading images in ChatGPT, issue returns after restart but recurs upon use of image upload feature
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile lags when uploading images in ChatGPT, issue persists after restart and recurs upon image upload use.
rows.Severity Reason: The lag occurs during a specific function use and resolves after restart, indicating partial malfunction rather than complete system failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Power saving mode restricts system resources; Countermeasure: Guide user to turn off power saving mode

rows.Title: Network issues
rows.Problem: Phone network switches from 5G to 4G even when a proper 5G signal is available. Error occurred at purchase. User has tried all solutions including YouTube tutorials without success.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone switches from 5G to 4G despite having a proper 5-5G signal, causing connectivity issues.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to maintain a stable 5G connection, leading to inconsistent network performance and potential loss of service.

rows.Title: Devices only latching to 4G despite strong 5G coverage
rows.Problem: Devices only latching to 4G despite being in a strong 5G coverage area where other phones work fine with Jio 5G
rows.Summarized Problem: Devices fail to connect to 5G and consistently latch to 4G in areas with strong 5-5G coverage.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is unable to utilize 5G connectivity in areas where it is available and supported, rendering the network feature non-functional despite proper settings and SIM configuration.

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery draining is very fast after the One UI 7.0 update, despite user efforts to save battery. The device, known for good battery life, now shows rapid discharge.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences rapid battery drainage after the One UI 7.0 update, despite user efforts to conserve battery.
rows.Severity Reason: Battery drains faster than expected, but discharge rate according to logs is within normal range, indicating partial malfunction rather than complete failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery discharge rate is normal according to logs; user reports rapid drainage, suggesting possible perception or UI-related issue.

rows.Title: Delayed touch response
rows.Problem: Touch response delays when pulling down the screen to see notifications or adjusting settings like Wi-Fi or vibration mode, or when scrolling or navigating back. This has been occurring for 3 to 4 days.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users experience delayed touch response when interacting with the display, such as pulling down for notifications or scrolling.
rows.Severity Reason: The touch response is impaired during key interactions, affecting usability but not rendering the device unusable or causing data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Insufficient log data makes analysis difficult; users should update to the latest version and provide video logs with real-time recordings if the issue recurs.

rows.Title: Internet not working
rows.Problem: Internet suddenly stops working showing 5G but no internet connection. Flight mode takes several minutes to turn on, and after turning it off, there is no network for a long time. Device must be restarted to fix. Same network provider and devices work fine for others in the family.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device loses internet connectivity showing 5G but no actual connection, requiring restart and only affecting this device despite shared network and provider.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves intermittent network failure affecting only one device under same conditions, indicating partial malfunction rather than complete device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Rejection reason in logs indicates temporary network issue. If persists, recommend contacting network operator for further assistance.

rows.Title: Accessibility keeps stopping
rows.Problem: Installed apps not opening
rows.Summarized Problem: Accessibility settings are stopping unexpectedly, causing installed apps to fail to open.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents core functionality (app launching) from working, making the device unusable for users relying on accessibility features.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue was caused because DevicePolicyManager and AppOpsManager cannot get info properly without packageName in RestrictedPreference. Fix: Added logic to set packageName. This issue has been fixed in version 14.1.00.17

rows.Title: Search in gallery doesn't work properly
rows.Problem: Search in gallery doesn't work properly. If I search for driving license it doesn't show the image even though I have it.
rows.Summarized Problem: The gallery search function fails to display images, even when they are present in the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The search function fails to retrieve images, resulting in partial functionality failure but does not render the device unusable.

rows.Title: Lag observed while switching between lenses
rows.Problem: Lag observed while switching between lenses
rows.Summarized Problem: Users experience lag when switching between camera lenses.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction during a specific camera function, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable.

rows.Title: Wi-fi calling option not showing
rows.Problem: Wi-fi calling option disappeared after Android update from 14 to 15. No wifi calling option available to turn on using existing methods.
rows.Summarized Problem: WiFi calling option is missing after Android 14 to 15 update, preventing users from enabling it.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot enable WiFi calling, a core communication feature, after the update, making the device unusable for calls in certain networks.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: battery drain so fast
rows.Problem: battery drops 27% in 1 hour 32 minutes with no gaming and no excessive brightness, user expects 11 hours screen time but only gets 5 hours 32 minutes without gaming and 4 hours 48 minutes with gaming, problem persists after factory reset
rows.Summarized Problem: Device experiences rapid battery drain of 27% in one hour and thirty-two minutes under normal usage conditions, with no gaming or high brightness, and the issue persists after factory reset.
rows.Severity Reason: Battery drains rapidly under normal usage, significantly shortening screen time and making device unusable for daily tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery was drained from 100% to 73% for 12h and 57 minutes not 1h and 32 minutes; screen on time is not capability for battery but user's usage pattern; log is not matched with user's description and there is no abnormal behavior

rows.Title: Unable to Make Voice Call while on Dual WhatsApp Call
rows.Problem: Cannot make voice calls while on a dual WhatsApp call. Receive error message 'Call cannot be placed because there are no calling accounts that support calls of this type'. Normal voice calls work, only dual WhatsApp call is affected.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot make voice calls during a dual WhatsApp call, receiving an error about no supported calling accounts, while normal voice calls work.
rows.Severity Reason: The device prevents users from making voice calls during a dual WhatsApp call, which is a major functional failure that blocks core communication capability.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Ongoing WhatsApp call blocks new voice call setup. Countermeasure: User must disconnect the ongoing call to initiate a new call.

rows.Title: Network drop from 5G to 4G
rows.Problem: Device: Galaxy S23 FE One UI Version: 7 (Android 15) Carrier: Jio 5G (Standalone - SA) Issue: My S23 FE aggressively drops from 5G n78 to 4G or 5G n28 when indoors, even when n78 signal is present (~ -105 dBm). This causes slow speed and unstable internet indoors. I have tested the same Jio SIM in a OnePlus 13R under identical conditions, and it stays locked on 5G n78 without fallback — same signal strength. Troubleshooting done: Battery optimizations disabled, SIM Toolkit, Phone Service disabled
rows.Summarized Problem: The Galaxy S23 FE drops from 5G to 4G or 5G n28 indoors despite strong 5G n78 signal, causing unstable internet, while a similar device on the same SIM maintains 5G connectivity.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent connectivity failure under indoor conditions, but does not render the device unusable or result in data loss.

rows.Title: Unable to configure supplementary services
rows.Problem: Unable to configure supplementary services
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot configure supplementary services.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is not available or functional, but the device remains usable overall.
rows.R&D Comment: The supplementary services registration fails due to temporary network issues; a network-related countermeasure is proposed.

rows.Title: Game icon didn't update
rows.Problem: Samsung launcher doesn't display the new icon for Free Fire game
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung launcher fails to display the updated icon for the Free Fire game.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in UI display, not affecting core device functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by a mismatch between app manifest and runtime icon display, and the countermeasure is to investigate with the app developer.

rows.Title: camera is not functioning properly
rows.Problem: The camera is not functioning properly, showing a black screen, not focusing, or crashing, affecting daily usage. The user has tried restarting, clearing cache, and updating software, but the issue persists.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera fails to function properly, showing black screen, not focusing, or crashing.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera is failing to function at all, resulting in complete loss of a core feature, making the device unusable for basic photography and video calls.
rows.R&D Comment: The camera sensor is not functioning properly; the H/W team needs to address this issue.

rows.Title: Black line appears when capture photo from rear camera
rows.Problem: Black line appears when capturing photos from rear camera, especially on plain walls, when Intelligent Optimization is set to maximum or medium.
rows.Summarized Problem: A black line appears in photos taken from the rear camera when Intelligent Optimization is set to maximum or medium, particularly on plain backgrounds.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects photo quality in specific conditions but does not prevent full functionality or cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Black stripes appear due to fast shutter speeds in Fast Shutter Mode; Deflicker feature is designed to minimize this effect.

rows.Title: GPS not working
rows.Problem: GPS location services are not working on a new Samsung Galaxy Tab S10 Ultra. The blue location tick icon in Google Maps is missing, and the issue persists despite all troubleshooting attempts.
rows.Summarized Problem: GPS location services are not functioning on the device, with the location indicator missing in Google Maps.
rows.Severity Reason: The GPS function is completely non-functional, preventing basic navigation and location-based services.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Sim not working
rows.Problem: SIM not working on Samsung S23 FE, works fine on other phones
rows.Summarized Problem: SIM card is not working on Samsung S23 FE despite working on other devices.
rows.Severity Reason: The SIM fails to function on one device but works on others, indicating a partial malfunction rather than complete failure or device unusability.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: WiFi Direct Printing
rows.Problem: Unable to print via WiFi direct printer since updating to UI 7.0 and subsequent updates
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot print via WiFi direct after updating to UI 7.0 and later versions.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a network feature after updates, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: There's no log related to WiFi Direct operation. Users should enable Wi-Fi verbose logging and increase logger buffer size to capture relevant logs.

rows.Title: Video codec not supported
rows.Problem: Video player shows codec not supported while playing a video, but works normally on iPhone
rows.Summarized Problem: The video player fails to play videos due to unsupported codec, while the same videos play normally on iPhone.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot play common video content, rendering the video player functionally unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The driver received an unsupported stream error; sharing the video file is required for further investigation.

rows.Title: Contact details mismatching
rows.Problem: Contacts do not match mobile number and profile picture is mis-matching with contact details
rows.Summarized Problem: Contact details do not match mobile number and profile picture, causing inconsistency in contact information.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction where contact data is inconsistent but not rendering the device unusable or causing crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: It is difficult to know how this contact is added. Please further check which account is stored through the "Contacts Detailed View> Storage Location" path. Please edit it properly through the contact editing menu and report it again if the same problem occurs again.

rows.Title: Left edge pixels missing while using edge light
rows.Problem: Left edge pixels are missing on edge light; top, right, and bottom edges work fine. Issue verified on another device where all edges display correctly.
rows.Summarized Problem: Left edge pixels are missing on the edge light display, while other edges function normally.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects only a portion of the edge light functionality, impacting visual consistency but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.

rows.Title: read caller name aloud functions have stopped working
rows.Problem: After new OneUI update, read caller name aloud functions have stopped working. Unable to use routines and modes because they are not reading written statements. This was a useful functionality that is now non-functional after the update.
rows.Summarized Problem: The function to read caller name aloud has stopped working after the OneUI update.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot access a core feature that was previously functional, rendering routine and mode settings unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Last incoming call logs missing; system logs captured late. Countermeasure: Provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: 4k and 8k videos not playing properly after ONE UI 7 update
rows.Problem: 4k and 8k videos are not playing properly after updating to ONE UI 7.0 on Samsung Galaxy M5
rows.Summarized Problem: 4k and 8k video playback is failing after the ONE UI 7.0 software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial failure of video playback, not full device malfunction or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The media codec shows no errors; playback should be tested via Samsung Video Player.

rows.Title: efootball game keeps crashing
rows.Problem: eFootball game keeps crashing and automatically closes during use, not occurring in other apps. User has tried resetting phone and contacting support but issue persists.
rows.Summarized Problem: The eFootball game crashes and closes unexpectedly during use.
rows.Severity Reason: The game crashes mid-use, preventing gameplay and rendering the app unusable for users.
rows.R&D Comment: The crash is likely due to an issue in the Google Play Services APK; clearing Google Play Services app data and rebooting resolves it.

rows.Title: My file keep crashing
rows.Problem: My files app crashed
rows.Summarized Problem: The My Files app crashes unexpectedly.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes, making it unusable and preventing file access.
rows.R&D Comment: Fix logic to update hierarchical URI; update via Galaxy Store.

rows.Title: Internet network keeps on going to zero
rows.Problem: The internet network keeps on going to zero especially the download part. I tried all ways - resetting network, turned on data roaming, reboot the device, reset the device. But the problem still persists. Did reboot, reset device, reset network, sim slot change but still internet suddenly goes down, especially downloading.
rows.Summarized Problem: The internet connection intermittently drops to zero, especially during downloads, despite multiple troubleshooting attempts.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes complete loss of internet access, particularly during downloads, making the device unusable for online tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Split screen switch causes screen to go black
rows.Problem: Split screen switch causes screen to go black
rows.Summarized Problem: When switching to split screen, the tablet screen goes black.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unusable during screen switching, preventing normal operation.

rows.Title: Wifi is not getting turned on
rows.Problem: Wifi is not getting turned on. It's greyed out. Tried network resting, safe mode, and factory reset. Issue persists.
rows.Summarized Problem: WiFi function is greyed out and cannot be turned on, despite attempts to resolve via network reset, safe mode, and factory reset.
rows.Severity Reason: Device cannot connect to Wi-Fi, rendering basic internet access and connectivity unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Failed to load WiFi driver and initialize firmware mode controller. Countermeasure: Same as cause; indicates a firmware or driver-level HAL failure.

rows.Title: Virtual Aperture option not available in Expert Raw Labs
rows.Problem: Virtual Aperture option not visible in Expert Raw Labs
rows.Summarized Problem: The Virtual Aperture option is missing in Expert Raw Labs.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is not visible in the interface, but it is supported in the product specification and already documented.
rows.Resolve Type: Product Requirement, UX Guide, Standard Technical Specification
rows.R&D Comment: We support Virtual Aperture since S25. We've already explained this on Samsung members (https://r1.community.samsung.com/t5/camcyclopedia/%EA%B0%80%EC%83%81%EC%A1%B0%EB%A6%AC%EA%B0%9C-expert-raw/ba-p/31326542)

rows.Title: Unable to Hide Categories in My File Menu
rows.Problem: Unable to hide categories in the menu layout of My File folder on Z Fold 7; works on Samsung S22
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot hide categories in the menu layout of the My File folder on Z Fold 7, despite it working on Samsung S22.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a menu feature, preventing full customization but not rendering the device unusable.

rows.Title: Fingerprint sensor not working properly
rows.Problem: fingerprint sensor not working properly. it shows fingerprint sensor isn't working again and again. when i restart the phone the issue was fixed but how many times i do that. i think its system error because mobile has no physical damage
rows.Summarized Problem: The fingerprint sensor is not working properly and repeatedly shows an error message, requiring restarts to resolve.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent failure of a core authentication function but does not result in device crash or data loss.

rows.Title: Wonderland module not downloading
rows.Problem: Galaxy Store says Wonderland module is not available for this device. User needs to contact developer for fix
rows.Summarized Problem: The Wonderland live wallpaper is not available for download on the device due to platform limitations.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is unavailable on the device, but users can still access it via developer contact, indicating partial functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: The Galaxy A3X series does not support Wonderland due to performance and battery concerns. Support is on hold until device meets performance requirements.

rows.Title: popup Occurs in device
rows.Problem: I am getting so much lagging my phone and auto restart
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences severe lagging and automatic restarts.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unusable due to severe lag and auto-restart, indicating a major system instability.
rows.R&D Comment: UFS link layer errors suggest hardware-level issues; recommend hardware inspection of AP and UFS components and user guidance to visit customer service center.

rows.Title: Unable to connect to Samsung health app
rows.Problem: Unable to connect to Samsung health app. It always shows error while trying to open the app.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung Health app fails to open and shows an error when attempting to connect.
rows.Severity Reason: The app fails to open and shows persistent error, preventing user from accessing health data.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Database file cannot be opened due to wrong password or file corruption. Countermeasure: User should uninstall and reinstall the app.

rows.Title: Call and Text on other devices not working on Tab S10
rows.Problem: Call and text on other devices not working on Tab S10; service stops after one or two calls, requires rebooting to restore functionality.
rows.Sub-Module: Call and Text on Other Devices
rows.Summarized Problem: Call and text functionality on other devices stops after a few calls and requires device reboot to restore.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves intermittent failure of a core connectivity feature after limited usage, preventing consistent communication but not causing full device unusability.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Unable to register for RCS service after upgraded to One UI 7
rows.Problem: Unable to register for RCS service after upgrading to One UI 7. Tried resetting phone, changing default messaging app, and de-registering from RCS, but registration fails.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot register for RCS service after upgrading to One UI 7, despite trying resets and switching messaging apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in messaging service registration after OS upgrade, not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: camera quality has worsened
rows.Problem: after updating to one ui 7, camera quality has noticeably worsened, with portrait mode struggling with edge detection and normal mode showing increased grain and pixelation
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera quality has deteriorated after One UI 7 update, with issues in edge detection and image sharpness.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera function is partially malfunctioning after an update, but still allows basic operation.
rows.R&D Comment: The video quality shows no noticeable difference before and after the update; user-reported issues may be subjective or due to perception bias.

rows.Title: Portrait mode not working in camera
rows.Problem: User cannot use portrait mode in camera. Camera crashes when zooming in or beyond 1x. App crashes on zoom. Camera lags and fails.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot use portrait mode in the camera, and the app crashes when zooming in or beyond 1x.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera app crashes during zoom, making the feature completely unusable and preventing normal operation.
rows.R&D Comment: The log capture is not correct. Request to get logs after clearing dumpstate and then opening only Portrait mode.

rows.Title: Can't install Whatsapp Application
rows.Problem: Can't download whatsapp
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot install or download the WhatsApp application on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The app installation fails due to version downgrade detection, preventing users from installing a critical communication app, rendering the device functionally unusable for essential communication.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Install version is older than current version; Countermeasure: Clear data of previous version and retry installation.

rows.Title: noise distortion muffling in sound
rows.Problem: noise distortion muffling in sound
rows.Summarized Problem: Users experience noise, distortion, and muffling in audio playback, particularly on Instagram content.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects audio quality during playback but does not cause device crash or complete failure, and the root cause is unclear.
rows.R&D Comment: The audio is not noisy in logs; content quality on Instagram is degraded, and issue scope is unclear. Request for silent logs to verify cause.

rows.Title: Media Picker consuming too much battery
rows.Problem: Media Picker is consuming too much battery without active use, leading to screen on time dropping to less than 4 hours on a single charge. Users report up to 5-10% daily battery drain despite less than 1 minute screen on time. Troubleshooting steps have not resolved the issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Media Picker app is consuming excessive battery power when not in active use, significantly reducing device screen on time.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes substantial battery drain, leading to device becoming unusable for daily tasks due to rapid battery depletion.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: com.microsoft.appmanager app continuously requests file scans on /storage/emulated/0, increasing MediaProvider CPU usage and power consumption. Countermeasure: The app is third-party and not under Samsung's control; power consumption is attributed to its background operation.

rows.Title: YouTube Video quality automatically drops back from 2160p to 480p
rows.Problem: On YouTube, video quality automatically drops from 2160p to 480p after a brief playback, even when manually set to 2160p. The quality option may not appear at all, and this issue occurs on multiple tablets.
rows.Summarized Problem: YouTube video quality automatically drops from 2160p to 480p after a short playback, despite user selection.
rows.Severity Reason: The video quality drops mid-playback, causing a major functional failure in video viewing experience, especially for high-resolution content.
rows.R&D Comment: The YouTube app incorrectly displays 2160p at 60fps despite device limitations and fixes the resolution to 360p or 480p; this should be addressed in the YouTube app and reported to Google.

rows.Title: dolby atmos seems to be broken
rows.Problem: dolby atmos seems to be broken and there is no difference in audio when playing over bluetooth. Turning on/off or changing modes has no effect. Restarting the device did not help. This used to work earlier, possibly due to recent oneui updates.
rows.Summarized Problem: Dolby Atmos is not functioning properly and users do not perceive any audio difference when playing over Bluetooth.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is not working as intended, but the device remains usable and no data loss or crash occurs.
rows.R&D Comment: dolby atmos was processed but the user cannot feel differences. It is need to check the playing app and contents and detailed reproduce path. Please give me more information about dolby atmos experiences.

rows.Title: Not able to hear voice from other side
rows.Problem: Not able to hear voice from other side. But in WhatsApp voice call it is possible
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot hear voice during calls, but can hear audio in WhatsApp voice calls.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects call functionality but is not complete or universal, and is partially workable via WhatsApp, indicating a partial malfunction.

rows.Title: Graphical glitch during gameplay
rows.Problem: Screen shows flickering, pixelated, or TV signal-like distortion effects while playing Genshin Impact. Glitches occur only inside the game, not in other apps or system UI, suggesting a GPU rendering or game compatibility issue, possibly related to graphics driver or thermal throttling.
rows.Summarized Problem: Gameplay on Genshin Impact causes screen flickering, pixelation, and TV signal-like distortion due to GPU rendering issues.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects only in-game visuals and does not cause device crash or data loss, but impacts user experience during gameplay.

rows.Title: Stopwatch UI Not Display Properly in Now Bar
rows.Problem: Now bar on always on display shows ---- instead of time after few minutes
rows.Summarized Problem: The stopwatch UI fails to display correctly on the Now Bar after a few minutes, showing '----' instead of time.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of the Now Bar display, affecting usability but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.

rows.Title: Samsung Note not sync with One Note App
rows.Problem: Samsung Notes app files are not syncing to OneNote app despite repeated attempts to sync
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung Notes app files fail to sync with OneNote app despite user attempts.
rows.Severity Reason: The sync function is not working, but users can still access notes through alternative methods like the OneNote web app.
rows.R&D Comment: User may not find the Onenote feed tab; data is uploaded successfully but not visible in the app. Users should check the OneNote feed tab or use web app to view notes. Microsoft guide indicates OneNote app on Windows no longer supports feed tab.

rows.Title: battery getting draining very fast
rows.Problem: Battery is draining very fast. Like I charged 80% and as far rightnow, I have used 32% and only get 2:21 of SOT. Attaching the screenshot of my battery usage data please refer to it. Since I'm using my mobile in very much basic manner and as setting of unnecessary mode and setting are turn off. Still battery getting draining very fast and facing pathetic battery backup and need to charge up twice a day.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device battery is draining extremely fast, even with minimal usage and no unnecessary settings enabled, resulting in needing to charge twice a day.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drains faster than expected under basic usage, leading to frequent charging and device unusability without charge.
rows.R&D Comment: According to log, there is no current consumption issue. If this user detects same issue, please get log again with detailed description. 1. Charge fully 2. Use the device until 20% without charging and rebooting. 3. Get log.

rows.Title: Unable to use 5g
rows.Problem: Unable to use 5g after updating or installing the security patch. In a network area I am facing this issue which I have never faced before.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot use 5G connectivity after a software update or security patch, especially in networked areas.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents 5G functionality in networked areas, rendering a key feature unusable after a software update.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Applications icons not showing in app drawer
rows.Problem: Few applications icons are not showing in the app drawer but appear when searched by name
rows.Summarized Problem: Some app icons are missing from the app drawer but appear when searched by name.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial functionality of the app drawer, affecting visibility but not preventing access through search.
rows.R&D Comment: The Royal Match app is hidden and processed by the Gaming Hub app. Try disabling the Hide Game Apps setting in the Gaming Hub app.

rows.Title: unable to use 5g data
rows.Problem: Device intermittently connects to 5g or does not connect at all, despite good 5g coverage in area; data connectivity is unstable for past 5 days.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device intermittently connects to 5G or fails to connect at all, despite good 5G coverage in the area.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves intermittent connectivity, not complete failure, but affects data functionality and user experience.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: AI core downloading notifications on WiFi connection
rows.Problem: AI core is downloading content frequently when connecting to WiFi and the notification does not open when clicked
rows.Summarized Problem: AI Core shows a hidden notification when connecting to WiFi, and clicking it does not open any content.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction where the notification is not visible or interactive, but the underlying AI service still functions correctly.
rows.R&D Comment: AICore runs as a foreground service for OnDevice AI features and creates notifications; Android hides notifications without user permission due to lack of UI, making the notification invisible by default. Users can manually manage this behavior.

rows.Title: sliding notification bar not working
rows.Problem: The sliding notification bar is not responding and does not allow selection of options such as mobile data, Wi-Fi, screen record, etc. This issue occurs frequently.
rows.Summarized Problem: The sliding notification bar fails to respond and does not allow user selection of settings like mobile data, Wi-Fi, or screen record.
rows.Severity Reason: The notification bar is not responding, preventing users from adjusting key settings, but it does not cause device crash or data loss.

rows.Title: unable to complete in-app purchases in the Galaxy Store
rows.Problem: unable to complete in-app purchases in the Galaxy Store version of Candy Crush. I receive the error: B7002/P/18jjr. This started after I briefly changed my Samsung account. I’ve switched back to the original one that worked before, but the issue continues. I’ve tried: - Clearing data/cache (Galaxy Store & Billing) - Reinstalling the app - Confirming valid payment method and region Please check if my device or account has been flagged, and whitelist if needed.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot complete in-app purchases in the Galaxy Store due to a payment blocking issue after account changes.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from making purchases, which is a core functionality, and affects usability of the app store.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: User account flagged for malicious payment patterns. Countermeasure: Exception granted for this case to allow access.

rows.Title: Camera quality has degraded
rows.Problem: Pictures have reduced detail and sharpness due to single frame processing in speed priority mode, resulting in increased noise.
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera images show reduced detail and sharpness due to noise from single frame processing in speed priority mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of image quality under specific settings, not complete failure or device unusability.
rows.R&D Comment: Single frame processing in speed priority mode leads to increased noise; multiframe processing should be applied in AutoMode to improve image quality.

rows.Title: Battery draining very fast in normal usage
rows.Problem: Battery drains rapidly during normal usage, dropping from 100% to 19% in just 3 hours 30 minutes without heavy usage or high-power activities.
rows.Summarized Problem: Device battery drains rapidly during normal usage, dropping from 100% to 19% in under four hours with no heavy tasks.
rows.Severity Reason: Battery drains significantly in normal use, indicating a major performance issue that affects device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery drain caused by high CPU usage from AI apps like ChatGPT and Perplexity; countermeasure is to reduce background AI app activity.

rows.Title: BGMI joystick stuck while jiggle movement
rows.Problem: Samsung A26 5G – please improve touch sampling rate optimization for smooth gaming
rows.Summarized Problem: The joystick control in BGMI game is stuck during jiggle movement, affecting gameplay.
rows.Severity Reason: The joystick stuck issue prevents smooth gameplay and makes the game unplayable during critical actions.

rows.Title: Low Edge Light
rows.Problem: Low edge light
rows.Summarized Problem: The edge light on the device is too dim.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue is a cosmetic UI element affecting visual appearance but does not impact device functionality or usability.

rows.Title: Battery icon disappears from status bar
rows.Problem: The battery icon does not show up in the status bar and disappears automatically
rows.Summarized Problem: The battery icon fails to display in the status bar and disappears automatically.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of the battery icon visibility, which affects user experience but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.

rows.Title: Dual always on option not working for dual sim
rows.Problem: Cannot turn on the dual always on option when using both Jio eSIM and Airtel physical SIM. Getting error "couldnt turn on dual sim always on"
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot enable the dual always on display feature when using both an eSIM and a physical SIM, resulting in an error message.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially unavailable under specific dual-SIM configurations, preventing full functionality but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Advanced mic settings cause force close in pro camera video mode
rows.Problem: Advanced mic settings cause force close in pro camera video mode. Not able to select external mic settings like usb mic, bt mic, gain settings.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users experience app force closure when using advanced mic settings in pro camera video mode, preventing selection of external microphones and gain adjustments.
rows.Severity Reason: The app force closes during use, preventing users from accessing essential camera functionality, making it unusable in video mode.

rows.Title: Battery Protection set to 80% but phone still charges beyond 80%
rows.Problem: Phone continues to charge beyond 80% even when Battery Protection is set to 80%, despite the expected behavior. This issue started after updating to One UI 7. Resetting the phone did not resolve it. The expected steps are: charge to 80%, unplug for 5 seconds, plug back in, and wait 5-10 minutes for the phone to resume charging beyond 80%.
rows.Summarized Problem: Phone continues to charge beyond 80% when Battery Protection is set to than 80%, violating expected behavior.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to respect user-set charging limits, potentially leading to battery overcharging and reduced battery lifespan.

rows.Title: Touch screen just stops working
rows.Problem: The touch screen just stops working at any time and on any screen. The issue sometimes resolves itself after idling the phone for a minute or by pressing the power button. The phone acts as if swiping to navi when touch is malfunctioning.
rows.Summarized Problem: The touch screen intermittently stops working across all screens and fails to respond to input.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of touch functionality but does not result in device crash or data loss, and resolves intermittently.

rows.Title: 4K video not playing
rows.Problem: 4K video playback is not smooth on Samsung Video Player and third-party apps like VLC; videos appear to run at 15-18 fps instead of 30 fps, causing a shutter effect on Samsung Galaxy F14 5G with UI 7.0.
rows.Summarized Problem: 4K video playback is not smooth and fails to run at expected frame rates on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot play 4K videos smoothly, resulting in a severe stuttering effect that makes video viewing unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The device's VP9 decoder only supports 2K playback by design; without hardware VP9 decoding, software playback is highly dependent on the AP's performance and cannot be resolved by Samsung.

rows.Title: Error Unable To Use App You Are Using Key Logger Software occurs while using SBI YONO Merchant App
rows.Problem: When using SBI YONO MERCHANT App, an error "Unbale To Use App You Are Using Key Logger Software" appears. Customer care has been contacted but no solution was found.
rows.Summarized Problem: The SBI YONO Merchant App displays a misleading security warning message indicating that key logger software is being used.
rows.Severity Reason: The error message is inaccurate and may mislead users, but the app remains functional and does not cause crashes or data loss.

rows.Title: Settings open slowly
rows.Problem: Device becomes slower when opening any settings
rows.Summarized Problem: Settings take a long time to open, causing device to become slow.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of setting load, not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Log dumping is a heavy process that can slow system performance; guide users to take logs properly and provide more details if issue recurs.

rows.Title: Wuthering Weaves game crashes every 5-10 minutes during gameplay
rows.Problem: Wuthering Weaves game crashes every 5-10 minutes during gameplay and causes significant heating. The issue occurs regardless of installation source (Google Play Store or Galaxy Store). Attempts to resolve via cache clearing, restart, uninstall, and reinstall have failed.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Wuthering Weaves game crashes every 5-10 minutes during gameplay and causes excessive heating.
rows.Severity Reason: The game crashes repeatedly during gameplay, making it unusable and causing device overheating, which impacts user experience and device stability.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue belongs to a third-party application. It should be checked and fixed by the app owner. We lack source code and no commercial agreement with the app developer.

rows.Title: Unable to register fingerprint
rows.Problem: Unable to register fingerprint. Device experiences lags, especially when switching from picture to video mode. Camera performance is slow.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot register their fingerprint and experience significant lag when switching between picture and video modes in the camera app.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial functionality (fingerprint registration) and performance lag, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: There is no camera app log. Please update log and video after the camera issue occurred.

rows.Title: Camera not working
rows.Problem: Camera is not working after update
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera function is not working after the software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera is a core device function; its failure renders the device unusable for basic operations.
rows.R&D Comment: From the logs attached in the issue, it is not enough to find root cause. Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Unable to place the call in the first attempt
rows.Problem: Unable to place the call in the first attempt and today iam Unable to lift the call also attached screenshot for reference
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot place a call on the first attempt and are unable to lift an active call.
rows.Severity Reason: Users are unable to initiate or end calls, which are fundamental to device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Temporary network signaling issue. Countermeasure: User advised to contact service center if issue persists.

rows.Title: notifications taking time to come to watch ultra
rows.Problem: notifications are taking time to come to watch ultra 2024, some are not coming, and some come only after invoking the watch screen; this occurs across multiple apps
rows.Summarized Problem: Notifications take a long time to appear on the Galaxy Watch Ultra, with some never arriving or appearing only after manually invoking the screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves delayed notification delivery across multiple apps, affecting user experience but not causing device failure or data loss.

rows.Title: Earpiece speaker distortion in One UI 7
rows.Problem: Earpiece speaker distortion returns after several hours or days of use, resolves after reboot, but reoccurs over time. Sound works fine initially, then distorts again. Indicates a background process or audio routing bug, not hardware-based.
rows.Summarized Problem: Earpiece speaker produces distorted sound after prolonged use, which resolves with reboot but returns over time.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects audio quality intermittently but does not cause device failure or crash, and is not fully resolved by reboot.
rows.R&D Comment: According to the log analysis by s/w team, there is no abnormal behavior. It seems to need to visit the service center and check if speaker material is defective.

rows.Title: Game performance sluggish
rows.Problem: BGMI game experiences sudden lag and FPS skip when encountering enemies, with no optimization or action taken by Samsung for Tab S9.
rows.Summarized Problem: The BGMI game on the Tab S9 experiences sudden lag and FPS drops when encountering enemies, leading to a poor gameplay experience.
rows.Severity Reason: The lag and FPS skip disrupt gameplay continuity and make the game unplayable during critical moments, resulting in a major functional impairment.
