rows.Problem: Videos get lagging while watching shorts videos on youtube, occurring often despite troubleshooting
rows.Summarized Problem: Videos lag while watching YouTube Shorts, occurring frequently despite troubleshooting.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves intermittent lag during video playback, affecting user experience but not causing device failure or data loss.

rows.Title: Suggested app background always in light theme
rows.Problem: The finder search bar is always in light theme
rows.Summarized Problem: The finder search bar remains in light theme regardless of device settings.
rows.Severity Reason: It is a cosmetic UI issue that does not affect device usability or functionality.

rows.Title: Error pop when updating weather app
rows.Problem: Weather app showing pop up error when updating, happening frequently
rows.Summarized Problem: The weather app shows a pop-up error when attempting to update, occurring frequently.
rows.Severity Reason: The error occurs frequently during updates, causing partial malfunction of the app functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: User network environment appears abnormal. It is being mapped to an unknown IP address. Please check network environment.

rows.Title: Calculations doesn't work properly in Notes
rows.Problem: Calculations don't work properly in the notes app
rows.Summarized Problem: Calculations are not working properly in the Notes app.
rows.Severity Reason: The calculation feature is not functioning, leading to partial malfunction in a core functionality of the Notes app.

rows.Title: Voice not heard in voice calls
rows.Problem: Since the UI 8 update, no voice is heard by the front during calls, and background voice is also not clear
rows.Summarized Problem: No voice is heard during voice calls, both front and background audio is inaudible.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot make or receive voice calls as intended, rendering the calling function unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Unusual software change detected
rows.Problem: Unusual software change detected
rows.Summarized Problem: An unusual software change has been detected in the system interface.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a detected software change but does not result in device malfunction or data loss, suggesting it is partial and not critical.

rows.Title: Galaxy Ring frequently keeps disconnecting from mobile device
rows.Problem: Galaxy Ring frequently keeps disconnecting from mobile device. It shows that it is fully charged and still keeps disconnecting. It stays disconnected more time than it is connected and is now becoming very difficult to not be upset about it. Already the battery life had substantially declined and stayed for only one day and now these disconnection issues.
rows.Summarized Problem: Galaxy Ring frequently disconnects from mobile device despite being fully charged, with prolonged disconnection periods and degraded battery life.
rows.Severity Reason: The device frequently disconnects, leading to inconsistent functionality and user frustration, with battery life substantially reduced, making it unusable for daily use.

rows.Title: 5G not latching in device
rows.Problem: Airtel SIM shows only 4G network despite 5G network preferred setting, while same SIM works on another phone with 5G. MIPI test fails due to hardware components reported as not good: DevInst, BUS, MID, USID, STATUS, RF_Component.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device fails to connect to 5G network when using an Airtel SIM, even with 5G preferred, while the same SIM works on another phone.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to establish 5G connectivity despite correct settings, indicating a critical failure in network functionality that prevents proper 5-5G operation.
rows.R&D Comment: MIPI test fails due to hardware components (DevInst, BUS, MID, USID, STATUS, RF_Component) reported as not good; recommend hardware inspection and replacement at service center.

rows.Title: Status Bar Text and Icons Visibility Issue
rows.Problem: When pulling down the notification or quick settings shade, status bar icons switch to white while the background remains light and slightly transparent, making them hard to see. This occurs on light or white-themed apps like Flipkart.
rows.Summarized Problem: Status bar icons become difficult to see when the background is light or transparent during quick settings or notification pull.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visibility during common interactions but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.

rows.Title: Background blur removed after editing Portrait Image
rows.Problem: Background blur is lost after saving a portrait photo; the blur effect appears during editing but disappears after saving, making the background unblurry and showing nearby objects like trees.
rows.Summarized Problem: The background blur effect in portrait photos is lost after saving, appearing only during editing and not persisting in the final image.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to persist after editing, resulting in inconsistent user experience but does not render the device unusable or cause crashes.

rows.Title: Call Waiting Option show disable in Call setting
rows.Problem: Call waiting options not opening
rows.Summarized Problem: The call waiting option does not open in call settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing and does not function, but the overall device remains usable.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Green dot appear above Battery Icon
rows.Problem: A duplicate green dot appears above the battery icon on the homepage and shifts into the battery icon on the lockscreen. This is not related to camera or microphone as the green dot is positioned to the right of the battery icon; it is a dummy or duplicate green dot.
rows.Summarized Problem: A duplicate green dot appears above the battery icon on the homepage and moves into the battery icon on the lockscreen, indicating a UI display anomaly.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the visual presentation of the battery icon but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.

rows.Title: mobile date does not switch automatically
rows.Problem: mobile data does not switch automatically when wifi connectivity is lost or disconnected; user must manually turn off wifi for mobile data to activate
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile data fails to switch automatically when Wi-Fi connectivity is lost or disconnected, requiring manual intervention to enable mobile data.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent connectivity failure but does not render the device unusable or result in data loss.

rows.Title: Heating issue after UI 8 update
rows.Problem: Heating issue after UI 8 update, device gives log data during heating
rows.Summarized Problem: Device overheats after UI 8 update, with log data generated during heating events.
rows.Severity Reason: The device overheats after an update, but does not become unusable or crash, indicating a partial malfunction affecting thermal behavior.

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery drain issues
rows.Summarized Problem: Device experiences significant battery drain after the ONE UI 8 update.
rows.Severity Reason: Battery drain prevents device from staying powered for normal usage, leading to frequent recharging and device unusability.

rows.Title: Picture are deleted after that update
rows.Problem: My pics are deleted after that update only those ones are which are clicked by this phone and now Camera showing this
rows.Summarized Problem: Photos taken with the phone are being deleted after the update and are no longer visible in the gallery.
rows.Severity Reason: Photos taken by the device are being permanently deleted, which results in loss of user data and renders the camera functionality unusable.

rows.Title: HDR playback not visible
rows.Problem: Unable to see HDR playback on Netflix on Samsung Galaxy S23 despite following software update and troubleshooting steps.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot see HDR playback on Netflix on Samsung Galaxy S23.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents HDR content from being viewed, but the core functionality (playing videos) remains available, and users can still access content through standard playback.

rows.Title: Nav star app not working proper
rows.Problem: When searching on Google and visiting a webpage, redirected to Google Chrome, where behind the hint bar the NavStar app appears larger. Turning on and off the transparent hint bar in NavStar on Goodlock resolves the issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: The NavStar app hint bar appears enlarged when navigating from Google, and the issue is resolved by toggling the transparent hint bar.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects UI appearance during navigation but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes or data loss.

rows.Title: Server not available popup occurs while try to sync with Galaxy watch3
rows.Problem: Cannot connect to Galaxy Watch 3 when toggling the sync button
rows.Summarized Problem: A 'Server not available' popup appears when attempting to sync with Galaxy Watch 3, preventing connection.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents connection to a device, but does not cause device freeze or data loss, and can be resolved by re-attempting sync or restarting the feature.

rows.Title: Frame drop occurs while play YouTube video
rows.Problem: Video lacks during playback, requiring closure and reopening of YouTube to restore smooth playback
rows.Summarized Problem: YouTube video experiences frame drops leading to choppy playback, requiring app restart to recover smooth performance.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent playback failure but does not render the device unusable or result in data loss.

rows.Title: Theme park not fully applied on Quick Panel
rows.Problem: Theme park settings from Goodlock are not fully applied on Quick Panel; only button color changes are visible. The issue started after updating to One UI 8.0 on Samsung Tab S9 FE.
rows.Summarized Problem: Theme park settings do not fully apply to the Quick Panel, only button color changes are visible.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual customization but does not prevent device usage or cause system crashes.

rows.Title: unable to download notification edge app
rows.Problem: unable to download notification edge app and whenever I try to download it is being shown as error. All the other edge panels were downloaded but I only have problem downloading this notification edge app
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot download the notification edge app, which fails with an error despite successful downloads of other edge panels.
rows.Severity Reason: The app fails to download, but other edge panels work, indicating a partial malfunction rather than complete device failure.

rows.Title: Quick panel is not transparent
rows.Problem: The notification panel looks odd and is not transparent as on my phone
rows.Summarized Problem: The quick panel notification panel appears opaque instead of transparent, differing from the user's device experience.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual appearance but does not impact device functionality or usability.

rows.Title: Low light turns off automatically
rows.Problem: Low light mode turns on randomly and turns off suddenly at night. The device also charges either very fast or very slowly. Unknown cause.
rows.Summarized Problem: Low light mode turns on and off randomly, causing inconsistent display behavior.
rows.Severity Reason: The random on/off behavior of low light mode disrupts normal usage and makes the device unusable in low-light conditions.

rows.Title: Camera skin tone changes upon zooming
rows.Problem: Camera facing issue with skin tone change upon zooming
rows.Summarized Problem: The skin tone of a person changes when the camera is zoomed in.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual accuracy during camera use but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.

rows.Title: Lag observed in the device
rows.Problem: Lag observed in the first swipe with a delay, followed by no further delay. This happens almost every time on a new device.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device exhibits lag during the first swipe, with a noticeable delay that occurs consistently on new devices.
rows.Severity Reason: The lag occurs on every swipe and affects initial device usability, making it unusable for immediate interaction.

rows.Title: Device lags and UI gets interrupted when a call is received
rows.Problem: When someone calls, the screen shows "INCOMING CALL" with options that are greyed out and cannot be used. The call eventually disconnects and is shown as "MISSED CALL" for all numbers, saved or unsaved.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device's UI becomes unresponsive during incoming calls, showing greyed-out options and incorrectly marking calls as missed.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot interact with the call interface, leading to a complete loss of functionality during an incoming call, which is a core usability requirement.

rows.Title: Directional input problem
rows.Problem: Bluetooth controller loses directional input or disconnects when phone screen turns off or goes to sleep during Samsung DeX mode, especially after One UI updates.
rows.Summarized Problem: Bluetooth controller loses directional input when phone screen sleeps during Samsung DeX mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial functionality failure in controller input during DeX mode, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.

rows.Title: Location app is not working
rows.Problem: location data from mock location app is not working
rows.Summarized Problem: The location app is not functioning, with mock location data failing to work.
rows.Severity Reason: The location app is completely non-functional, preventing core device functionality such as location-based services.

rows.Title: Lock Screen widgets disappear when charging
rows.Problem: Lock screen widgets disappear when device is plugged to charging, returning to normal when unplugged. Issue is intermittent and does not affect charging function or battery level.
rows.Summarized Problem: Lock screen widgets disappear when charging and return after unplugging, indicating a functional failure during charging.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of the lock screen functionality during charging, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.

rows.Title: SIM card disconnects
rows.Problem: SIM card frequently disconnects, preventing calls and messages
rows.Summarized Problem: The SIM card frequently disconnects, preventing calls and messages.
rows.Severity Reason: The frequent disconnection prevents essential communication functions, making the device unusable for calls and messages.

rows.Title: 5G internet is working slow
rows.Problem: 5G internet on my phone is running slow
rows.Summarized Problem: 5G internet connection is running slowly on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of 5G network performance, which affects usability but does not render the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Photos and videos not present in secure folder after device restart
rows.Problem: Photos and videos saved in secure folder are missing after cache deletion and device restart
rows.Summarized Problem: Photos and videos saved in the secure folder are missing after cache deletion and device restart.
rows.Severity Reason: Data is missing after a restart, but the user can still access the device and core functions are intact, indicating partial malfunction.

rows.Title: YouTube picture quality drops to 360p/48
rows.Problem: YouTube video quality drops to 360p or 480p
rows.Summarized Problem: YouTube video quality drops to 360p or 480p instead of higher resolutions.
rows.Severity Reason: The video quality is lower than expected, affecting user experience but does not cause device crash or data loss.

rows.Title: Camera app is not working
rows.Problem: My camera is not working and diagnostic test shows an error
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera app is not functioning and diagnostic tests show an error.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera app is completely non-functional, preventing basic device usage.

rows.Title: Google search widget not visible on home screen
rows.Problem: The Google Search widget is no longer visible on the home screen. When tapping and holding the space where it was placed, it gets selected but does not appear on the screen.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Google Search widget is missing from the home screen and does not display when tapped and held.
rows.Severity Reason: The widget is not visible and does not appear on screen, but the device remains usable and no major function is disrupted.

rows.Title: Wrong count shown for whatsapp messages in notification
rows.Problem: whatsapp issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The notification shows an incorrect message count for WhatsApp.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of the notification display, affecting user experience but not causing device failure or data loss.

rows.Title: Adaptive Clock function stops when modes are turned on
rows.Problem: The Adaptive Clock feature in One UI 8 stops working whenever the system changes Modes. As soon as a Mode activates (such as Sleep, Work, or Driving Mode), the Adaptive Clock no longer updates or switches wallpapers. Even after the Mode ends, the Adaptive Clock does not resume functioning automatically.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Adaptive Clock feature stops working when system modes are activated and fails to resume after mode is deactivated.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to function during mode transitions but does not cause device crash or data loss, only partial functionality loss.

rows.Title: Wifi calling turns off automatically
rows.Problem: I have attached a screen recording
rows.Summarized Problem: WiFi calling turns off automatically without user intervention.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature turns off unexpectedly, which affects usability but does not cause device failure or data loss.

rows.Title: Clock animation not working
rows.Problem: Clock animation is not working on Samsung A56
rows.Summarized Problem: The clock animation on the lock screen is not functioning properly on Samsung A56.
rows.Severity Reason: The clock animation is missing or not working, which affects visual feedback but does not render the device unusable or crash.

rows.Title: Dual SIM functionalities not working
rows.Problem: Dual SIM issue after software update: when only SIM 1 is inserted, mobile data and SMS do not work; when both SIMs are inserted, SIM 1 shows 'No service' and 'Mobile Networks' and 'SIM Manager' settings are greyed out. Both SIMs work in other phones. Factory reset and software recovery did not fix it.
rows.Summarized Problem: Dual SIM functionality is not working properly after a software update, with SIM 1 showing no service and settings being greyed out when both SIMs are inserted.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents full use of dual SIM functionality, which is a core feature for many users, leading to device unusability in specific scenarios.

rows.Title: Portrait filters missing
rows.Problem: Portrait filters missing in Galaxy A35
rows.Summarized Problem: Portrait filters are missing in the Galaxy A35 camera app.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing, but the device remains usable and core functions operate normally.

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery drain fast after ONE UI 8 update on Galaxy A35; no solution found despite resets, software updates, and visits to Samsung service centers.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences rapid battery drain after the ONE UI 8 update.
rows.Severity Reason: Battery drain severely impacts device usability and daily operation, making the device impractical to use without charging.

rows.Title: Black vertical lines appear in low light
rows.Problem: Vertical black lines appear on the screen during video recording, photo capture, and while viewing through the camera app, especially under low-light conditions. The lines appear randomly and affect both video and image quality.
rows.Summarized Problem: Vertical black lines appear randomly in low-light conditions during video and photo capture, affecting image and video quality.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects both video and photo quality in low light, leading to a major malfunction of the camera's core functionality.

rows.Title: Unable to download the update
rows.Problem: Software update fails to start and pauses repeatedly, showing 'couldn't update' message despite network changes
rows.Summarized Problem: The software update fails to start and repeatedly pauses, resulting in a failure to complete the update process.
rows.Severity Reason: The update process fails to start and pauses repeatedly, preventing users from receiving new software, which is a core system functionality.

rows.Title: Run Linux terminal on Android
rows.Problem: The option for enabling "linux development environment" on my Samsung phone is not responding. I can see the ui but it is not responding.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Linux development environment option on the Samsung phone is not responding and does not function.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is not responding, but the UI is visible, indicating partial malfunction rather than complete device failure.

rows.Title: Fingerprint sensor not responding
rows.Problem: Fingerprint sensor not working please check error this come than 10 day
rows.Summarized Problem: The fingerprint sensor is not responding and has been malfunctioning for over 10 days.
rows.Severity Reason: The sensor failure prevents biometric authentication, making device access impossible.

rows.Title: Good lock app homeup transition effect not working
rows.Problem: Good lock app issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The transition effect in the HomeUp feature of the Good Lock app is not working.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the visual experience but does not prevent device usage or cause system failure.

rows.Title: Photos lost when moving from secure folder gallery to private album
rows.Problem: Unable to move photos from secure folder gallery to private album, resulting in loss of photos
rows.Summarized Problem: Users lose photos when attempting to move them from the secure folder gallery to a private album.
rows.Severity Reason: Users lose data during a critical operation, which results in irreversible loss of photos and videos.

rows.Title: Proximity sensor is not working
rows.Problem: The proximity sensor is not working
rows.Summarized Problem: The proximity sensor is not functioning properly.
rows.Severity Reason: The sensor is not working, which prevents the device from detecting when the phone is near the user's face, leading to potential malfunction during calls.

rows.Title: Studio App Keeps Stopping after save edit video
rows.Problem: The Studio App crashes when saving changes to a video after editing in the gallery app.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Studio App crashes when saving edited videos.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes during a critical operation (saving video edits), making it unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: We added defense code to prevent crash in this case. Please check it with app version 7.1.8.0 or later.

rows.Title: System's UI not responding
rows.Problem: System's UI not responding
rows.Summarized Problem: The system's user interface is not responding.
rows.Severity Reason: The UI is unresponsive, making the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: ANR occur in SystemUI due to accessing telephonyManager API in MobileConnectionRepositoryImpl. Telephony team suggested to apply try catch in problem code block and it is applied in UTAH branch with CL#30708369. As discussed with our Part Leader, only critical patches are allowed to be applied in PROD_UTAH, so it will not be applied in PROD_UTAH. The changes will reflect in B OS (OneUI 8.0). Please maintain current state for UTAH models.

rows.Title: AI generative icon not available in gallery
rows.Problem: unable to see AI generative logo between favorite and edit icon
rows.Summarized Problem: The AI generative icon is missing in the gallery interface between the favorite and edit icons.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a UI element, preventing visibility of a feature but not rendering the app unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue may occur if "Show menu in viewer bottom" is turned on through Gallery labs. Gallery Labs is not an official setting; users should reset it and avoid using it.

rows.Title: Eye comfort shield doesn't work while using Samsung wallet
rows.Problem: Eye comfort shield doesn't work while using Samsung wallet
rows.Summarized Problem: The eye comfort shield feature does not function while using Samsung Wallet.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails during use, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The eye comfort shield is temporarily disabled during fingerprint authentication to ensure proper sensor performance; this is a known limitation due to optical fingerprint sensor sensitivity to screen lighting.

rows.Title: Face issue with recyclebin
rows.Problem: When deleting an image, it does not delete and shows 'can move the file please try again' with an error acquired message at the bottom of the screen
rows.Summarized Problem: Images are not properly deleted and instead show a 'can move the file please try again' error message in the recyclebin.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction where deletion fails and shows an error, but the device remains usable and no data is lost.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: User is using an incorrect version of the My Files app. Countermeasure: Uninstall updates and reinstall the app.

rows.Title: Camera failed
rows.Problem: Issue persists after reset; device still shows camera failure
rows.Summarized Problem: The rear wide (x1.0) camera is not functioning despite reset attempts.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera function is completely failing, rendering a key device feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: There is some rear Wide(x1.0) camera HW error in the attached log. Please visit to CS center and request to check the rear Wide(x1.0) camera module or related HW.

rows.Title: Screen refresh rate issue at 60Hz
rows.Problem: The 60Hz refresh rate is very unoptimized and feels like it is operating at 10-12Hz, making the experience highly unsatisfactory.
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen refresh rate at 60Hz is poorly optimized and appears to operate at a much lower effective rate, causing a laggy and unsatisfactory user experience.
rows.Severity Reason: The screen feels unresponsive and operates at a drastically reduced refresh rate, significantly impairing usability and performance.
rows.R&D Comment: There are no abnormal logs; reproduction steps and video are missing. If issue recurs, provide reproduction steps, video, and time logs with systrace.

rows.Title: PIP Mode not working properly while rotating device
rows.Problem: Inconsistencies in auto rotate and PIP mode animations on a flagship level phone
rows.Summarized Problem: PIP mode fails to function correctly during device rotation, causing inconsistent animations.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of a core UI feature during device rotation, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: No further OS VER 14 release planned. Please check issue on latest OS VER 15 and update accordingly.

rows.Title: Overheating issue
rows.Problem: Phone heats abnormally after using Amazon UPI scan, causing glitches and inability to type, internet drops, and device performance issues
rows.Summarized Problem: Phone overheats during Amazon UPI scan, leading to performance glitches and internet disconnection.
rows.Severity Reason: Device overheats during use, causing functional glitches and loss of usability, making it unusable for basic tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: During use of in.amazon.mShop.android.shopping for Amazon UPI scan, heating is due to high CPU and network consumption, multiple app launches, and increased battery thermistor readings.

rows.Title: Battery drainage issue
rows.Problem: Battery level rapidly decreased from 7% to 3% without significant usage, dropping to 1% by 4:24 PM despite no major device usage.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences rapid battery drain without significant usage.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drains rapidly to 1% in a short period without noticeable usage, indicating a major power consumption issue that renders the device unusable quickly.

rows.Title: AOD not working
rows.Problem: The Always on display is very dim and not visible in normal lighting conditions. It shows time, date, and battery percentage only when double-tapped, and the brightness increases upon tapping. Otherwise, it remains very dim.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Always On Display is too dim and not visible under normal lighting conditions, making time, date, and battery percentage unreadable.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visibility of key information under normal lighting but does not cause device crash or data loss.

rows.Title: video recording problem
rows.Problem: Video shows 50/50 stuttering when switching from 1440P 60 HDR to 2160P 60 HDR, with screen recording struggling to capture the stuttering accurately.
rows.Summarized Problem: Video recording stutters at 2160P 60 HDR resolution due to unsupported playback on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot handle 2160P 60 HDR playback, causing significant stuttering that affects video quality and usability during recording.
rows.R&D Comment: This model uses Exynos1380 chipset which has max support of playback is UHD@30fps (2160p@30fps). When playing in Youtube app 4K 60fps resolution is selected, which is not supported. So it should be played at FHD 60fps, but it seems to be played at lower resolution. This is problem from Youtube side so it's reported to Google and they are checking it: b/329373194 [SHADOWED b/329373032] [Youtube]

rows.Title: Wi-Fi isn't turning On
rows.Problem: Please check it
rows.Summarized Problem: Wi-Fi is not turning on, indicating a hardware or connection failure.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to establish Wi-Fi connectivity, which is essential for basic network functionality, making the device unusable without internet access.
rows.R&D Comment: PCIe link down has been failed with Wi-Fi and AP. Please guide that customer should contact to local service center for checking FPCB.

rows.Title: Notes Functions not working
rows.Problem: When trying to open the notes app and go to drawing option, it doesn't work and automatically reaches the home page.
rows.Summarized Problem: The drawing function in the Notes app fails and redirects to the home screen when accessed.
rows.Severity Reason: The function does not work properly but does not cause device crash or complete failure, only partial malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue fixed in new version. Please wait for new version of Samsung Notes on market app update will release soon.

rows.Title: Auto restart device but not turn on
rows.Problem: Phone restart automatically but not turning on when cx hold the power for longer then usual then it turned on
rows.Summarized Problem: Device restarts automatically without turning on when power is held for an extended duration.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to power on after restart, making it unusable until the issue is resolved.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide complete ramdump logs to analyse the root cause of the issue.

rows.Title: Unable to use Keep open Setting
rows.Problem: Users cannot keep more than one application open in recent apps on Galaxy M35. The feature works flawlessly on other devices like Galaxy F15 and M53.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot keep more than one application open in recent apps on Galaxy M35, while the same feature works on other devices.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of a feature, limited to specific devices, not causing device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: As per current scenario, devices with 8GB RAM can only have one app kept open in recents. This is normal behavior; if changed, it will be addressed in future updates. Keep open app limit: <8 GB = 0, 8 GB = 1, 12 GB = 3, 16 GB = 5.

rows.Title: Jitter and Lag while scrolling apps
rows.Problem: Stuttering and jitters occur while scrolling apps, with pauses of up to a second. The issue persists across all applications, including Samsung apps, and has been present since purchase.
rows.Summarized Problem: Apps stutter and jitter during scrolling due to poor system performance.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes noticeable lag and interruptions during app usage, making navigation difficult and impacting overall device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Storage not updating after file deletion
rows.Problem: Storage display shows incorrect size after file deletion; correct after device restart
rows.Summarized Problem: The device shows incorrect storage size after file deletion, only correcting after a restart.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects storage accuracy after deletion but resolves after restart, causing partial malfunction of file management.

rows.Title: Tap & Pay feature unavailable in Samsung Wallet
rows.Problem: Tap & Pay feature unavailable in Samsung Wallet despite NFC capability
rows.Summarized Problem: Tap & Pay feature is unavailable in Samsung Wallet despite the device having NFC capability.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing but not fully broken; the device has NFC capability but the feature is not available due to platform limitations.
rows.R&D Comment: As the device does not have DRK support, Pay card is not supported. Hence it is decided to go with Mini version of Samsung Wallet which is the current expected behavior.

rows.Title: Device lags while playing any game
rows.Problem: Device lags during gameplay, especially with small games like Shadow Fight 4, despite having ample free memory and RAM Plus enabled. Performance degrades significantly when gaming, even on a device with Snapdragon Gen 2 chip.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences significant lag when playing games, even small ones, despite sufficient memory and optimized settings.
rows.Severity Reason: Gameplay is severely impacted, making the device unusable for typical usage scenarios, especially under load.
rows.R&D Comment: Device temperature rises during gaming, particularly in multiwindow mode; recommend disabling alternate game performance management and playing in cooler, stable environments to reduce thermal load.

rows.Title: Battery reducing rapidly
rows.Problem: Battery is reducing by 1 percent every 30 seconds, even with no background apps running and memory cleaned. Device care shows great condition, yet battery drains continuously.
rows.Summarized Problem: Battery is draining at an abnormal rate of 1% every 30 seconds despite no background apps and clean memory.
rows.Severity Reason: Device is losing battery at a rapid rate, which makes it unusable without charging, indicating a critical hardware or system issue.
rows.R&D Comment: Voltage has dropped below 3.4V with observed fluctuations; device should be sent to HQ for hardware inspection to check SOC-voltage mismatch.

rows.Title: Network fluctuating
rows.Problem: Losing signal while using 5G mode, during calls and data usage
rows.Summarized Problem: Users experience intermittent signal loss while using 5G mode during calls and data activity.
rows.Severity Reason: Signal loss during active calls and data usage renders the device unusable in real-world scenarios.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Network Issue
rows.Problem: VoLTE not working on A23 with BSNL SIM, downgrades to 2G during calls, no internet available. Works on A14 with same SIM. Works on A23 with BSN4G SIM. Issue appears to be device-specific with SIM.
rows.Summarized Problem: VoLTE is not working on A23 with BSNL SIM, downgrading to 2G during calls and losing internet, while working on other devices and with different SIMs.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial functionality failure (VoLTE not working) under specific conditions, but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Bug report Captured popup appeared in watch repeatedly
rows.Problem: Error reports appear repeatedly on Galaxy Watch indicating the report will be sent to mobile, but it is not happening. User experience with Samsung support has been poor.
rows.Summarized Problem: A repeated popup appears on the Galaxy Watch indicating a bug report will be sent to mobile, but the report is not actually sent.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents the user from receiving confirmation that a report has been sent, but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: When an accessory log is sent from Samsung Members, the connected watch's log is acquired and a screen for log acquisition is shown. This is normal behavior.

rows.Title: GPS is not working
rows.Problem: GPS is not working. I tried all the troubleshooting steps, but no success.
rows.Summarized Problem: GPS functionality is not working on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: GPS is a core navigation and location feature; its failure prevents basic device functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Suttle vibration when increasing or decreasing volume
rows.Problem: Suttle vibration when increasing or decreasing volume to extreme high or low levels, which sometimes does not work after December update on A55 device.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users experience subtle vibration when adjusting volume to extreme levels, with intermittent failure after the December update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects volume control functionality intermittently, impacting user experience but not causing device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The problem is hard to diagnose due to lack of logs when volume is adjusted to extreme levels. If it occurs again, users should provide logs immediately after the event.

rows.Title: haptic feedback vibration is low
rows.Problem: the haptic feedback vibration on my s21fe exynos is very low after the latest november security patch update
rows.Summarized Problem: The haptic feedback vibration is significantly reduced after the latest software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects user experience but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Logs show no abnormalities; likely hardware motor defect. Recommend checking and replacing the motor component.

rows.Title: Poor Network warnings popup during online gaming
rows.Problem: Game shows 'Poor Network' warnings despite stable internet and low ping, even when connected to other devices.
rows.Summarized Problem: Online games display 'Poor Network' warnings despite stable internet and low ping.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves intermittent network warning display during gameplay, affecting user experience but not causing device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Camera Failed popup
rows.Problem: please find pic of the issue along with system log
rows.Summarized Problem: A popup appears indicating camera failure on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera failure popup prevents normal device usage and indicates a critical malfunction.

rows.Title: Screen freeze error
rows.Problem: Screen freezing occurs even after reset, cache clearing, and storage deletion. No third-party apps installed.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device screen freezes despite device reset, cache clearing, and storage deletion, with no third-party apps installed.
rows.Severity Reason: Screen freezing prevents normal device operation and renders the device unusable until resolved.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: OCTA's touch I2C signal operation is not working properly; Countermeasure: Replace OCTA first, then mainboard if symptoms persist.

rows.Title: Sound not coming in recorded video
rows.Problem: Unable to hear sound after recording video
rows.Summarized Problem: No sound is heard when recording videos using the camera.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of audio recording functionality, preventing sound from being captured during video recording.
rows.R&D Comment: Modify the "va-mic-mono-lpi" and "speaker-dmic-endfire" controls to make them compatible

rows.Title: Lagging in device while playing game in low graphics
rows.Problem: Lag and heat issue on Samsung phone while playing short term games in low graphics, resulting in choppiness, slow performance, and overheating
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences lag and overheating when playing games in low graphics, leading to choppiness and slow performance.
rows.Severity Reason: The lag and overheating significantly impair gameplay, making the device unusable during gaming sessions.
rows.R&D Comment: After charging, the phone's initial temperature is relatively high; using Instagram voice calls while gaming increases temperature, causing frequency limitations and lag. To prevent overheating, users should cool the phone to room temperature and manage background apps and in-game voice chat.

rows.Title: Can't change the password of "App timer" in digital wellbeing application
rows.Problem: I can't change the password of "App timer" in digital wellbeing application because I forgot the password. There's no option to re-set it, all it's showing is to contact the customer care service. But the customer care service is asking to go on a physical Samsung service centre. And the centre is too far from
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot reset the password for the App Timer in the Digital Wellbeing application, as there is no password recovery option available.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing but does not prevent full device usage or cause crashes or data loss; users are directed to a physical service centre, which is inconvenient but not critical.
rows.R&D Comment: If you don't remember your password, use the master pin code. Master pin code is Digital Wellbeing's App version. If Digital Wellbeing's App version is 5.1.02.8, please input pin code 51028. We plan to support a password retrieval function in the next version.

rows.Title: Fast charging stop working
rows.Problem: Phone does not detect charger initially, requires multiple plug-in attempts to detect, then charges slowly, taking approximately 4 hours to fully charge.
rows.Summarized Problem: Phone fails to detect charger initially and charges slowly after multiple attempts, taking over 4 hours to fully charge.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of charging functionality, where the device does not immediately detect the charger and charges slowly, but the device remains usable.
rows.R&D Comment: In the log, there is no information when your phone connected with charger. Please guide the customer to get the log when issue occurs for further analysis.

rows.Title: usb device not recognise error during call
rows.Problem: usb device not recognise error during call. ethernet works fine when connected, but usb device not recognised during call. after cutting the call, ethernet adapter works again. please fix in s23
rows.Summarized Problem: USB device is not recognised during phone calls, even when ethernet is working.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue occurs intermittently during calls and affects functionality under specific conditions, but does not cause device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: No further OS VER 14 release planned. Please check issue on latest OS VER 15 and update accordingly.

rows.Title: Drawing does not work in notes app widget
rows.Problem: Drawing does not work in notes app widget. This happens always.
rows.Summarized Problem: Drawing functionality is not working in the notes app widget.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely non-functional and prevents users from using the widget as intended.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue fixed in new version. Please wait new version of samsung Notes on market app update will release soon. Thank you

rows.Title: Samsung Photo Editor Not Functioning Properly
rows.Problem: Issue with Samsung Photo Editor Not Functioning Properly
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung Photo Editor fails to function properly due to issues during restoration of photo analysis data during smart switch.
rows.Severity Reason: The photo editor does not work correctly after smart switch, but functionality is partially restored and can be fixed automatically, indicating partial malfunction.
rows.Resolve Type: Issue Fixed(Fixed automatically by Main branch)
rows.R&D Comment: When the smart switch occurs, if the analyzed information of the photos from the previous device is restored in new device, the analysis information increased. But there was an issue during restoration so photo editor cannot saved normally. Duplicate restoration issue was resolved during Smart switch with large amount of analyzed images. - P240213-05083 : modification done. Please guide to user like below [Guide] In this issue case, analyzed information will not be deleted automatically.

rows.Title: Rear camera slow to start
rows.Problem: Rear camera is slow to start after recent update; front camera works fine
rows.Summarized Problem: The rear camera takes a long time to start after a recent software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera startup delay affects usability but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Camera module fails to open fast AEC; Timeout in Fast Aec Completion. Countermeasure: User to clear camera data/cache and restart; check 3rd party apps; share logs post-restart.

rows.Title: No network problem after recent update
rows.Problem: Phone faces no network and no SIM for 1-3 minutes, repeated 4-5 times per hour after system update
rows.Summarized Problem: Device fails to register network and detect SIM after system update, with repeated occurrences every hour.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves intermittent network registration failure, which affects functionality but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Mobile phone is still lagging or froze
rows.Problem: Phone getting slow and suddenly restarting. Then heating up. Cpu temperature going around and above 70°C
rows.Summarized Problem: The mobile phone is experiencing persistent lag and sudden restarts, accompanied by excessive heating and high CPU temperature.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is becoming unresponsive and frequently restarting, leading to a loss of usability and potential hardware instability.
rows.R&D Comment: There are multiple KP on different call stacks in a single day, check for hardware inspection

rows.Title: Video player is unresponsive when trying to generate slow-motion video
rows.Problem: My Galaxy Tab S10 video player is unresponsive when attempting to generate slow-motion video clips from existing footage
rows.Summarized Problem: The video player fails to respond when attempting to generate slow-motion video clips from existing footage.
rows.Severity Reason: The video player crashes during slow-motion video generation, making the feature completely unusable.

rows.Title: latency between video and sound on every app
rows.Problem: When playing something while connected to Bluetooth headphones, there is latency between video and sound on every app, with videos lagging for a second and audio delay starting. The issue persists after system cache wipe and factory reset on both device and headphones. Headphones work fine on other devices.
rows.Summarized Problem: There is a latency issue between video and audio when using Bluetooth headphones on all apps, with persistent lag and audio delay.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects audio synchronization across apps but does not cause device crash or complete failure, and is reproducible only with specific hardware.
rows.R&D Comment: From logs, a2dp delay can be seen. Please check settings in soundassistant app: Soundassistant -> Bluetooth Metronome

rows.Title: Wrist detection on Watch 4 device is broken
rows.Problem: Wrist detection on the Watch 4 device is broken after the One UI 6 Watch update, with no foreign matter or damage found on the sensor, and the device is worn with a snug fit.
rows.Summarized Problem: Wrist detection function is no longer working on the Galaxy Watch 4 after the One UI 6 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot detect wrist presence, which is a core functionality for operation and user interaction, rendering the watch unusable without proper wear detection.
rows.R&D Comment: Wear-off occurred due to non-contact of electrode sensor; recommend checking for foreign matter or visiting a service center for electrode sensor inspection.

rows.Title: camera captured blurry image with poor focus
rows.Problem: camera captures blurry images with poor focus when scanning documents
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera fails to capture clear images with proper focus when scanning documents.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera cannot produce clear images of documents, making scanning functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: When capturing close and slanted objects with a large sensor, lens design leads to poor focus; customers should be guided to stay farther away and use zoom.

rows.Title: Pro video mode 9:21 ratio causes elongated video
rows.Problem: When using pro video mode with 9:21 ratio in UHD 60fps, the resulting video appears elongated, making objects look stretched and video quality significantly degraded.
rows.Summarized Problem: Video recorded in pro video mode with 9:21 ratio appears elongated, distorting object sizes and degrading video quality.
rows.Severity Reason: The distortion causes significant visual degradation, making the video unusable and undermining core camera functionality.

rows.Title: Unable to change wallpaper
rows.Problem: Unable to change lock screen wallpaper
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot change their lock screen wallpaper.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a UI feature, preventing users from updating their wallpaper but not causing device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: No further OS VER 14 release planned. Please check issue on latest OS VER 15 and update accordingly.

rows.Title: TITLE not showing while playing the video
rows.Problem: After updating the app, TITLE not showing while playing the video. Previously it was working normally without any issues. After the latest updates, many problems occurred.
rows.Summarized Problem: The video title is not displayed during playback.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a UI element, where the title is missing during video playback but the core functionality of playing video remains intact.

rows.Title: frame drop issue when switch to 2160p hdr 60 fps on youtube
rows.Problem: frame drop issue when switch to 2160p hdr 60 fps on youtube
rows.Summarized Problem: YouTube experiences frame drops when switching to 2160p HDR at 60fps.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot support 2160p at 60fps due to hardware limitations, causing visible frame drops that impair video playback experience.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by Exynos1380 chipset limiting playback to UHD@30fps; YouTube app requests 4K 60fps, which is unsupported. Countermeasure: YouTube should adjust resolution to FHD 60fps.

rows.Title: Camera captured hazy effect image on 10X zoom
rows.Problem: Camera on 10x zoom shows hazy effect, very irritating, requires developer fix
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera produces a hazy image when using 10X zoom, affecting image clarity and user experience.
rows.Severity Reason: The hazy effect significantly degrades image quality, especially at high zoom, making photos unusable and impacting core camera functionality.
rows.Resolve Type: Product Requirement, UX Guide, Standard Technical Specification
rows.R&D Comment: When zoom is operated during shooting, reduced angle of view and varying light exposure cause image degradation; this issue is due to differences in camera modules and lens conditions.

rows.Title: Battery draining fast
rows.Problem: Phone battery is draining fast after December software update
rows.Summarized Problem: Phone battery drains rapidly after the December software update.
rows.Severity Reason: Battery drain is significant but not causing device freeze or crash, and functionality remains usable.
rows.R&D Comment: Device battery drain issue is likely due to software update; require extended battery usage logs for accurate analysis.

rows.Title: Phone getting lags during normal usage
rows.Problem: Phone experiences input lags, app loading delays, jitters, and stutters during normal usage.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone experiences significant input lag and stutters during normal usage.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unresponsive and difficult to use due to severe lag and stuttering, impairing core user interaction.
rows.R&D Comment: The lag is caused by power saving mode limiting device performance and an ANR in a third-party VPN app; countermeasure is to disable the VPN app.

rows.Title: 5G network takes considerable time to connect after turning on mobile data
rows.Problem: 5G network takes considerable time to connect after turning on mobile data
rows.Summarized Problem: The device takes a long time to connect to 5G networks after turning on mobile data.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in 5G connection behavior, which persists despite user troubleshooting and proper settings.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Lag While Recording video
rows.Problem: Lag while recording video happening in every S23 I own. After the November patch update.
rows.Summarized Problem: Video recording experiences lag after the November patch update on all S23 devices.
rows.Severity Reason: Lag during recording prevents smooth video capture, making the feature unusable for users.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: wifi Calling is not working
rows.Problem: I tried all the options you suggested. Nothing has helped. I am uploading video of issue. Please have a look. This is consistent issue and causing lot of inconvenience.
rows.Summarized Problem: WiFi calling is not functioning on the device, despite attempts to resolve it.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue is consistent and prevents a core communication feature from working, causing significant user inconvenience.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Imobile app keep crashing
rows.Problem: Imobile app crashes every time when trying to login, started after last security patch update on Samsung Galaxy S23
rows.Summarized Problem: The iMobile app crashes repeatedly during login attempts on Samsung Galaxy S23 after a security patch update.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes during login, a critical function, making the user unable to access banking services.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue belongs to third-party application; it should be checked and fixed by the third-party app owner.

rows.Title: Camera zooming produces painted and crayon-like images
rows.Problem: Photos captured during camera zooming appear painted and like crayon drawings
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera produces painted and crayon-like images when zooming in.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in image quality during zoom, affecting visual output but not rendering the device unusable or causing crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Poor texture rendering during zoom. Countermeasure: Improve texture rendering in camera zoom function to enhance photo quality.

rows.Title: Home Page getting changed Automatically
rows.Problem: Customer upgraded the OS to the latest version, which is Jan 2025, but the issue still persists. I've attached a screen recording and logs for the same which was taken within 5-10 mins of the occurrence of the issue. Please let me know if any further details are needed.
rows.Summarized Problem: The home page is changing automatically after OS upgrade, disrupting user experience.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of the home screen behavior, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable or causing data loss.
rows.Resolve Type: Product Requirement, UX Guide, Standard Technical Specification
rows.R&D Comment: It is a "Add to Home" concept that the apps will be added: 1. Initially to first available position on the first available (left most) page except the Home Page (default). 2. If all other pages are full then app will be added to Home Page. 3. If Home Page is also full, then new page will be created (on the right) and app will be added to it. Thus, the app was not added on the home page even if the space was available. This ensures clean home screen layout on default page as per UX concept.

rows.Title: Unable to update S wallet App
rows.Problem: Samsung wallet couldn't update and has many bugs
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung Wallet app cannot update and has multiple bugs.
rows.Severity Reason: The app fails to update and has multiple bugs, preventing proper functionality.

rows.Title: Biometric option in security and privacy causing phone restart
rows.Problem: Touching biometric option in security and privacy causes phone to restart multiple times
rows.Summarized Problem: Tapping the biometric option in security and privacy triggers repeated phone restarts.
rows.Severity Reason: The device restarts repeatedly, making it unusable during the interaction, which is a critical system-level failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Given logs are insufficient to identify the root cause; complete RDX logs are required for analysis.

rows.Title: System UI keep Stop popup Occur
rows.Problem: Automatically stopped
rows.Summarized Problem: System UI automatically stops and shows a popup due to ANR caused by accessing telephonyManager API in MobileConnectionRepositoryImpl.
rows.Severity Reason: The system UI stopping leads to device instability and user disruption, making the device unusable during operation.
rows.R&D Comment: ANR occur in SystemUI due to accessing telephonyManager API in MobileConnectionRepositoryImpl. Telephony team suggested to apply try catch in problem code block and it is applied in UTAH branch with CL#30708369. As discussed with our Part Leader, only critical patches are allowed to be applied in PROD_UTAH, so it will not be applied in PROD_UTAH. The changes will reflect in B OS (OneUI 8.0). Please maintain current state for UTAH models.

rows.Title: Unable to access document session in My Files
rows.Problem: Unable to access the document session within My Files
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot access document sessions within the My Files app.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a core feature, preventing access to document sessions but not rendering the app unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Added code to fix in next app update version (15.0.07.5 or higher); users can sign out of Google Drive and re-sign in to resolve.

rows.Title: Camera stop working
rows.Problem: Camera is not working suddenly
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera suddenly stops working and fails to function.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera is completely non-functional, preventing basic device usage.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Power on camera failed; sensor open fail, possibly due to hardware failure. Counter Measure: Reboot device and send to SS center if issue persists.

rows.Title: Fingerprint sensor not working
rows.Problem: After software update to UI 6.1, fingerprint sensor is not responding despite multiple attempts to register the fingerprint.
rows.Summarized Problem: Fingerprint sensor is not responding after a software update.
rows.Severity Reason: User cannot authenticate using biometrics, rendering a core security and access function inoperable.
rows.R&D Comment: Fingerprint recognition may be affected by protective films or glass with poor light transmission; recommend checking for such usage.

rows.Title: Wifi and Hotspot not working
rows.Problem: WiFi and Hotspot settings fail to turn on; the interface briefly brightens but stops, and the feature hangs when attempting to toggle via settings or long press. Same behavior observed with Bluetooth.
rows.Summarized Problem: WiFi and Hotspot fail to activate and hang during setup, with no response after initial visual feedback.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot establish wireless connections, making basic network functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: WLAN driver loading fails, suspecting a hardware issue within the WiFi chipset. HW inspection required at CS center.

rows.Title: Drag and drop for text from browser not working
rows.Problem: Drag and drop for text from browser not working
rows.Summarized Problem: Drag and drop functionality for text from browser is not working.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially missing, preventing users from copying text from browsers to other apps, but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue is caused because Google Docs does not accept text drop from Samsung Internet. This is a third party app issue. Please maintain current status.

rows.Title: Fingerprint sensor not working
rows.Problem: Fingerprint sensor not working
rows.Summarized Problem: The fingerprint sensor is not functioning properly due to poor image quality.
rows.Severity Reason: The fingerprint sensor is a core biometric function; failure prevents user authentication and device access.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Poor image quality from fingerprint sensor. Countermeasure: Thick protective film may interfere; recommend checking at customer service center without film.

rows.Title: Unable to connect eSIM in watch
rows.Problem: Please check screen recording
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot connect to eSIM on the watch, and no eSIM profile is present or downloaded.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to establish eSIM connectivity, which is a fundamental functionality required for operation.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: No eSIM profile found in device; Counter Measure: Verify customer has properly downloaded eSIM profile.

rows.Title: Camera is not working
rows.Problem: Front and back camera including torch is not working; torch shows can't turn on because light is being used by another app
rows.Summarized Problem: Front and back camera and torch are not working, with torch unable to activate due to another app using the light.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera system is completely non-functional, including torch, preventing core device usage.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Mouse cannot resize any apps in multi-window mode
rows.Problem: The Mouse cannot resize any apps in multi-window mode. The click instead registers on the app/objects in the background. This causes major inconvenience when working with multiple apps. This issue happens with all apps. There is no issue with the window buttons and moving the entire window. A screen recording is attached where it clearly shows any attempts to resize the window fail, and instead the home screen scrolls.
rows.Summarized Problem: The mouse fails to resize apps in multi-window mode, causing clicks to register on background elements instead.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents effective app management in multi-window mode, making it unusable for users working with multiple applications.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue has been fixed in the latest binary.

rows.Title: Captured Images look dull and there is lack of focus in the photo
rows.Problem: Photos taken on Samsung f55 look dull and lack focus compared to Redmi k50i, with visible dullness in pink and brown colors under same lighting and distance conditions
rows.Summarized Problem: Photos taken on the device appear dull and lack focus, especially in colors like pink and brown, under consistent lighting and distance conditions.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects image clarity and color accuracy but does not cause device malfunction or data loss, and is visible only in specific color tones.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Normal phenomenon; Countermeasure: Normal phenomenon

rows.Title: Dolby Atmos sound has broken
rows.Problem: Dolby Atmos sound has broken after the 6.1.1 AI update on S23 Ultra. Before the update, the sound felt excellent; after, it is significantly weaker. Many users report the same issue. No fix has been provided despite customer feedback and moderator acknowledgment.
rows.Summarized Problem: Dolby Atmos sound functionality has degraded significantly after the 6-1-1 AI update on S23 Ultra, with users reporting much weaker audio output.
rows.Severity Reason: The sound is no longer functioning as expected, leading to a major degradation in audio experience, which is a core feature of the device.
rows.R&D Comment: Please communicate with customers to select their favorite mode among Dolby Auto/Movie/Music or Dolby Off.

rows.Title: Google play system update failed
rows.Problem: Google play system update failed to update error
rows.Summarized Problem: Google Play system update fails to update due to credential re-entry requirement.
rows.Severity Reason: The update process fails and requires user to re-enter credentials, making the system update unusable and preventing device from receiving critical updates.

rows.Title: Sound Picker keeps stopping
rows.Problem: Sound picker stops working
rows.Summarized Problem: The sound picker feature stops working unexpectedly.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to function, preventing users from selecting sound settings, which is a core usability function.
rows.R&D Comment: NullPointerException occurred in SecSoundPickerFragment when accessing internal routine; solution applied in V OS via CL#30191070.

rows.Title: Lines appear while taking video
rows.Problem: 2 lines appear while taking video
rows.Summarized Problem: Two lines appear during video recording.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in video recording functionality, where visual artifacts appear but do not cause device failure or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: This failure is due to camera sensor hardware fault. Please visit nearest Samsung support Centre for further help.

rows.Title: Mobile Data is Not working
rows.Problem: Mobile data is on but no network symbol. Tried phone restart, network reset, airplane mode, sim tray eject and insert, but no network connection.
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile data is enabled but shows no network symbol despite proper SIM insertion and device restarts.
rows.Severity Reason: Device shows no network signal despite mobile data being on, making basic connectivity impossible and rendering the device unusable for internet or calls.
rows.R&D Comment: No disconnection observed; data call response shows cause=NONE, indicating no network failure, but no actual connection. Recommend providing CP silent logs for deeper analysis.

rows.Title: Unable to Update sleep tracking
rows.Problem: Sleep tracking is gone haywire with missing hours and incorrect start and end times. Heart rate data is also missing. The watch detects sleep start and end times significantly off from actual times.
rows.Summarized Problem: Sleep tracking is malfunctioning with incorrect start and end times and missing heart rate data.
rows.Severity Reason: Sleep tracking is critical for user health data and is completely off, leading to inaccurate health insights and potential user confusion.

rows.Title: AI chat assistance not working
rows.Problem: AI chat assistance is not working on Samsung Messages after an update. Tried clearing cache and restarting phone, but issue persists.
rows.Summarized Problem: AI chat assistance is not functioning in Samsung Messages after a system update.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing after an update, but the device remains usable and basic functions operate normally.
rows.R&D Comment: No further OS VER 14 release planned. Please check issue on latest OS VER 15 and update accordingly.

rows.Title: Cannot find Good Lock app in Galaxy Store
rows.Problem: Unable to find Good Lock app on Galaxy Store; app is not available in user's region despite being useful and supported by Samsung users.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot find the Good Lock app in the Galaxy Store due to regional restrictions.
rows.Severity Reason: The app is missing from the store in certain regions, preventing users from accessing a useful feature, but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Good Lock is not available in the user's region currently, but plans exist to launch globally in the future.

rows.Title: Network reception issue with BSNL 4G
rows.Problem: Samsung Galaxy S24 FE has poor 4G network reception on BSNL, while other brands offer better reception at the same location and with the same SIM.
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung Galaxy S24 FE has poor 4G network reception on BSN
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves inconsistent network performance compared to other devices, indicating partial malfunction rather than complete device failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Battery Getting drain in normal Usage
rows.Problem: Battery usage summary shows 53% consumption in a day, but sum of individual app battery usage adds up to only 29.3%. This suggests unlisted background processes or activities are causing additional drain.
rows.Summarized Problem: Device battery drains faster than expected during normal usage due to unlisted background processes.
rows.Severity Reason: Partial malfunction: battery consumption data does not match app-level breakdown, indicating background drain but not full system failure or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery usage may differ from the sum of battery usage for each app in the app list because system usage and low-usage apps are not displayed. This is normal operation based on concept.

rows.Title: Camera quality degraded after Update
rows.Problem: Camera quality has degraded after software update, especially in low light with high zoom, resulting in blurry and shaky star images due to camera shake and noise reduction algorithms in night mode.
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera quality degrades significantly in low-light conditions with high zoom due to shaky images and noise reduction algorithms in night mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects image quality in specific conditions but does not cause device crash or complete failure, and is not universally disruptive.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Night mode in high zoom, low light produces shaky images due to camera shake and noise reduction algorithm. Counter Measure: Same as cause.

rows.Title: Volte does not latch in BSNL SIM
rows.Problem: No composer or file upload option; background log collection occurs; VoLTE works with 4G BSNL SIM but not with 5G BSNL SIM; issue occurs during flight mode toggle and SIM change
rows.Summarized Problem: VoLTE fails to register on BSNL 5G SIM but works on 4G BSN
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves intermittent functionality under specific network conditions, but does not cause device crash or complete failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Camera not working
rows.Problem: Camera is not working after device update
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera function is not working after a device update.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera is a major functionality that is completely non-operational, making the device unusable for basic tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: There are not enough logs to find root cause; please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Unable to Add Phone Number in Profile Sharing Card
rows.Problem: The phone number cannot be added for profile card sharing
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot add a phone number to a profile sharing card.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially missing, preventing phone number input but not causing device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Cannot get phone number from USIM. Countermeasure: Verify USIM information is valid.

rows.Title: Phone heats up after rough usage of 2 mins of camera
rows.Problem: Phone heats up during camera usage, especially with continuous on/off cycling, 5G data usage, and package usage. Temperature rises to 39-40 degrees but is within spec. Thermal management system is working fine.
rows.Summarized Problem: Phone heats up during continuous camera usage due to on/off cycling and 5G data, with temperature rising to 39-40 degrees but within specified limits.
rows.Severity Reason: Temperature rise is within specified limits and does not affect device usability or performance.
rows.R&D Comment: In the given set of logs no overheating found when using social media apps. Temperature only rise to 39-40 degree due to continuously camera on/off, 5G data usage and pkg usage. Temperature raise in this scenario is under spec. Thermal management system is working fine to control heat in the device.

rows.Title: Not able to play 4k content on phone
rows.Problem: Using Z Fold 5 with Netflix 4K UHD plan but unable to play 4K content despite software and app updates
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot play 4K content on their phones despite having a 4K UHD Netflix plan and updated software.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial failure in video playback functionality, not complete device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue is irreproducible on our end; no widevine errors in logs. User may need to clear app data/cache to resolve.

rows.Title: Theme not applying fully in dark mode
rows.Problem: Theme does not apply fully when dark mode is enabled or disabled; user reports inconsistent behavior and lack of resolution despite multiple complaints
rows.Summarized Problem: The theme does not apply fully when dark mode is enabled or disabled, resulting in inconsistent visual appearance.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of a UI feature but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: When dark mode is applied, theme resources are not applied; users should be guided that dark mode and theme resources cannot be used together.

rows.Title: Network reception issue
rows.Problem: Device has network reception issue with 4G frequency bands 70
rows.Summarized Problem: The device has poor network reception with 4G frequency bands 700MHz and 2100MHz, especially with BSNL SIM.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects network connectivity in specific bands but does not cause device crash or complete failure.
rows.R&D Comment: In the shared logs device was in LTE RAT. Please share the modem logs for detailed analysis of issue.

rows.Title: Camera not working
rows.Problem: Camera not functioning on both front and back after several attempts to resolve, including restarting and updating the mobile software.
rows.Summarized Problem: Both front and back cameras are not working despite multiple attempts to fix.
rows.Severity Reason: Camera is a core functionality; failure to access both cameras renders the device unusable for basic photo and video capture.
rows.R&D Comment: Camera module is faulty; recommend hardware inspection and replacement at service center.

rows.Title: unable to draw small circles using capacitive stylus
rows.Problem: Cannot draw small circles using capacitive stylus. It reads as a dot or a long press. There is excessive touch lag. The stylus works fine with all other devices. Small dots in video are attempts to draw small circles.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot draw small circles with the capacitive stylus, which instead registers as dots or long presses, with noticeable touch lag.
rows.Severity Reason: The stylus fails to register small circles accurately, resulting in a partial malfunction of the drawing function, but the device remains usable for general tasks.
rows.Resolve Type: Product Requirement, UX Guide, Standard Technical Specification

rows.Title: Unable to add widgets
rows.Problem: Unable to add widgets attaching recording
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot add widgets that attach recording functionality.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents a specific feature from working, but does not cause device crash or total unavailability.
rows.R&D Comment: Launcher code has been updated and fix to prevent NameNotFoundException when loading application info in widget list

rows.Title: No Compatible display error occurs while trying to connect via dex
rows.Problem: Here is the screen recording you asked
rows.Summarized Problem: A display compatibility error occurs when attempting to connect via Samsung DeX.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial failure in connectivity during DeX setup, preventing successful display connection but not causing device crash or data loss.

rows.Title: Unable to Set Routine Wallpaper
rows.Problem: Unable to set routine-based wallpaper in the Modes & Routines app, despite multiple attempts and troubleshooting steps including app updates, restart, and permission checks.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot set a routine-based wallpaper in the Modes & Routines app.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing or not functioning properly, preventing users from setting routine-based wallpapers, but the device remains usable overall.
rows.R&D Comment: Corrections have been applied to U OS Wallpaper & Style app 2.5.29 version. Users are advised to clear app data via Settings > Apps > Show system apps: ON > Wallpaper and Style > Storage > Clear Data.

rows.Title: Can't open RINGTONES to change it
rows.Problem: I did everything you said But I m still facing the same issue Can't open RINGTONES to change it
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot open the ringtones settings to change their sound settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from changing their ringtones, which is a core functionality in settings, but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Fixed with commit id a3603c2d8e9abab65545a5b9c6142f500019a680 for master branch. NullPointerException was thrown while accessing internal routine. Prevention code added and delivered with V OS deployment.

rows.Title: Lag and frame drops while playing game
rows.Problem: Lag and frame drops during gameplay, with slow touch responses
rows.Summarized Problem: Game experiences lag and frame drops with slow touch responses during gameplay.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes noticeable performance degradation during gameplay, making the device unusable for gaming activities.
rows.R&D Comment: Please help to reproduce issue again, take screen record and log right after issue occurs.

rows.Title: Unable to upload images to any website using chrome browser
rows.Problem: Images are greyed out and unable to select images or files to upload. Download manager shows download unsuccessful for files and PDFs from any app.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot select or upload images in Chrome browser, and file downloads via native download manager fail.
rows.Severity Reason: Partial functionality failure in media upload and file download, but device remains usable.
rows.R&D Comment: We are unable to reproduce the issue. Further analysis is difficult without timely logs and reproduction. Requesting user to clear app data and retry on stable network.

rows.Title: Video in YouTube going back to portrait after leaving landscape
rows.Problem: Video in YouTube goes back to portrait mode when leaving landscape orientation and re-entering the app, despite being set to landscape.
rows.Summarized Problem: YouTube video playback resets from landscape to portrait orientation when the user leaves and re-enters the app.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes inconsistent behavior in video playback orientation, affecting user experience but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The root cause is unclear from logs; if the issue persists, further investigation with logs is needed.

rows.Title: Wallpaper frozen when phone is completely open
rows.Problem: Wallpaper is frozen when phone is completely open and restores when opened or closed
rows.Summarized Problem: The wallpaper freezes when the phone is fully open and returns to normal when the phone is opened or closed.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent display behavior but does not prevent device usage or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: No further OS VER 14 release planned. Please check issue on latest OS VER 15 and update accordingly.

rows.Title: phone got automatically reset
rows.Problem: My phone was getting reset multiple times from last 2 days, up to 30 to 40 times, while opening and using the phone.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone is experiencing frequent automatic resets, up to 30 to 40 times in two days, while in use.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is repeatedly resetting, which renders it unusable and indicates a critical system failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Hardware defects such as AP can cause these problems. It is necessary to check for hardware defects.
